loans.name: Flor De Marina

texts.es:
Flor, de 40 años de edad, tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la universidad y es licenciada en administración de empresas, está casada y su esposo se dedica al comercio, tienen dos hijos, que están estudiando y además con ella viven sus padres. 

Flor, tiene una pequeña librería frente a una escuela, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 5 años, se dedicó a esta actividad, porque vive frente a la escuela y observo que este seria un negocio rentable.- Además, tiene negocio de sastrería y una tienda que está en la misma casa; en el negocio de la tienda se involucra su esposo y en la sastrería su papá.- Todo el trabajo que realizan lo hacen diariamente de 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 4:00 de la tarde y además, ha iniciado a trabajar en un supermercado, desde hace 5 meses.

Flor, está solicitando este préstamo para comprar tres docenas de útiles para la librería y comprar golosinas, gaseosas, galletas y dulces para la tienda.- 

Ella espera que con sacrificio y trabajo, puede poner un cyber café, de esta manera obtendrá más ingresos y podrá pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Flor, 40, had the opportunity to go to university and has a degree in business administration. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. She has two children, who are currently studying, and she also lives with her parents.

Flor has a small bookshop in front of a school. She has had this business for 5 years, and she decided to start this business because she lives in front of a school and she realised that it would be a profitable business. She also has a tailor's shop and another small shop in the same house. Her husband runs the small shop, and her father runs the tailor's shop. All of the work they undertake is done from 7am to 4pm. Flor also works in a supermarket, which she started doing 5 months ago. 

Flor is asking for this loan in order to buy three dozen sets of school supplies for the bookshop, and to buy lollipops, soft drinks, biscuits and sweets for the shop. 

She hopes that with work and by making sacrifices, she can open a cyber-café, and in this way earn more money so that she can send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy three dozen sets of school supplies for the bookshop, and to buy lollipops, soft drinks, biscuits and sweets for the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, hardware products and propane gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plantain in order to make plantain chips, and to begin selling sweets.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en: A 61-year-old woman, Asuncion earns a living through her sari-sari (general store) business. The mother of five adult children has been in the business for more than 20 years now. Asuncion would like to take out a loan to buy more stock for her store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda, other beverages, biscuits, toiletries, soap, candies, cleaning agents, bread and snack foods. Through this loan, Asuncion will be able to improve her stock, thus attracting more customers to her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Juan Aguirre

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS SOLIDARIOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Juan  es albañil y continua  trabajando  en forma independiente, el socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Juan is a member of the communal bank 'Los Solidarios' [The Supportive Ones]. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, in Urubamba province, Cusco. 

Juan is a self-employed builder, and he is a responsible, diligent person. He wants to continue working in this way in order to go on supporting his family. He is grateful for this loan and he promises to make the repayments on time. 

Juan is asking for a loan to buy construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Dinah's Group

texts.en:
Dinah, featured in the above picture, is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is 42 years old, a married mother of six children, and often described as a very hard-working individual. 

Although Dinah has been a farmer for 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Dinah wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Dinah hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of eight solar lights, as some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package (although Dinah has decided not to).

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Seam's Group

texts.en: Seam is a 61-year-old woman with three children from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is still dependent on her. To improve her family’s living, she grows rice as their main source of income. This is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She fully repaid her previous loan and now she is leading the group of three to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide, fertilizer and seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can earn more income and provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, fertilizer and seed to support her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El socio Emilio continúa en el banco comunal “Los Solidarios” .
El socio continua con su negocio de artesanía, él socio continua  elaborando tejidos como chompas, guantes, mantas en base de lana de alpaca, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al, empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de lanas entre otros.
texts.en: Emilio continues in the “Los Solidarios” communal bank and making crafts. He continues working in weaving such things as sweaters, gloves and blankets out of Alpaca wool. He has been working in this business for a good time, and he is doing very well thanks to his daily hard work. He wants to keep on working to support his family. He is requesting a loan to buy wool, among other things.

loans.use: to buy wool, among other things.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
Aldo es un hombre de 35 años de edad, casado, tiene 1 hijo varón de 13 años y una hija mujer de 11 años, y su negocio es la producción y venta de estuco.
Él es buen padre, emprendedora, dedicado a su trabajo, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Vichaya’  ubicada al oeste del río Desaguadero, esta área cuenta con variedad de materiales para ser explotados, se trabaja con yeso y estuco, minerales que son exportados en favor de las comunidades. En la ganadería se cría a camélidos, donde la especie de la alpaca resalta con una alta calidad en comparación a otros sectores, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados. 
Aldo es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la realiza junto a su esposa que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y cuenta con energía eléctrica, para obtener agua debe desplazarse hasta el riachuelo a 10 minutos del lugar. Su negocio es la producción y venta de estuco; la producción comienza desde la extracción de la roca hasta su pesaje y embolsado, todo el proceso se realiza de forma manual, en esta actividad también contrató un ayudante. La venta la realiza por mayor a casas y edificios en construcción, cuenta con un vehículo propio para transportar su estuco. “inicie mi actividad hace más de 7 años como empleado, hace 5 me independicé y trabajo independientemente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con un transporte para realizar las entregas de estuco en cualquier parte de la ciudad, la desventaja es la falta de agua del lugar. Su sueño es explotar en mayor cantidad y comprar un camión para transportar en mayor cantidad, el desea realizar la compra de leña y combustible para explotar el estuco. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Aldo solicita un préstamo para la compra de leña y combustible para explotar estuco en mayor cantidad y comprar un camión.
texts.en:
Aldo is a 35-year-old married man with a 13-year-old son and an 11-year-old daughter. His business is the production and sales of stucco.

He is a good father, entrepreneurial, dedicated to his work, responsible, and hardworking. He operates his business in the 'Vichaya' community, located west of the Desaguadero River. This area has a variety of materials to be exploded. Work is done with gypsum and stucco, minerals which are exported to support the community. Camelidos are raised in the ranching industry, and the species of alpaca here stands out from other areas due to it high quality. The weather is cold and dry, and the temperature varies during the day between 0 and 12 degrees centigrade.

Aldo is dark-skinned with short black hair, brown eyes, a short stature, and a thin physical build. His native language is Aymará which he speaks at home, and he also speaks Spanish for general purposes and in his business. He lives his life along with his wife who makes a living in the same business as him, and with his children who study at school. They live in their own home built from adobe with a corrugated iron roof, and they have electricity. To get water, they have to go to a stream 10 minutes away from their home.

Aldo's business is the production and sales of stucco. The production includes the extraction of the rock and the weighing and packaging. The entire process is done manually, and in this area he has hired a helper. The product is sold at wholesale for the construction of homes and buildings. Aldo has his own vehicle to transport the stucco. "I began in my occupation 7 years ago as an employee. Five years ago, I became independent and now I work independently..." says Aldo. The advantage of his business is that he has transportation to make deliveries of stucco in any area of the city. The disadvantage is the lack of water in his home. His dream is to explode stucco in greater quantities, and buy a truck to transport it in greater quantities. He would like to buy firewood and fuel in order to explode stucco. This is Aldo's first loan with the institution in the 5 years he has been working independently in this occupation.

For these reasons, Aldo is requesting a loan to buy firewood and fuel in order to explode stucco in greater quantities and to buy a truck.

loans.use: to buy firewood and fuel in order to blow up stucco in greater quantities and to buy a truck.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La socia Maria Teresa continúa en el banco comunal “Los Solidarios”.
La socia continua elaborando  cuadros de pintura, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas al oleo entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: María Teresa continues in the “Los Solidarios” communal bank and manufacturing paintings. She has been working in this business for years, and she is doing very well thanks to her daily hard work. She wants to keep on working to support her family. She is requesting the loan to buy oil paints, among other things. She is grateful for the loan, and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy oil paints, among other things.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 31-year-old man from Kisumu. He supports three people in his family; his children are 8, 5 and 2 ½ years old.

He operates a motorcycle transport business, which he has done for the last six years, generating a monthly income of KES 20,000.

He is taking his first loan with VISIONFUND KENYA, which he will use to purchase another motorcycle. He will use the anticipated income to plow back into the business and educate his kids.

His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motobike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase animal feed, poultry vaccines, add more poultry, and farm bulding materials

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 11 years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to buy wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat to sell

loans.name: Asatur

texts.en:
Asatur has been providing Soviet car repair work in Malishka village since early 2008. He lives with his wife and son. Asatur's son helps him with the work. They specialize in Soviet car production repair. 

To be able to purchase some tools which will greatly improve their work, Asatur has applied for this loan. He needs a loan to purchase a welding machine, a set of tools and a mitre saw needed for providing auto repair service. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a welding machine, a set of tools and a mitre saw needed for providing auto repair service

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 51-year-old Palestinian Refugee, a married father to eleven children. He has been working in the construction business, specialized in cement work for 37 years.

Saleh lives and works in a Palestinian camp, and is working hard to develop his business to make sure he can provide his beloved large family with the necessary living needs and education for his children who are still seeking education.

Saleh has been an Al Majmoua borrower for five cycles; his previous loans were invested in developing his business through buying updated tools and requested materials.

Today, Saleh's requested loan will be invested in buying necessary requested building needs to continue building his son's house. He hopes he stays capable of supporting his children and helping them to take their own lives forward.

loans.use: To buy building materials to continue building his son's house.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula, de 64 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está soltera y tiene 3 hijos, pero actualmente solo 1 depende directamente de ella.

Paula, se dedica a vender joyas de enchape.

Ella necesita el dinero para comprar joyas enchapadas.

Paula, sueña con ampliar su negocio y que su familia tenga lo necesario.
texts.en:
Paula is 64 years old, and she studied in school through the second grade. She is single and has 3 children, but currently only 1 of them depends directly on her.

Paula makes a living selling gold-plated jewelry, and she needs money to buy more gold-plated jewelry. Paula dreams of expanding her business, and she dreams that all of her family's needs are met.

loans.use: to buy gold-plated jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Medrine

texts.en:
Medrine is a 28-year-old greengrocer living in Voi, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children whose husband provides additional income to support the family. She has been in this business for the last six years and it has been profitable.

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she has been paying back her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to purchase mangoes, vegetables, onions and potatoes to sell to her customers and increase her income which will enable her to educate her children. 

In future she hopes to expand her business and open a restaurant business.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes, vegetables, onions and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is forty-nine years old. She is married with nine children. She runs a greengrocery business and has been in business for twenty-four years. Her monthly income is eighteen thousand Kenya Shillings.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase onions, potatoes, cabbages and tomatoes to sell. 

She plans to use the profits to improve the standard of living of her family and to educate her children. In future she aspires to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: To purchase onions, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Maa Byaghra Devi Group-A

texts.en:
In 2014, two women from a village of Boudh district stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their family and formed a group named Maa Nyaghra Devi Group-A. The members of this group are both women. One of them is Mrs. Sasika, who was selected as their featured borrower for this loan. 

The lady standing left in the photo is Sasika. Sasika is 28 years old and is living with her husband and her 4-year-old son. Her husband has been involved in vegetable and paddy farming for a long time. She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her husband, so she gathered Anita and told her about her plan. Anita liked her idea and appreciated her. Sasika took the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. She took some land for lease and started vegetable cultivation on a small scale. She started with a limited supply of vegetables like tomatoes and potatoes and grew to sell more than seven varieties like cucumbers, beans, carrots, and radishes. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village as she sells fresh and high-quality vegetables. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

Now Sasika has a new idea of doing sugarcane cultivation, for which she has requested a loan to utilize for the resources necessary to do sugarcane cultivation. A portion of the loan amount will help her to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: to pay for resources like sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides for her sugarcane plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has been engaged in hog-raising business for more than 12 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Marilou is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. Marilou dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for her children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is 28 years old, married to Milicent and blessed with three children. He has been in a dairy business for the last five years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 11,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to buy a cow to enable him get school fees to educate his children.

His plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and start a retail shop. His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
32-year-old Vahe is a constructor from Achajour village. He lives with his wife and two kids (ages 4 and 3 years old). 

Vahe provides different type of construction work: cosmetic repair and interior design, roofing, tiling and electrical installation. He works hard to cover his family's growing daily needs. 

To be able to purchase rotary hammer drill and lasering device, Vahe has applied for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a rotary hammer drill and lasering device for interior design of houses.

loans.name: Maxilinda

texts.en:
Maxilinda is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown children from Leyte, Philippines. 

She is engaged in a hog raising business. 

Maxilinda is requesting to take a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yucca, flour, corn, oil, and other ingredients to make her products.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, de 67 años, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casado y su esposa trabaja en una pequeña tienda que tienen en su casa; tiene dos hijos, pero no dependen económicamente de él aunque vivan en su casa.

José, trabaja en una empresa de seguridad como vigilante y tiene una tienda en su casa.

Él, necesita el crédito para comprar producto para surtir la tienda.

Y sueña con tener una tienda más grande y que sus ingresos mejoren.
texts.en:
Jose is 67 years old and studied until the 5th grade. He is married and his wife works in the small store that they run from their house. They have 2 sons who don't depend on him economically even though they live in his house. 

Jose works in a security company as a security guard and has a store in his house. 

He needs to loan to buy products to stock the store. 

His dream is to have a bigger store and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy products to stock his store.

loans.name: Maa Byaghra Devi Group-B

texts.en:
Ketaki, the lady standing first from right is a 45-year-old woman. She started a snack and tea stall in her house, which is located quite close to the market. She cooks and sells local snacks and tea in the mornings and evenings, the general hours for such a business. She sells pan on a small scale during the rest of the day to fill her day and support her income. She hopes for a bright future for her children. 

With the seven years of experience in running the shop, she wants to expand her business to meet customer demand. She needs a loan of 12,000 INR for each member and she will use her portion to buy some utensils and stock up on raw materials like besan and oil for cooking her snacks, as well as buy new products like packaged snacks and wafers to stock in her betel shop. She also plans to buy some furniture to seat her customers as she sees an increase in her customer base. 

She says that the increased cash flow can change her life and provide better education to her children.

loans.use: to pay for benches to seat her customers and to buy utensils and raw materials like besan and oil in bulk for her snack stall.

loans.name: Jose Silverio

texts.es:
José, de 67 años, no estudio, está casado y su esposa le ayuda en el trabajo que tienen en su casa que es un molino y una pequeña tienda, tienen dos hijos, pero ninguno depende económicamente de él.

José, trabaja en la agricultura, la ganadería, tiene un molino y una pequeña tienda desde hace muchos años.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar productos de la canasta básica para su tienda.

Él, sueña con tener un negocio  más grande.
texts.en:
José, 67 years old, did not go to school, is married and his wife helps him in the work he has in his house which is a mill and a small store, they have two children, but neither one depends on him economically.

José works in agriculture, ranching, has had a mill and a small store for many years. 

José needs the loan to purchase products from the basic food basket for his store. 

He dreams of having a bigger business.

loans.use: to purchase products from the basic food basket for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the living conditions in her humble house and to live in a healthier and cleaner environment.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a 54-year-old married woman living in Ormoc City, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business in her place. Prudencia has been in the business for more than nine years now. 

Prudencia is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, toiletries, bread and snack foods, soap and detergents, cooking oil and condiments. This loan will allow Prudencia to improve her inventories thus attracting more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Myrisia

texts.en:
Myrisia is a sari-sari or grocery store owner from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is 53 years old, married, and has been in the business for more than six years now.

Myrisia sells various goods to the people in her place. As of now, she is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments and cooking oil, bread and biscuits.

A loan will help her improve her stock, thus allowing her to cater to more buyers in her store. Myrisia hopes to expand her store in the future in order to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments and cooking oil, bread and biscuits.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc City, Leyte. 

Rosemarie has been engaged in a hog-raising business for several months now. Rosemarie is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog-raising business as well as her income. 

In the future, Rosemarie hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Zilzilamo

texts.en:
Zilzilamo is a hardworking and capable woman. She was born in a small town in 1972. She is married and has four children. Her husband is an emigrant. 

She tries to support her husband and does her own business. She trades women clothes in the domestic market. She imports from the capital to her small town. 

Now she is planning to open a new business of selling textiles. It would help to get additional income to feed her family and support her husband. She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy the first collection of textiles for the new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy textiles for a new business.

loans.name: Bramwel's Group

texts.en:
Bramwel is a 54-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing his group of 14 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Bramwel has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Bramwel described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Bramwel’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Jane has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Jane also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Jane's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the leader of his group. Joseph is representing his group of ten farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Joseph has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light for his children to be able to study during the dark hours. 

With the profits from this coming season, Joseph is planning to buy a cow.

A total of 5.25 acres will be planted by Joseph's Group, and between them they will receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina tiene 57 años de edad, es casada, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge en una comunidad que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito son personas amables que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas corporales, shampoos, entre otros, se dedica a este negocio desde hace más de 03 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia y con clientes fijos quienes dan buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Justina espera ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Justina is 57 years old, is married and lives in her own house with her partner in a community which is located in the Cayalti district of the Chiclayo province in the Lambayque region of northern coastal Peru. The inhabitants of this district are friendly people who make a living working in farming, breeding animals and commerce. 

For the past 3 years Justina has made a living selling beauty products like perfume and shampoo etc. She is experienced in this business and has regular clients who give her good personal and work references. 

She will use the loan to buy a bigger quantity of beauty products to increase the stock in her business. By doing this she hopes to offer a better variety of products to her clients which will make her a better profit and allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a bigger quantity of beauty products to increase the stock in her business.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba, de 57 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica al transporte de carga en camión, tiene 4 hijos y dos de ellos están casados y solo viven con ella dos.

Alba, se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace cinco años, ella quizo ayudar a su pareja a cubrir las necesidades de la casa y fue por esa razón que decidió colocar su negocio de tortillas; su hija también le ayuda.- Venden tortillas desde las 8:00 de la mañana, hasta las 3:00 de la tarde.

Alba, utilizara el préstamo para terminar de construir dos cuartos en su casa, porque no pudo terminar de construir.

Ella sueña con tener una casa grande, donde sus hijos la puedan visitar y estar cómodos, ya que donde vive es pequeño y tiene mucho que mejorarle.
texts.en:
Alba is 57 years old and she has a partner who makes a living transporting cargo in a truck. She has 4 children, 2 of whom are married, and so only 2 of them live with her. She didn't study.  

Alba has been making a living selling tortillas for five years. She wanted to help her partner cover the household expenses and so she decided to start up her tortilla business. Her daughter also helps her. Then sell tortillas from 8:00 am until 3:00 pm. 

Alba will use the loan to finish constructing two rooms in her house because she hasn't been able to finish the construction as yet. 

Her dream is to have a big house where her children can visit her and feel comfortable because where she lives at the moment is small and needs a lot of improvement.

loans.use: to finish constructing two rooms in her house because she hasn't been able to finish the construction as yet.

loans.name: Jerita's Group

texts.en:
Jerita is 74 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by nine farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Jerita has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Jerita also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Jerita's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Satyasai Group-A

texts.en:
Sanjulata, the lady standing in middle in the photo, is a 39-year-old mother living with her husband and two children in a small village of Boudh district of Odisha, India. 

She has been involved in the carpet-making business for the past 10 years. She gets materials from a dealer and supplies the finished goods to the same dealer for which she gets the labour cost. It takes one month to knit one carpet, working four hours a day. She sells one carpet in a month and earns 2,500 Indian rupees (INR) for one carpet (the price of the carpet depends on its size). 

She needs a loan of 12,000 INR to purchase her own materials for making carpets, i.e., wool and thread, so she can sell them in the market directly to the retailers. This way she can earn more as she can get the actual selling price for the carpet. She also plans to use a portion of the loan to buy the  materials necessary for making incense sticks. She plans to divide her time between making carpets and incense sticks. She will sell these incense sticks to shops in the nearby village market. 

Going forward, she hopes to grow this business and hire two additional staff to help her manage the business and create a living for other women like her in the village.

She, along with her group, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR.

loans.use: to buy materials for making carpets and incense sticks.

loans.name: Damaris's Group

texts.en:
Damaris is a 30-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of seven farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Damaris has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Damaris described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Damaris’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
Naim is a member of the Romani Albanian community in the country. He is married and has two children, 16 and 18 years old.

He and his wife have been making draperies and linens from raw fabric materials that they have been importing from Pakistan. This has been their activity for the past ten years, and they have mostly made these items on demand for hotels and restaurants. Sometimes they sell a few pieces as well to a few stores in the city.

Here is what Naim said in the interview: “I have been a bit assertive in advertising our work, going everywhere with some fabric samples and also finished items, and this has had a good outcome. We have three machines at home, for me and my wife to use. I have had also a little vehicle that I’ve been using for my activity, but now it broke down and I need to fix it.”

loans.use: to repair the vehicle that he uses for his tailoring activity.

loans.name: Maa Byaghra Devi Group-C

texts.en:
Naas, the lady standing in the middle in the photo, is a 40-year-old woman living with her husband, parents-in-law, and two children in a small village of Boudh district of Odisha, India.

She has a goat farm in which she currently has ten goats. She purchases goat kids and sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they grow. It takes 8 to 9 months for her to raise and sell them. She goes out in the morning to leave the goats for grazing in the fields and returns by noon. She then helps her husband in the farming activities and then resumes taking care of her goats by feeding them at home. Her children assist her in selling and maintaining these goats.

In this way, she is earning to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities. She says that there is a lot of demand during the months of April-July and October-December, the auspicious times for Indian weddings. Currently, she is not able to meet the demand during these months and other peak-demand times.

She, along with her group, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase some more goat kids to be able to sell more and seize the opportunity during this peak-demand period, as well as to construct a shelter for the goats to protect them from the rain.

loans.use: to enhance her business and to construct a shelter to protect her goats from the rain.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1992. She is living in remote district and with her parents. She is divorced. 

She is a sewer and sews traditional women's dresses. Two years ago she started this business. She also challenged women who suffered in her young life. 

The house where she lives is in bad condition. She wants to renovate her house and help her parents. She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy construction materials. She awaits your mercy and hopes to be helpful to her parents.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 43-year-old married mother of four children. She works hard to support her beloved husband in covering their family's increasing living needs with her shoe-selling business, which she established in 2011.

Zeinab has a diversified shoe inventory covering women's, children's, and men's needs, to make sure that whole families' needs are found in one place to ease customers' demands and offer convenience.

Today, Zeinab is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her men's shoes collection with newly released spring and summer items.

Her future goal is to open a family clothing shop that can meet whole families' needs at one time.

loans.use: To increase her men's shoes collection with newly released spring and summer items

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She is from Ormoc City, Leyte.

Rosalina has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than eight years now. This is the source of her income. Rosalina is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help Rosalina in improving her business as well as her income.

In the future, Rosalina dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc City, Leyte. 

Evangeline has been engaged in a hog-raising business for several years now. This is the source of her income. 

Evangeline is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy animal feed. This loan will help Evangeline to improve her hog-raising business as well as her income. 

In the future, Evangeline hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and animal feed.

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dinora, de 43 años de edad, no estudió, es madre soltera de dos niñas, en su casa vive el papá de Dinora. 

Dinora, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales de elote, esto lo aprendió desde niña, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela.- También hace tamales de pollo y pisques, esto lo hace cada tres días.- Ella compra la materia prima en la ciudad, a unos 10 kilómetros de su casa, específicamente compra una red de elotes de 6 canastos (300 elotes) y paga taxi para llevarlos hasta su casa. 

Dinora, necesita el préstamo para comprar un ternero y cubrir gastos personales para el estudio de sus hijas y también para capital de trabajo en su negocio de tamales.- 

Ella espera que sus hijas tengan los recursos necesarios, para estudiar hasta la universidad y sean profesionales y tengan mejores condiciones a futuro.
texts.en:
Dinora, 43 years old, did not study. She is a single mother of two daughters. In her home lives Dinora’s father.

Dinora makes a living from the production and sale of corn tamales. She learned this trade as a child since she did not have the opportunity to go to school. She also makes chicken and bean tamales, which she makes every three days. She buys the primary materials in the city, which is about 10 kilometers from her home. She specifically purchases a net of 6 baskets of corn (300 ears of corn) and pays a taxi to bring them to her home.

Dinora needs the loan to purchase a calf and to cover personal expenses for her daughter’s studies, and also for work capital in her tamale business.

She hopes that her daughters have the necessary resources to study until the university and that they become professionals, and that they have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and to cover personal expenses for her daughters' studies.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 32 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y un hijo de 6 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de Santo Tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café variedad catimore, esta actividad la realiza hace cinco años en terreno propio por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este sector y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de piña, maíz y menestras y a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes y cerdos. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto Jaime espera ofrecer un mejor café a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 32 years old. He has a stable home with his common law wife and 6 year old son. He lives in his own home made of rustic material, in a rural location in the Santo Tomas district, located in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. He lives in a small community who works primarily in agriculture and livestock.

He works in agriculture, mainly growing coffee of the Arabica Catimore variety. He has been doing this for the past 5 years in his own plot of land, thus he has experience in this field. He has good personal and professional references from his neighbors. In addition, he grows pineapples, corn, grain legumes, and raises small animals such as hens, guinea pigs, and pigs. The loan will be used to buy manure and fertilizers to provide maintenance for his coffee crop. With this, Jaime hopes to offer a better coffee to his clients, which will have a positive impact and will improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to provide maintenance for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Grupo Las Marias 2 Group

texts.es:
Lilian es una mujer de 46 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de 4 hijos de las edades entre 20 y 23 años, viven en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Lilian (es la segunda del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa para damas y niños, este pequeño negocio lo tiene ella desde hace  4 años desde su casa.
Para Lilian mejorar su negocio es su mayor sueño, por tal motivo ella dese hace algún tiempo había decidido incrementar su mercadería, pues ahora la gente necesita de mucha ropa moderna, pero una de la limitaciones que Lilian tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder realizar esta inversión es  por eso que se ha unido a un grupo de personas, para solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá comprando más ropas, como pantalones, blusas, faldas.
El gran anhelo de Lilian es hacer de su pequeño negocio algo más grande.
texts.en:
Lilian is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and has a lovely family of 4 children of the ages between 20 and 23 years old. They live in a community of Suchitepéquez.

Lilian (she is the second from the left side of the photograph), to generate an income and to maintain her family, makes a living from the purchase and sale of clothing for women and children. She has had this small business for 4 years and works out of her home.

For Lilian, improving her business is her greatest dream. For this reason, for some time she has decided to increase her merchandise since now people need a lot of modern clothing, but one of the limitations that Lilian has is that she cannot count on enough money to be able to carry out this investment. It is because of this that she has brought together a group of people to be able to request a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of more clothing, such as pants, blouses, and skirts.

Lilian’s greatest desire is to make her small business larger.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Gubkatimali - Lamashegu Group

texts.en:
Amina is a 35-year-old hardworking woman from Lamashegu in the Northern region of Ghana. Amina is married and has three children. Amina is the individual pictured with her hand raised among members squatting.

Amina is a member of a parboiled rice processing group that has been in business for the last three years. The name of the group is ‘Gubkatimali - Lamashegu’. She earns a good profit from the business because the group has been trained to process high quality parboiled rice for the Ghanaian local markets by Grameen Ghana.

Amina and ‘Gubkatimali - Lamashegu’ group have asked for a loan of GHS 18,900. Her share of the loan is GHS 700, which she would use to buy paddy rice for processing from rice farmers. 

Amina aspires to produce large quantities to supply the Ghana School Feeding Programme, earn more income to repay this loan and to support her family with food and educational expenses.

Amina thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing.

loans.name: Berbenitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BERBENITAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de candelabros, venta de mantas, venta de pañales, venta de comida, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, ya que hace varios años apoya en el negocio familiar, con el pasar del tiempo decide independizarse y emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Berbenitas” will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada regional hub. It is made up of nine members and is directed by a board of directors of which Margarita is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry out are varied. Among those exist: candelabra sales, blanket sales, diaper sales, food sales, clothing sales, and a neighborhood store.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small-business entrepreneurs like Margarita. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, joining through the invitation of a massive promotion from the institution that they carried out in her zone. Currently, she has a business selling clothing. She makes it known that she learned this business from her mother since for many years she supported the family business. With the passing of time, she decided to become independent and open her own business.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase of capital (the purchase of clothing wholesale) which she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz, which she will subsequently sell from her store. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is married and has three children.

When she is consulted about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru:
Женщину на фотографии зовут Рохат. Ей 52 лет. Она проживает в городе Худжанд. Худжанд еще называют северной столицей. Худжанд древний и красивый городок с высококультурным народом, который по сей день сохранил свою древнюю культуру, обычай и традиции. Рохат также является одной из жителей города, который способствует сохранению их культуры. Рохат на дому шьет "курпа" и "купача".
«Курпа» и «курпача» ватные матрасы. «Курпу» используют в качестве одеяло а «курпача» длинные матрасы используется как диваны. Курпу и курпачу дарят невестам как приданное. 
  Теплое время года наступает и начнется сезон свадеб. Рохат хочет воспользоваться моментом и увеличить товарооборот. Она на деньги от кредита приобретет ткани, вату, иголки, нитки швейные принадлежности и швейную машинку. На все это необходимы средства и из-за того что ей не хватает денег она обратилась за кредитом, с надеждой на то что ей не откажут в заемных средствах.
texts.en:
The woman in the photo is called Rohat. She is 52 and lives in the city of Khujand, which is also known as the northern capital. It is an ancient and beautiful city with highly cultured people who have to this day preserved their ancient culture, habits and traditions. Rohat is one of these residents who are helping to preserve this culture. She sews "kurpas" and "kupachas" at home. These are quilted mattresses, the former used as a type of blanket and the latter as seating. Both are given to brides as part of their trousseau.

The warmer part of the year is beginning and along with it the wedding season. Rohat wants to take the opportunity to increase her working capital. She will use the loan amount to purchase fabric, wadding, needles, thread, other sewing accessories and a sewing machine. Since she doesn't have the means to buy these things on her own, she is seeking a loan with the hope that she will not be turned away.

loans.use: to buy wadding, sewing needs and a sewing machine

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a small house. Ahmad has a store for selling and maintaining mobile phones. This is the only source of income for the family. Ahmad would like to improve his store and expand it in the future. Ahmad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his business. This will help him to organize his folders, and he will use it on the mobile software.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Idimoh

texts.en:
Idimoh is a young and beautiful woman. She was born into a family of workers in 1972. She is from the northern part of Tajikistan and lives in a remote district. She is married and her husband is an emigrant in Russia. She has two children. The money that her husband earns is not enough to keep a family. That is why Idimoh also runs a business to help her husband and feed her family. 

Idimoh has a retail business selling clothes and shoes. She has been busy with this activity since 2010. She has permanent clients who are satisfied with her business. She is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders to buy clothes and shoes because the new season is coming, which will increase the demand for her goods. 

Idimoh awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijas de 6 y 3 años, y su negocio es el tejido de enaguas.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘Senkata’ caracterizada porque su población en su mayoría son migrantes del altiplano, jóvenes en busca de nuevas oportunidades, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Sonia es de tez es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua nativa es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que efectúa. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijas; la mayor estudia en la escuela, la menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de enaguas tejidas con hilo; la enagua es una prenda de ropa interior femenina, se usa sobre la ropa interior íntima, bajo las polleras para conservar el calor. “inicié mi negocio tejiendo para mi madrina que fue la que me enseñó a confeccionar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que trabaja en su propio domicilio y puede cuidar a sus hijos que son pequeños, la desventaja es que no cuenta con clientes fijos y debe realizar la venta de forma ambulante. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de enaguas, ella desea refaccionar su taller porque en época de lluvias el agua entra y arruina las prendas. Esta es su 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Sonia solicita un préstamo para la refacción de su taller para que no entre agua y no se arruine su mercadería.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 31, lives with her life partner.  She has two daughters, ages six and three.  Her business is knitted petticoats.  She is a good mother, independent, enterprising, supportive, responsible, and very hard-working.  She conducts her business in the ‘Senkata’ area.  The area is known for its population, primarily immigrants from the highlands, young people seeking new opportunities, and the cold, dry climate with temperatures that vary between 0 and 12 degrees centigrade during the day.

Sonia has a dark complexion, long black, braided hair, and brown eyes.  She is short and thin.  She wears traditional clothing (a brimmed hat, shawl and a traditional skirt). Her first language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family.  She speaks Spanish with the general public and for her business.  She lives with her life partner, a construction worker, and with her daughters.  The oldest goes to school, and the youngest is not yet school age.  They live in their own house, which is made of brick and cement and has a roof of metal sheeting.  They have running water, electricity, gas for the house, and indoor plumbing.

Her business is making knitted ‘enaguas’ [petticoats].  The enagua is a women’s underwear garment that is used over the underwear and under the typical skirts that retain the heat.  “I started my knitting business for my Godmother, who was the one who taught me how to make things,” she says.  The advantage of her business is that she can work in her own house, and she is able to take care of her small children.  The disadvantage is that she does not have fixed customers, and she needs to sell in an itinerant manner.  Her dream is to open an enaguas store. 

She wishes to refurbish her workshop because water gets in during the rainy season, and it ruins the clothing.  This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the three years that she has been engaged in this business activity independently.

It is for these reasons that Sonia is requesting a loan to refurbish her workshop so that water does not get in and ruin her merchandise.

loans.use: to refurbish her workshop so that water does not get in and ruin her merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is 20 years old and a second-year student majoring in business administration. Sanaa choose this major because she believes it is in high demand within the labor market, and she hopes to find a job working in this field within a company or bank. Her family has faced some financial problems that have led Sanaa to request an education loan to cover her university fees and educational expenses.

loans.use: To cover her university fees and educational expenses

loans.name: Blerina

texts.en:
Blerina is a 39-year-old villager and a married mother of a 16 and 9 year old.

Blerina is seeking your financial help to buy pesticides and to pay for the agricultural land that she has rented from others since she doesn't own much of the land. 

She’s been photographed at the primitive greenhouse that she has built to plant the seeds to become seedlings. Blerina basically plants potatoes, corn and beans and she tries to sell almost all that she produces. 

“I try to sell all, because that is our only source of income, yet sometimes, it’s not possible to sell it. We try it both ways; selling to whole buyers and also at the market by ourselves,” said Blerina to the loan officer who interviewed her.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her seedlings and to pay for the land she rents from other villagers

loans.name: Shefikat

texts.en:
Shefikat is an Egyptian Albanian lady and a divorced mother of one; she lives in the city of Elbasan where most of her community lives. Under the Communist regime, members of this community were discriminated against. They lived very poorly, with some of them in the basements of apartment buildings and some in shacks, and unfortunately lacked basics such as nutrition and sanitation. Over the past 20-something years, their lives have improved somehow. 

Shefikat started to buy and sell used shoes about five years ago in an attempt to secure food because the $130/month that she was receiving as government assistance was not enough. She is requesting this loan from you in order to stock up on shoes to resell.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to resell

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed, 27 years old, is a father of two children who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He is the sole provider of his family. Many years ago, Mohammed completed his university education but now he is unemployed. Due to the high rates of the unemployment, he couldn't find a job to look after his family. 

He didn't give up, but applied for a loan of 1,200,000 YER from AMB to purchase a minibus in order to transport people inside the city. Working on the bus will help him to make money and solve a lot of his family's problems. 

Next year he plans to send his oldest child to a school, and he must provide him with a good educational environment. Mohammed will be able to take him school every morning, and come back to take him home again every afternoon. Also, Mohammed can cover the school fees for his child by purchasing the necessary tools that he needs in his studies. 

Notwithstanding he grew up in a humble and poor house, but he is an optimistic man who dreams that the bus will help him create a source of income for his children, and make a healthy environment for them. The hope came back again inside Mohammed because he believes that he will be an active and effective man in his society.

Mohammed looks forward to opening a commercial store in addition to working on the bus to provide his children with suitable living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a minibus

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is a 36-year-old married lady who has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Yasmin makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to increase the stock available for her customers. In this way, she will be able to meet increasing demand consistently. Yasmin wishes to utilize part of her revenues to provide a good quality of life for her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour to increase her stock

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel padre de familia honrado y trabajador, que agradece el apoyo brindado, pues él cuenta que antes su pequeño negocio no contaba con una diversidad de clases de bananos, pero ahora él ya cuenta con una variedad de bananos en su negocio, por lo que ha mejorado su clientela y sus ingresos han incrementado es por eso que logro comprar un terreno. 
Samuel con el afán de seguir superando ha tomado la decisión de solicitar nuevamente un crédito que lo invertirá comprando  una diversidad de bananos como de seda,  oro, morada, chocolate. 
El gran anhelo de Samuel es seguir incrementando su negocio, y poder construir su casa de block.
texts.en: Samuel is a family man, honest and hard working who is grateful for the help provided. He tells us that in the past he didn't have a diverse selection of bananas but currently he has a variety of bananas in his business which has improved his customer base. His earnings have increased, which helped him buy a plot of land. With the goal of continuing getting ahead, Samuel decided to ask for a new loan which will be used to buy a variety of bananas such as Cavendish bananas (most common variety,) gold, purple, chocolate. Samuel's biggest dream is to continue growing his business,  and to build his house out of cement blocks.

loans.use: To buy and sell bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy hibiscus flowers.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 30-year-old married woman who has run a milk-selling business for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes and sells their milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. 

Nasreen is a dedicated mother of five who wants the best for her children. She has taken many previous loans from Kashf Foundation. She is now requesting a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to increase her milk sales in order to earn a good amount of income and fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing her milk sales

loans.name: Agua Marina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUA MARINA” iniciará el décimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Carmen es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de fruta, servicio de limpieza, venta de cereales, venta de ropa, venta de carne, venta de polainas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Carmen es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida rápida; da a conocer que este negocio lo implementó hace varios años, aprendiendo la elaboración de estos productos al observar el mercado, así mismo comenta que para la implementación del mismo le ayudo su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo y aceite por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el ahorro que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Agua Marina” will begin its sixteenth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Alto Lima Regional Office. The group is made up of eight members and is directed by a board of directors, of which Carmen is the President. The communal bank’s members work in various businesses such as: food sales, fruit sales, cleaning services, grain sales, clothing sales, meat sales, and legging sales. 

The loan that they will take out will help the small entrepreneurs. Carmen is one of the members. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, joining after receiving an invitation from a huge promotion that the institution carried out in her area. Currently, she has a fast food business. She tells us that she started the business many years ago, learning to make the products by observing the market. She also comments that her mother helped her start the business.

The loan she is taking out is to increase her capital (to buy noodles and oil on wholesale), which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in La Paz. After she produces her merchandise, she will sell it in her storefront. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is single and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the lending and savings services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy noodles and oil on wholesale.

loans.name: Satyasai Group-B

texts.en:
Alaka, the lady standing in the middle in the photo, is a 47-year-old woman living with her husband, son, and daughter. She sells tea, biscuits, betel, and wafers in her shop, earning 2,000 Indian Rupees (INR) per month. Her son is a worker in a stone-crushing factory. Her son's job is to manually crush larger stones into smaller pieces with a hammer. These smaller pieces are then fed into a machine to make concrete.

Alaka wants to purchase a refrigerator to sell soft drinks and buy more stock and variety of biscuits, betel, and wafers, through which she says she can increase her sales and customer base as well. She also wants to buy some wooden furniture, like benches, to seat her new customers and keep her existing customers for a longer time at her shop and increase her sales.

A lot of meetings in the village happen over tea at shops like these, and having benches for customers to sit at her shop will enable her to get more of such customers and keep them for a longer time at this shop. This will increase her sales for tea and other merchandise as well.

Alaka, along with her group, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR for making these changes. With enough savings from the increased earnings, she can make her dream of building a concrete house come true.

loans.use: to buy wooden furniture to seat her customers, a refrigerator to keep soft drinks, and more biscuits, betel, and wafers for her shop.

loans.name: Maria Rosangela

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 60 años de edad, ella se encuentra desempleada, su historia es un poco difícil, quedo viuda y con 10 hijos a su cuidado, es realmente sorprendente como está mujer se sacrificó en hogares, haciendo alimentos mil y un cosas para generar el sustento a estos 10 hijos que alcanzo a tener.

Como inicialmente habíamos mencionado la señora María se encuentra desempleada y viene ante ustedes a solicitar un apoyo, para iniciar un negocio que será una tienda de abarrotes.

El negocio es pura necesidad y con el préstamo que se encuentra solicitando comprara estanterías y adecuara la sala de su casa para iniciar a vender, también parte del dinero será destino a surtir su negocio con productos de la canasta familiar.
texts.en: María is a 60 woman who finds herself unemployed. Her history is a bit difficult. She is a widow with 10 children under her care. It is really surprising how this woman sacrifices herself in homes, making meals and a thousand and one other thing to generate the sustenance for the 10 children she has. As mentioned María is unemployed and comes to you requesting support to start a business which will be a grocery store. This business is a simple necessity and the loan that she is requesting is to buy shelves and adapt the living room of her house to begin to sell. Part of the money will be used to stock her business with basic food items.

loans.use: to start a business and stop being an unemployed woman by opening a grocery store.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida, age 51, is a married woman and the mother of 2 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all of their household expenses, so she initiated her milk business. Zahida has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she is requesting a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. With the help of this loan, she hopes to increase her sales and earn greater profits in order to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo in order to increase her milk sales

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam is 34 years old and married. She has run a beauty parlor for many years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Over the time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family's income. 

As her business has grown over time, Shabnam has had to deal with more customers. She has applied a loan of 45,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. The loan will allow her to purchase combs, hair straightener, makeup kits, and cleansers for treating many customers at a time in order to earn more revenue for running her household activities efficiently. She is very experienced in her business and confident that it will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase combs, hair straightener, makeup kits, and cleansers

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is 50 years old and married. She is the mother of 4 children. She has been raising and selling animals for many years with the support of her husband. Through her business she is able to meet her household expenses. Razia has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LIBERTAD” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Carla es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de polleras, venta de verduras, venta de ropa, librería, venta de maíz pelado, venta e refrescos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Carla es integrante, ella indica que es la dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de librería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, por herencia de sus padres, ya que ella apoyaba desde niña, con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de material escolar por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “LIBERTAD” communal bank is starting their 3rd loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Patacamaya regional branch, It is composed of 8 members and is led by a board of directors with Carla as the president. The businesses of the members are varied, amongst them are: food sales, the sale of polleras (traditional skirts), selling vegetables, clothing sales, a bookstore, selling corn and selling soft drinks.

The loan that is being taken out will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs including Carla. She indicated that she joined Pro Mujer 2 years ago joining on the invitation of a massive promotion that the institution had in her area.

Her current business is a bookstore. She says that she learned this business a number of years ago as an inheritance from her parents as she helped them in the store since she was a child. With the passing of time she decided to open her own independent business.

The loan that she is now getting will be working capital (buying educational material wholesale) that she will acquire at the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and later sell in her commercial space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is single and has 3 children. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the training that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy educational material wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of vegetables, onions, tomatoes and fruit for her kiosk

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 29-year-old married man from a village near Hebron. He lives with his wife and four kids: two sons and two daughters. Raed has a store in the city where he sells fruits and vegetables. He buys his products from the local farmers.

Raed took a USD 1500 loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more crops from the farmers to sell in his store. With the loan, he hopes to increase his sales and also his income.

Raed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more crops to sell in his store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Hayri

texts.en:
Hayri is a businesswoman who has fourteen years practice of doing business. She trades nutritional products and has her own store. She sells grocery products at two domestic markets and also in her store. 

Additionally, Hayri has some kid’s clothes and toys in her assortment of goods. Hayri is a responsible, gentle, kind and hardworking person. She attracts a lot of satisfied clients. 

Hayri wants to enlarge her turnover and activity. She is planning to buy grocery products and is adding toys, napkins, socks and diapers to enlarge her assortment. 

Hayri has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy grocery products and an additional assortment of goods. She awaits your mercy.
