loans.use: To buy grocery products, toys, napkins, socks and diapers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 21-year-old single lady who lives with her family in Ajloun. Wafaa is in the third year of studying for her bachelor's degree in applied arts. She has a future plan to work in her field. Because of the financial problems faced by her parents, Wafaa has applied for an education loan to help cover the rest of her semester fees and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to cover the rest of her semester fees

loans.name: Mnyika

texts.en:
Mnyika is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mnyika has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of repaying creditors for goods taken on credit. 

Mnyika wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour with the loan that she is requesting. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Duaa

texts.en:
Duaa is a 22-year-old single lady living in Irbid. She is studying economics. Duaa is asking for the loan to pay her semester fees because her father's income is not enough to pay for her fees and spend on the household expenses. 

Duaa is an ambitious lady, and she is working hard to be a successful woman in the future.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees

loans.name: Ngaakom Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Ngaakom and are into the trade of rice, gari (cassava flour), underwear, detergents, cassava and corn dough, earrings, plates, diapers, sewing accessories, wigs, perming cream, shampoo and charcoal. They have been in the loan business with ID-Ghana for some time now and are very hardworking and extremely competent in their trades.

Cynthia is the group representative, and she is taking a loan from Kiva for the second time. She has been very instrumental in the creation of the group. She is in her sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and is standing second from the right in the photograph. She has been selling rice and gari (cassava flour) for 19 years. She is now 41 years old and married with one dependent child, and they are all living together in a family apartment. 

She and her colleagues will need GHS 6,300 to expand their businesses, and Cynthia will use her share of the loan to buy more rice and gari (cassava flour) to sell to customers. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more rice and gari (cassava flour) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Suglo Mali-Nyari-Lam Group

texts.en:
Adisah is a 60-year-old businesswoman from Lamashegu in the Northern region of Ghana. Adisah is married and has 10 children. She is the individual pictured with her hand raised among members sitting.

Adisah is a member of a parboiled rice processing group that has been in business for the last five years. The name of the group is ‘Suglo Mali-Nyari-Lam’. She earns a good profit from the business because the group has been trained on how to process high quality parboiled rice for the Ghanaian market by Grameen Ghana.

Adisah and ‘Suglo Mali-Nyari-Lam’ Group have asked for a loan of GHS 12,900. Adisah’s share of the loan is GHS 900, which she would use to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing. Adisah aspires to produce in large quantities in the future, to earn more income, to repay this loan, to support her family with food, and to pay school expenses for her children.

Adisah thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing.

loans.name: Yaqoob

texts.en:
For 25 years, Yaqoob has been running a school in his community. The secret to his success has been hard work and dedication to his cause. Yaqoob feels very strongly about the need to provide quality education to children in low-income communities. He has built his enrollment over years of hard work, and today there are over 250 children in his school, 50% of whom are girls. He has also invested in his 10 female teachers by training them himself. 

Yaqoob wants to continue his work and to do it better. He requires a loan of PKR 75,000 to purchase books and furniture and to buy a generator so that his students can study in well-lit rooms even when there is no electricity.

loans.use: to purchase books, furniture, and a generator for his students' use

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 26-year-old woman who has been running a school for two years. In these 2 years, Tahira says that she has learned the value of hard work. A young, educated woman herself, Tahira wants the same for the children in her community. She strives to give them the opportunity to follow their dreams. 

Today, there are over 100 boys and girls in the school. Tahira wants to make improvements to her school and provide better facilities for her students. She requires a loan of PKR 100,000 to purchase 50 chairs and to perform necessary repairs around the school building.

loans.use: to purchase 50 chairs and to perform necessary repairs around the school building.

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomas un hombre de 45 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre diez y veintinueve años, vive en una comunidad de Sololá. 
Tomas un padre de familia que se preocupa por las necesidades de su familia, y para generar sus ingresos él se dedica como ayudante de camioneta que trasporta a las personas de su comunidad, a otra circunvecina, él cuenta que gracias a este trabajo ha logrado sacar a delante a su familia.
Tomas ahora se ve a la necesidad de construir una cocina donde su esposa pudiera preparar con más comodidad los alimentos, pero una de las limitaciones de Tomas tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder construir su cocina por tal motivo solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, arena, piedrín y hierro.
El gran sueño de Tomas es terminar de construir su cocina antes de este año, para que su familia tenga una mejor lugar donde preparar sus alimento.
texts.en:
Tomas is a 45-year-old man. He is married and has a beautiful family with five children between the ages of 10 and 29. He lives in a community in Sololá. 

Tomas is a father who worries about the needs of his family. To generate income, he works as the assistant on a bus that transports the people from his community to another neighboring community. He says that, thanks to this job, he has been able to help his family get ahead. 

Now, Tomas is seeing the need to build a kitchen where his wife can prepare food more comfortably. However, one of the limitations that Tomas has is that he doesn’t have enough money to build the kitchen. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, and iron. 

Tomas’s biggest dream is to finish building his kitchen before this year ends, so that his family can have a better place to prepare food.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Wun-Nam  Bungalows Group

texts.en:
Zelihatu is a 55-year-old hard-working woman from Tamale, the capital of the Northern region of Ghana. She is married and has 4 children. Zelihatu is the individual pictured with her hands on the paddy rice.

Zelihatu is a member of a parboiled rice processing group that has been in business for the last 20 years. The name of the group is Wun-Nam Bungalows. She earns a good profit from the business simply because of the long-standing experience she has gained from the group in processing high-quality parboiled rice for the Ghanaian market.

Zelihatu and the Wun-Nam Bungalows group have asked for a loan of GHS 8,000. Zelihatu’s share of the loan is GHS 500, which will be used to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing. She aspires to produce in large quantities in the future in order to earn more income, repay this loan, support her family with foodstuffs, pay her health insurance premiums, and provide school uniforms for her children.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 35-year-old, hardworking lady. She deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family's income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 35-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his wife and one small daughter. Ayman works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also has a stall selling fruit and vegetables. He earns a good income from this job. 

Ayman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more crops from the farmers to sell ihis stall. This will increase his sales and also his income. 

Ayman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more crops from the farmers to sell in his stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvement to the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a perimeter wall around her house to guarantee her security and privacy.

loans.name: El Shaman Group

texts.es: Con la esperanza de incrementar el capital de trabajo y mejorar sus ingresos, solicitan por tercera ocasión el financiamiento en ADIM el grupo solidario “El Shaman”, quienes han demostrado ser personas responsables en sus cuotas y que saben administrar sus negocios, quien lo coordina es la señora Rosa que tiene la edad de 44 años, ella es propietaria de una pulpería además comercializa ropa de segunda y cosméticos, por medio de estos negocios busca mejorar sus ingresos y así aportar más a los gastos familiares, este negocio lo impulsó hace tres años con ayuda financiera de su compañero de vida, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado ampliar su negocio, lo que la ha motivado a seguir solicitando los financiamientos para su negocio, este financiamiento lo solicita para invertir en paca mixta de ropa, cosméticos y granos básicos. El resto de los integrantes son las señoras, Miriam que tiene la edad de 60 años y comercializa ropa de segunda en su comunidad desde hace cuatro años, Pastora de 52 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería por más de un año, y Eveling que tiene la edad de 26 años y es propietaria de una mini pulpería, además comercializa ropa de segunda. Estas mujeres han aprendido a sobrellevar los problemas para seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de sus familias.
texts.en: Hoping to increase work capital and improve their income, the solidarity group "El Shaman" is requesting a loan in ADIM for the third time. These are people who have shown they are responsible with their payments, and who know how to manage their businesses. The group is coordinated by Rosa, who is 44 years old. She owns a grocery store and also sells second-hand clothing and cosmetics. Through these businesses she wants to improve her income and help more with household expenses. She began this business three years ago with her life partner's financial support. With the previous loans, she was able to expand her business, what has led her to request another loan for it. With this loan she will buy bales of second-hand clothing, cosmetics and basic grains. The other members are Miriam, 60 years of age, who has sold used clothing in her community for four years; and Pastora, 52 years of age, who owns a mini grocery store and also sells second-hand clothing. These women have learned to overcome problems in order to keep improving the life conditions of their families.

loans.use: to buy bales of mixed used clothes, cosmetics and basic grains.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is thirty-three years old. He is married with five children. He does farming and has been operating for five years. He gets a monthly income of 28,000 Kenya shillings. 

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and expand his business. He plans to use the profits to improve the standard of living of his family. 


In future he wants to have a financially stable business.

loans.use: To purchase manure and seedlings

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 37-year-old and he has a tree nursery business. He is married to Mideva, who is also a business lady, and they have been blessed with 5 children. He also supports 7 people in his family. He has been running the tree nursery business for the last 9 years and it generates a monthly income of KES 16,000.

Jackson is requesting his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase tree seedlings and a wheelbarrow. This will enable him to plant more tree seedlings in a shorter time, as well as supply his customers, and thereby make more income. Jackson will use the anticipated profit to educate his children and expand his business by planting more varieties of trees.

His hopes and dreams are to have a successful tree nursery business and to be able to educate his children and build a good house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and a wheelbarrow to help him grow more tree seedlings to sell.

loans.name: Afsareen

texts.en:
Afsareen is a 27-year-old, married woman. She has three children. She, along with her husband (also shown in the photo), has been running a business of purchasing and selling animals. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. 

Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, health and clothing. In order to expand her earnings, Afsareen has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to buy more baby goats to sell to expand the business, and that will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats to sell to expand the business, and that will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 37-year-old married woman who is blessed with four children, and has been operating a clothing shop for a period of six years, earning herself an income of KES 10,000 by the end of every month.

Caroline is taking a loan of KES 45,000 and intends to buy additional shirts, trousers, blouses, dresses and sweaters to sell to her customers. She plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children, and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Thirty-five-year-old Annah does not possess a university degree, but as an accomplished farmer from the Kericho area of Kenya she commands a lot of respect. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming, and because of her immense knowledge, farmers flock to her home to seek technical advice on the best techniques.

Annah has identified free space on her farm that she wants to fully utilize by keeping a good-quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture, and milk prices have been going up in the recent past. Annah, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this trend. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure to boost the fertility of her farm. Selling her milk should never be a problem because there is a ready market, and she will also be selling to big dairy processing firms. 

Annah said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural loans, and their interest rate is low and is on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro-finance institutions. 

Annah hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting to offer services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. She hopes that this loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sherbano

texts.en:
Sherbano is a married woman and the mother of four children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) started a taxi driving business some time ago. He earns a good amount of income and needs some financial help to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the taxi. 

Therefore, Sherbano has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR for her husband. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the taxi.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is a 35-years-old married man from Nablus City. He lives with his wife and two daughters in a small house. His wife works as an employee in the public sector, where she gets a low income. Fares has a stall for selling fruits and vegetables. He earns a good income from this job. 

Fares Has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more crops from farmers to sell at his stall. This will increase his sales and also his income. 

Fares appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more crops from farmers to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa, une femme de 36ans a pour mari un déclarant en douane avec 04 enfants en charge. Deux d'entre eux sont scolarisés. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et revend en même temps des charbons de bois et du mais à domicile. Son premier crédit demandé à WAGES lui permettra d'acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle souhaite épargner le profit et assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en: Kossiwa, a 36 year old woman, is married to a customs officer and is responsible for 4 children. Two of them go to school. She is a hairdresser by trade and, at the same time, resells charcoal and corn from home.Her first loan requested from WAGES will allow her to buy products in order to respond to her clients' needs. She would like to save her profits and ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and corn

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is widowed and has five children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees. 

Florence sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for seven years, and she works six days a week. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major business challenges include transportation. She aspires to build rental houses someday.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a 32-year-old mother from the Kisimu region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Dickson, who is a businessman, and supports her family by providing income. She supports seven people in their family and has two children.

Sharon has a retail kiosk where she sells second-hand clothes - a business which has been operating for the last five years - and makes a monthly income of KES 13,000. She is taking her first loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which she will use to purchase more bales of second-hand clothes to earn more income to help her support the family. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business by opening another kiosk.

Her dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of second-hand clothes to earn more income to help her support the family.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 37-year-old man from Kisumu, a city in the western part of Kenya. He supports four people in his family. He has four children, who are 11, 8, 5 and 2 years old. 

Martin supplies water to his customers, and he has been in this business for the past four years. He generates a monthly income of KES 8,900. He is taking his first loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase another hand cart for water distribution. He hopes this will enable him to supply more water to his customers and earn more income. He will use the anticipated income to educate his children. His dream is to have a successful and stable business.

loans.use: To purchase another hand cart for transporting water

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a single woman with 2 children. She describes herself as caring. She operates a retail business where she sells plates and spoons. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital. 

Margret will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of plates, spoons, and other items. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a financially stable business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of plates, spoons, and other items

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is a 28-year-old woman from the city of Rustavi. She has a husband, who is employed at a private company and earns a fixed salary. Especially during her secondary education, Maka was unable to start any stable job. 

To take care of her family's increased needs, Maka has a great desire to start her own business and become financially independent. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make their livings. Maka decided to start a clothing trading business but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers before approving a loan. Maka’s previous credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy these requirements.

Maka has received the credit through a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Startup Program gives poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Maka will rent a place, which she has already found and is appropriate for her new business. She will also purchase stocks of used clothing to resell at a profit.

With the help of this loan, Maka will get the opportunity to generate her own income and contribute to the family's welfare. She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: To open a used clothing store

loans.name: Ibtesam

texts.en:
Ibtesam is a woman who is an example of the willpower of an ambitious lady. She is 28 years old and lives with her family in Rusaifeh. She is a conservative woman and asked her mom to take her place in the photo instead.

She wanted to help her family in any way; therefore she decided to start her business, which is a retail store for general products. Now Ibtesam has a good business where she can help her family with the household expenses form her income. Because she is very hungry for success, she wants to expand and develop her work. Because of that she has applied for a loan to buy more products and expand the work.

loans.use: To buy more products and expand the work.

loans.name: Sasmita

texts.en:
Sasmita is a 39-year-old lady. She lives with her husband, parents-in-law, and three children in a small village called Phulbani Sahi in Boudh district in Odisha, India. Her husband lost his vision in an accident.

Sasmita runs her terracotta business with the help of her father-in-law and her son. She learned this work in her childhood, as it is their family occupation. She makes earthen pots and statues of gods, and paints them. Her son helps her to supply those finished products to the dealers in the market.

She plans to expand her business, appoint new work staff to help her, and to own a shop in the marketplace for direct sale of the product to end customers. She needs a loan of 35,000 INR to buy more resources like paints, brushes, and ornaments for statues (statues of Indian Gods and Goddesses) and to set up her own shop in the market.

She wants to give her children a better education and let her family live a happy life.

loans.use: to pay for more clay and paints for her terracotta work and to set up her own shop in the market.

loans.name: La Tola N°1 Group

texts.es:
LETICIA. Tiene 22 años de edad, desde hace 2 años ella se dedica a la compra venta de Langostino, con el crédito anterior ella invirtió en la compra de este marisco, icopores para mantener fresco el producto y poder transportarlo.
En esta ocasión, ella invertirá en la compra de un congelador para mantener frescos los langostinos y así poder tener un poco mas de seguridad en que el producto se mantenga en buen estado.

ella vive con su abuela y una prima en una humilde vivienda; su abuela se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas y refrescantes, con las ganancias ella apoya para los gastos del hogar.

LETICIA, compra el Langostino a los pescadores y luego lo comercializa al por menor en su casa.

en la comunidad donde vive no cuentan con servicio de agua potable, tienen escuelas y un pequeño centro de salud.

desea en un futuro, poder comprar mucho langostino y así poder vender al por mayor, para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Leticia is 22 years old. For the past 2 years, she has made a living by buying and selling prawns. With the prior loan, she invested in buying this shellfish, as well as Styrofoam coolers to keep the product fresh and to be able to transport it.

This time, she will invest in a freezer to keep the prawns fresh. This way, she will be able to have a little bit more security because her product will stay in good condition. 

She lives with her grandmother and a cousin in a humble home. Her grandmother makes a living by selling soft drinks and other refreshments. With her earnings, she helps with the household expenses. Leticia buys the prawns from the fishermen and then markets them on retail in her house. 

In the community where she lives, they do not have potable water. They have schools and a small health center. In the future, she would like to be able to buy a lot more prawns and be able to sell on wholesale. This would allow her to have more earnings.

loans.use: to buy and sell prawns (large shrimp) on retail in her residence.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana does not want to give up on her dream in front of the challenges that she faces on her education journey. She lives in Irbid and she is a university student in her third year, majoring in Arabic Language.

Rana's dad works as a taxi driver, and his income barely covers the household expenses. He cannot pay the tuition fees for Rana, but she wants to complete her studies. Rana hopes to find good work with a good salary to help her family, therefore she has applied for an education loan to cover her semester fees and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To cover her semester fees and achieve her dreams.

loans.name: Ndifeamodzi Credit Group

texts.en:
Taliyesi is 36 years old and married. She has six children and looks after one orphan. They all rely on her for their daily needs. Taliyesi opened a restaurant so she could earn income for supporting her family by providing them with food and paying for her children’s education. 

Taliyesi will use her portion of the group's loan to buy commodities necessary for her restaurant. Before she started getting loans, she used to sell sugarcane, and these loans have helped her to expand her business into a restaurant. Her future plans are to buy a plot of land and build a house for her children.

Through the help of the loans that she has been obtaining in the past months, she is now able to provide clothing and food to her children.

loans.use: to buy maize, rice, and chickens

loans.name: Satyasai Group-C

texts.en:
Satyasai Group-C has three members who are all from the same neighborhood. The lady standing first from the right in the photo is Babita, who is the leader of the group.

Babita is 45 years old and married to a fisherman from a village in Boudh district in Odisha, India. Babita lives with her in-laws, and her husband takes care of all the household expenses. She helps her husband in selling fish.

Her husband goes to the lake every morning to fish, and she sells those fish in the market as fresh fish, and keeps some of them to dry and sell as dried fish. (Drying the fish is a way of preserving the fish for future use by drying them in the sun until the water is completely evaporated.) Demand for dried as well as fresh fish is very high in the region. All the members of this group are engaged in selling fresh and dried fish in the market.

In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demands, Babita and her group have requested a loan of 36,000 INR, from which Babita will use her portion to purchase fishing nets and storage boxes to keep fish. Their goal is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and storage boxes to keep fish.

loans.name: Famille Mugisho Group

texts.fr: Il y a 30 ans que Gaspard a été initié à la culture du café par son père. Il y a pris goût suite à sa rentabilité malgré que les charges scolaires de ses dépendants consomment la grande majorité de revenus et ne lui permettent pas d'atteindre d'autres projets. Pourtant, il estime pouvoir se construire une maison d'habitation et pose sur la photo avec son épouse.
texts.en: 30 years ago Gaspard was introduced to coffee farming by his father. He took a liking to this work because of its profitability even though his dependents' school fees use a large majority of the earnings and do not allow him to achieve other projects. However, he expects to be able to build himself a house and is posing in the picture with his wife.

loans.use: to pay the labour wages for harvest and for maintenance work

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a 36-year-old single lady who runs M-pesa services for her clients in Voi town. For the past year she has done this business and has earned great income.

This marks Edith's second time borrowing from Visionfund Kenya to finance her business.She will use the loan to increase her float (electronic credits to sell in her mobile money business), and the anticipated profit to open a second business selling phone accessories.

loans.use: to purchase float (electronic credits to sell in her mobile money business).

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 39 years old, and is a green grocer. He is married to Nancy and they are blessed with three children: Calle is 12 years old, Alfred Karuga is 7 years old and Grace Wambui is 4 years old. 

John has had a farming business for three years, earning a mothly income of 35,000 KES. He has borrowed 15,000 KES, his first loan, from VisionFund Kenya. He will be using the loan to purchase animal feed, a sprinkler, pesticides and fertilizer.  He hopes that the anticipated profits will help him to merge his agribusiness activities into one area, build a house on his new plot and repay his loan. 

John's hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable, flourishing agribusiness and to concentrate on planting cash crops for exporting and selling in local markets.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed, a sprinkler, pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 54-year-old female who is married. She has four children aged 18, 17, 14 and 10 years old who she supports. 

Margaret has been growing wheat and potatoes for seven years now. She is taking her seventh loan to purchase seedlings, fertilizers and other chemicals to use on her farm. She successfully repaid her previous loans.

Margaret will use the generated profit to expand her current business. Her hopes and dreams are to be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizers and other chemicals to use on her farm.

loans.name: Las Joyitas De Charapaqui Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS JOYITAS DE CHARAPAQUI II” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Noemi es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de flete de ropa, venta de mantas, venta de huevos, tienda de barrio, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Noemi es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, ya que hace varios años apoya en el negocio familiar, con el pasar del tiempo su madre le heredo este negocio el cual ahora está trabajando.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz y conservas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución y le gusta compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Joyitas de Charapaqui II” will begin its sixth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada Regional Office. The group is made up of eight members and is directed by a board of directors, of which Noemi is the President. The communal bank’s members work in businesses such as: shipping clothes, selling blankets, selling eggs, running a neighborhood store, and selling food. 

The loan that they will take out will help the small entrepreneurs. Noemi is one of the members. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, joining after receiving an invitation from a huge promotion that the institution carried out in her area. She currently has a neighborhood store. She tells us that she learned this business from her mother, since she has been working in the family business for many years. With the passing of time, her mother passed the business along to her. 

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital (to buy rice and canned food on wholesale) that she will obtain from the wholesale vendors in La Paz. Later, she will sell it in her storefront. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the trainings that the institution offers, and that she likes to share with her friends.

loans.use: to buy rice and canned food on wholesale.

loans.name: Mwarimo

texts.en:
Mwarimo is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwarimo operates a grocery stall, selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high costs of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Yuga

texts.en:
Yuga is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over eight years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mugalla

texts.en:
Mugalla is a married woman and has been blessed with four children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over six years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Mzungu

texts.en:
Mzungu is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two hoes, one folk hoe, a sickle, seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shop items like sugar, salt and bar soap.

loans.name: Ngati

texts.en:
Ngati is a married woman with nine kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Ngati operates a stall selling grocery vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Mwenga

texts.en:
Mwenga is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwenga operates a stall selling grocery vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Yehowa No Group

texts.en:
Matilda is the lady standing on the far left in the photo. She is 31 years old, a married lady and has three children. Matilda is part of the group called Yehowa No and, together with four other colleagues, is requesting a total loan amount of GHS 3,900 to sell local dishes, rice, yams and dresses.

Matilda is a ladies' dress and underwear seller and has been doing this business for four years now. She was formerly selling men's things but realized that the ladies' dress and underwear business is very profitable. Matilda is in her fourth loan cycle with ‘Yehowa No’ and has had successful previous loan cycles. Her group meets on Tuesdays to make loan repayments, savings, and receive training on either business or health. 

Matilda is living in a family house and had former education so she can read and write very well. She will use her share of the loan to buy more ladies' dresses and underwear to sell to her customers so that she will make more profit.

loans.use: To buy more ladies' dresses and underwear to sell to her customers so that she will make more profit.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is a 24-year-old young man, from the village of Aghtaklia. He has a mother, a wife and a brother. The family earns a living growing greens and sells them in the local market. However, the income is insignificant for a family of four and so they live in poverty and require financial support to start another business. 

Tengiz decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, he applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

Tengiz will purchase a used car and start providing taxi service. His regular customers especially will be locals and passersby as well. He will be able to achieve financial stability and make a monthly income that will cover his family's basic needs. 

Tengiz and his family members will be very grateful for giving them a chance to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a car and provide taxi service

loans.name: Jose Ezequias

texts.es:
Ezequías, de 71 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene seis hijos, pero ya todos son adultos y ya formaron sus propias familias.

Ezequías, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo y a pesar de sus años, todavía se siente con fuerzas para trabajar en cultivos de maíz y frijol.- Anteriormente, era empleado en una institución del gobierno, fue así como a logrado apoyar a sus hijos.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas para los cultivos de maíz, frijol y hortalizas.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando en el campo, mientras tenga las fuerzas necesarias.
texts.en:
Ezequías is 71 years old and attended school through sixth grade.  He is married and his wife takes care of their home.  He has six children who are all now adults who have formed their own families.

Ezequías has worked as a farmer for a long time, and in spite of his age, he still feels strong enough to work on his corn and bean crops.  He used to work in a government institution, which is how he was able to support his children.  

He will use this loan to purchase farming supplies for his corn, bean, and vegetable crops.  His dream is to continue working in the fields while he has the necessary strength.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for his corn, bean, and vegetable crops.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea, who is a 37 year old married woman, lives in Tbilisi city with her husband. The only breadwinner in the family is Tea's husband who gets a fixed salary of 400 GEL. This income is hardly enough to satisfy even their basic need for the whole month, so Tea decided to do her bit to contribute to the family's welfare.

Due to the aforementioned situation, she lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain the credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Tea to get a loan of 1900 GEL and start a trading business.

With the requested amount she plans to open a general store and start a retail business with food products. She has already found the place and will buy stocks of products for the store. Her regular costumers will be local people. She will work with price mark-ups and get some profit. The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in the case of need.

loans.use: to open a general store and run the business herself.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es: Santa una mujer de ahora 34 años  de edad, ella cuenta que antes del crédito no contaba con el capital suficiente para invertir en su negocio, pero gracias al préstamo al que pudo acceder ella logro cumplir sus sueños, que era la de incrementar su negocio de venta de ropa típica con ello incremento también sus ingresos. Santa es una mujer muy  perseverante y sueña con seguir incrementado su negocio, por tal motivo  ella solicita un nuevo préstamo de Q 9,000.00 para comprar más cortes, faja, güipiles. Santa tiene las esperanzas de conseguir nuevamente un crédito para seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
Santa is a 34-year-old woman. She tells us that, before her loan, she did not have enough capital to invest in her business. However, thanks to the loan that she was able to get, she was able to make her dream come true, which was to expand her traditional clothing sales business. With this, she was able to increase her income as well.

Santa is a very persevering woman and dreams of continuing to expand her business. For this reason, she is requesting a new loan of 9,000.00 quetzals to buy more lengths of fabric, belts, and traditional tunics/blouses. Santa has hopes of getting a loan again to continue prospering.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en:
Margaret, a member of Biakoye group, is 31 and a married mother with two children who are 14 and 4 years old. All of her children go to school. She (standing in the middle of the photograph) sells charcoal at her residence and she has sample of the charcoal in her hands. She has been doing this job for 3 years to assist her husband who is a tiller. 

As a mother, she would not sit back and leave all the responsibilities on her husband so she saved some money from her previous petty trade, which enabled her to engage in the sale of charcoal in town. This has enabled her to meet her family's needs. 

Margaret has dreams of expanding her business and educating her children up to higher levels of learning so that they will have a bright future. Margaret lacks enough capital, which has led to the sluggish growth of her business. She, therefore, needs a loan to boost her business. So, together with Victoria and Lawrenda, the group needs a total of 2,600 GHS to boost their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell to customers.

loans.name: Famille Juvenal Group

texts.fr: Il y a 36 ans que Juvénal a commencé l'exploitation du café car il y a trouvé un moyen pour relever le niveau de vie de sa famille. Souvent, il est buté au manque d'argent pour financer les travaux de récolte; défi qui sera levé cette fois-ci grâce au crédit qu'il aura à recevoir. Pour lui, la priorité est l'amélioration de la qualité et la quantité en café dans sa production. Il pose sur la photo avec son épouse.
texts.en: 36 years ago Juvénal began coffee farming because he found it to be a way to raise his family's quality of living. He is often struggling from a lack of money to pay for the harvesting work. This challenge will be overcome thanks to this loan that he will receive. His priority is the improvement of the coffee quality and quantity in its production. He is posing in the picture with his wife.

loans.use: to pay the labor wages for harvest

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es: Mujeres luchadoras nombre con el que se identifica el grupo al que pertenecen tres mujeres que lo único que quieren es salir de la pobreza para ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, con tal intensión deciden solicitar por octava ocasión el financiamiento en ADIM y así invertir en sus negocios, quien lo coordina es Elsa una mujer que tiene la edad de 30 años, se dedica a realizar derivados del cerdo como es nacatamales, menudo de cerdo, etc., es el séptimo ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento para su negocio y ha logrado aumentar la producción en su negocio y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida.el credito lo invertira para la compra de dos cerdos en pie para el destace. El resto de las integrantes son las señoras, Martha de 31 años de edad y se dedica a la hecha y venta de platanitos en las principales calles de su comunidad y afueras de colegios, este negocio lo impulsó hace seis años, y María que tiene la edad de 35 años, su negocio es la comercialización de ropa y cosméticos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Luchadoras" is the name of this group that is made up of three women who want to leave poverty to offer their family better living conditions.  In order to do this, they have decided to request a loan from ADIM for the eighth time so they can invest in their businesses.  

Elsa coordinates the group.  She is 30 years old and makes food from pig products, including nacatamales and menudo.  This is the seventh loan she has gotten from ADIM for her business and she has succeeded in increasing her production.  This has improved her quality of life.  She will use this loan to purchase two pigs to butcher.  

The other group members are Martha, who is 31 years old and has worked making and selling plantain chips on the main streets of the community and outside of schools for six years, and María who is 35 years old and sells clothing and cosmetics in their community.

loans.use: to purchase two pigs to butcher.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 54 years old, and is married with 2 children. She also supports 10 people in her family. She sells clothes and has been doing this for the last 7 years and makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She has applied for her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more clothes such as shirts and trousers to sell. She hopes this will enable her to increase her overall income. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children and expand the business by buying more clothes to sell.

Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique, make more income and start a poultry farming business and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes such as shirts and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, Emmy started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Mogogosiek, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart; every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a better time milking her cow and also feeding. 

A modern dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevents them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Emmy believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Emmy waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa is a married woman. She has six children of whom five attend school and one is still young. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. 

Karisa is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Urumuri Group

texts.en:
Urumuri is a group led by Veronique who is 52 years old. The group name means “The Light” in English. 

She is married with seven children aged between 5 and 23 years. She sells food stuffs and has been doing this business for the past 7 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, maize and bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans, maize and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Andres Santiago

texts.es:
Andrés, de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a hacer pupusas los fines de semana, para vender, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 ya tiene su propia familia y solo uno vive aún en casa.

Andrés, es agricultor desde muy pequeño, ya que su padre también lo era y de él aprendió todos los trabajos del campo, pero además compra y vende ganado bovino, porque es un negocio muy rentable.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar ganado, para engordarlo, criarlo y luego venderlos cuando estén más grandes, para poder obtener mejores ganancias. 

En un futuro piensa sembrar arroz, ya que en la zona donde él vive es muy productivo para este tipo de cultivos.
texts.en:
Andrés, who is 54 years old, has a fourth-grade education. He is married; his wife takes care of the household chores and, on the weekends, makes pupusas to sell. He has four children, three of whom already have their own families. Only one still lives at home.

Andrés has been a farmer since he was very young; his father was a farmer, too, and Andrés learned all the farm work from him. In addition, he buys and sells cattle, because that is a very profitable business.

He will use the loan to buy cattle in order to fatten them, raise them, and eventually sell them when they are very big in order to obtain the best earnings.

In the future, he plans to plant rice, as the area where he lives is very productive for this type of crop.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Lugogo

texts.en:
Lugogo is a married woman blessed with two school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a dairy farming business, selling as retail and at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed.

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a married woman and has been blessed with three children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Bunda

texts.en:
Bunda is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling goat meat to the neighbors. She also operates a retail shop selling consumable items. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goats to slaughter for resale.

loans.name: Dzengo

texts.en:
Dzengo is a married woman and has been blessed with six children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses. In addition she also operates a retail shop selling household consumables.

With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Katsumi

texts.en:
Katsumi is a married woman and has been blessed with three children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over five years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with six children, of whom three attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past seven years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors waiting for too long to repay goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Tipindule Group

texts.en:
Rozina is a woman aged 23, with two children. Of her two children only one has access to education, as she cannot afford to pay school fees for both of them. She manages her family everyday day by selling secondhand shoes to the people surrounding her area.

She started this business in order to become financially stable and to improve her family's well-being. When she gets a loan, she wants to expand her business by buying two bales of shoes. Her future plan is to buy a house for her children and send all her children to school. Through the loans that she obtained, she will now be able to send her children to private schools.

loans.use: to buy bales of shoes.

loans.name: Nkome Nfa Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two members who live in the same neighborhood and have been together for many years. They belong to a group called Nkome Nfa and are into the sale of drinks and smoked fish.

Joyce (standing on the left in the photo) is the featured borrower of the group; she is an elementary school leaver and has been selling smoked fish from door-to-door for ten years now. She enjoys doing this job because it is profitable and has earned her many customers. Together with her friend, they will need a total amount of GHS 3,000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more fish, firewood and smoked fish.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah has a large family which consists of 13 children, and he lives in a very small house in Haja, Yemen. All of Abdullah's children are students and none of them are employed or able to earn money. 

Abullah is the sole provider of the family and works as a teacher in the public sector with a small salary. His salary is not enough to make the necessary expansions to his house. As a result, Abdullah applied for a loan of 400,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials to expand the house. This loan will help him to build extra rooms in addition to a large bathroom and expand the first one. In reality, his house lacks a suitable bathroom. The house is also without a kitchen and food is made inside a small room where some of his children live. 

Abdullah believes that this loan will improve the living conditions of his family very much. The house needs to a suitable and quiet place, but Abdullah's house is very small and crowded, so most of his children leave the house to read with their friends. Building extra rooms will create a good educational environment for Abdullah's children. Abdullah hopes to renovate all his house after making that necessary expansion.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have productive sorghum harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items to repair his house.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
A decade ago, Alice started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Mogogosiek, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of one child sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and she is proud to wake up every day to milk her cow. 

Although she makes profits by selling milk, she lacks a proper dairy unit and is seeking a loan to build one. A good dairy unit provides a place where cows can relax, and also prevents them from coming down with diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather such as rain. 

Alice believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save the money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Alice thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Elosy

texts.en:
Kenya’s farmers are generally small-scale farmers. Elosy is a very honest, hardworking, and dedicated farmer who is 42 years of age and lives in Chuka, Kenya, an area known to have the best weather patterns that favor crops and animal farming. 

Elosy has so much experience in farming, which she has been doing for 10 years. She is considered one of the best farmers in her village. Elosy’s primary sources of income are selling maize, milk and eggs and crop farming. She is a very dedicated dairy farmer, and she has nicknamed her cow “Mutune” (cool cow). Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow, and that makes her very proud. 

Although Elosy makes profits through milk selling, she is faced with the problem of feeding her cow. She is requesting a loan to buy a chaff-cutter. A chaff-cutter is a mechanical device used to cut hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forages. Through the loan, her cows will not reject any part of the food, hence increasing milk production and Elosy's income level. All that Elosy waits for is the lenders' goodwill and kindness.

loans.use: To buy a chaff-cutter.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a 38-year-old married lady with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a retail shop and a hotel, and at the same time, does farming. She faces challenges of limited capital that hinder her from achieving her dream of having good, fully furnished permanent rental houses where she expects more income. 

She has asked for a loan to buy iron sheets and timber to construct her residential house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and timber to construct her residential house.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 asisten a la escuela.

Teresa, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar los niños; anteriormente ella trabajaba con una amiga vendiendo carne de cerdo y res.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar zacate, alimento para ganado y otra parte para colocar un pequeño negocio de venta de carne.

En un futuro quiere ampliar sus negocios y cree que con mucho trabajo y dedicación lo lograra.
texts.en:
Teresa, aged 42, studied until third grade. She is now married with four children, three of whom go to school. Her husband works on a farm.

Teresa takes care of the household chores and looks after the children, although she used to work with a friend selling pork and beef.

She will use this loan to buy hay and cattle feed, as well as to set up a small store selling meat.

In the future she wishes to grow her business, and believes that with a lot of hard work and dedication she will achieve her wish.

loans.use: to buy hay, cattle feed and to set up a small meat selling store.

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es:
Jesús un joven de tan solo 23 años de edad que por falta de oportunidades laborales opto por iniciar un negocio, aunque tuvo mucho temor e inseguridad debido a su falta de experiencia y capacitación se lanzó todo por generar el sustento de su hijo menor de edad.

Se dedica a la venta de alimentos, los cuales fabrica en su hogar y sale a vender empujando una carrera manual elaborada por él mismo. 

Jesús Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido, cubiertos desechables, comprar pastas, papa, agua potable, especias, arroz, carne, entre otros.
texts.en:
Jesús is a young man of only 23 years of age. Because of the lack of employment opportunities, he opted to start a business. Although he had a great deal of fear and uncertainty due to his lack of experience and training, he threw himself completely into providing for his young son.

He earns his living selling foods, which he makes in his house and sells outdoors, pushing a handcart that he made himself. 

Jesús is requesting a loan for the purchase of supplies, disposable utensils, pasta, potatoes, drinking water, spices, rice, meat, and more.

loans.use: to buy supplies, disposable utensils, pasta, potatoes, drinking water, spices, rice, meat, and more.

loans.name: Omar Ismain

texts.es:
Omar, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales dos trabajan y dos asisten a la escuela.

Omar, es agricultor desde pequeño y aprendió este oficio, porque su padre también era agricultor y él le ayudaba con los trabajos de cultivo de maíz.- Además, compra ganado bovino, los cría y los vende cuando tiene buen precio.

El crédito lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar mano de obra que le limpie el terreno donde sembrará la próxima cosecha.

En un futuro desea comprar bueyes, para trabajar toda la época agrícola.
texts.en:
Omar is 41 years old. He has a fourth-grade education. He is married and his spouse takes care of the household chores. He has four children, of whom two work and two attend school.

Omar has been a farmer since he was very young. He learned this trade because his father was also a farmer and he helped him with the work of growing corn. In addition, he buys cattle. He raises them and sells them when the price is good.

He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor to clear the land where he will plant the next harvest. 

In the future, he would like to buy oxen in order to work throughout the agricultural season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor to clear the land where he will plant the next crop.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is an artisan from Ghana specializing in wood carvings. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, stain and polish. He would also like to use part of the funds to hire additional carvers for his workshop. Nana has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story: Nana is the chief carver for the king of the Ashanti. "I draw inspiration from traditional kente cloth designs, from my family background, and from our rich Ashanti tradition. Some of my work for the king includes objects with 'gye nyame' (symbol for the supremacy of God), stools, staffs and other royal and ceremonial objects. My dream has always been to invest in my children's education. I am happy to say that this is now possible. "As a Chief Carver, I can say that it is you who has made it possible for me to look after my children's school now that I am at my old age. So I am very grateful to all the people who are joining in this microcredit to assist me through this loan. God bless you." Use the link below to view Nana's wood carvings on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/1482

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, stain and polish, and to hire additional carvers for his workshop

loans.name: Ila

texts.en: Ila an artisan from Ghana who specializes in handcrafted leather jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including beads and leather. Ila has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story: "I'm Ila from Ghana and I come from a family of artists, starting with my great-grandfather. My forefathers were predominantly millet and cattle farmers who used the leather of the animals they reared for clothing and accessories such as talismans, bangles and necklaces. I love what I do!" "I am very grateful for this microcredit. Without you, things would not be as they are now. A big thank you to all of you." Use the link below to view Ila's leather jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8592

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including beads and leather.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Ghanaian artisan Evelyn specializes in handcrafted African masks. She would like to purchase raw materials in bulk, including wood, beads, paint, sandpaper, nails and polish. Evelyn has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is her story: "My greatest inspiration is to preserve our rich cultural heritage," confides Ghana's Evelyn. "Initially, I wasn't using lots of different materials, but now I use recycled glass and glass beads, aluminum, brass and more. I sit and draw the mask creatively, and come up with the colors that will make it stand out." "I will always be very grateful to you for wanting to ensure that I am able to pay my daughter's school fees every term through my work. Thank you for this microcredit." Use the link below to view Evelyn's African masks on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/6750

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in bulk, including wood, beads, paint, sandpaper, nails and polish.

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe 1 Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Yehowa Akwe 1 and are into selling assorted soaps, biscuits and soft drinks. They have known each for very many years and are still together, living in the same neighborhood.

Charlotte is the group representative. She is 41 years old and lives with her family. She attended school to the elementary level. She is married and together, they have two dependent children. She has sold assorted soft drinks for the past three years which she uses to take care of the family financially. She is taking this loan amount of GHS 3,300 together with her colleague, Salomey.

She will use her portion to purchase more assorted soft drinks to sell to her customers. This is her ninth loan cycle. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more assorted soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario, who leads a women's cooperative known as To'ooneel Ixoq, is a weaver from Guatemala who specializes in handwoven accessories and hammocks. She would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including thread and dyes. Rosario has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is her story: "We are a group of hard-working, creative and enterprising women with a desire to improve our lives, our families, and that of our community," says Rosario, president of the association. "Our mothers taught us to weave when we were only little girls, and they also taught us how to dye threads with natural pigments to protect our environment. In fact, that is our specialty – our weaves are done with cotton threads dyed with tree bark, leaves and fruits. We go by the name To'ooneel Ixoq, which in the Tzutujil Maya language means 'Feminine Development.' We are a very united team, and the most beautiful thing about being in this team is that we support each other, and we encourage members to create their own designs. Our dream is to one day have our own store and a community workshop, because at the moment we work from our own homes." "Our cooperative is made up of families of very humble means, and this microcredit will provide the capital we need to grow our business. All of the women in the cooperative are very thankful for the opportunity that this loan represents." Use the link below to view Rosario's handwoven accessories and hammocks on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/7339

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including thread and dyes.

loans.name: Gjyste

texts.en:
While Gjyste built the animal stable previously with your financial help and is very grateful to you all, she now is seeking your help again to pay for her son's education fees. He is studying in a university in Albania; he is in the third year taking German language and he will graduate with an undergraduate degree in German culture and language. 

Her family's only source of income has been agriculture/livestock for a very long time.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education; he is taking German language.

loans.name: Maria Del Refugo

texts.en:
Maria del Refugio is 47 years old. She used to work in a furniture manufacturing company and then with a colleague decided to start their own shop and become independent. She started the business nine years ago and has been able to sustain it and make it grow. 

She is asking for a loan to buy some equipment to increase her production capacity. She says that she makes tubular furniture as well as other items. Her goal is to keep growing the business and provide employment opportunities to other people.

loans.use: To buy equipment for furniture making.

loans.name: Vitor

texts.en:
Vitor is a villager living in the northern part of Albania and is a father of five children; all ranging in age from 9 to 19 years old. 

“I want my kids to get ahead in life and this can be done only if they study; and they want to; for this reason, I want to expand my business activity by adding two more dairy cows to the existing herd, so that I can put some money aside for their education.  That is something that I cannot do right now since the money I make,  is not enough to do that. It’s a blessing having this many kids, yet it’s hard to provide all the things they need,” said Vitor in the interview.  

The activity that he has been pursuing for so long is livestock, and it has been the only source of income for the family of nine members including his parents who live with them.  He also plants, mostly feed for the animals and beans that he sells in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy two more dairy cows

loans.name: Karen Guadalupe

texts.en:
Karen Guadalupe is 48 years old, married, and has three sons.  One is independent and two live with her. 

She has been working in retail for the last eight years. She owns a grocery store where she sells dairy products such as yogurt. 

She is requesting a loan to restock her inventory and increase her sales. 

She describes herself as credit worthy. 

She enjoys her work and feels accomplished due to her ability to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy dairy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Famille Mwendo Group

texts.fr: En observant le progrès accompli par les autres personnes grâce au café, Justin a décidé de s'y lancer il y a de cela 7 ans. Le problème majeur pour lui se situe surtout au niveau de paiement de la main d'oeuvre face aux innombrables travaux champêtres qu'exige le café; toutefois, il s'estime heureux car ce crédit lui permet d'y répondre plus aisément. Il compte dans l'avenir et grâce à son travail se construire un habitat confortable. Il est accompagné de son épouse sur la photo.
texts.en: Justin decided to take up coffee farming 7 years ago while observing other people's developments accomplished thanks to coffee,  His main problem is paying the labor wages for the innumerable tasks required for coffee. Nevertheless, he counts himself lucky because this loan will allow him to respond to these needs more easily. Thanks to his work, he hopes to build himself a comfortable home in the future. In the picture, he is accompanied by his wife.

loans.use: to pay the labor wages for harvesting and mulching

loans.name: Karen Denis

texts.en:
Karen Denis is 21 years old, single, and has a daughter that is 1 and a half years old. 

She works in a call center and also sells home products and shoes through a catalog. She has been selling products for almost three years. 

Karen Denis is asking for a loan to restock her inventory and continue to sell.  She says that with her sales and job she is able to support her daughter.

loans.use: to buy home products and shoes for sale

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla vit avec son mari et leur enfant à Lomé. Elle est infirmière accoucheuse et revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale. Son approvisionnement se fait au Grand Marché de Lomé. Abla espère agrandir son activité et assurer l'avenir de la famille.
texts.en: Abla lives with her husband and their child in Lomé. She is a midwife and a reseller of general food products. She stocks up at the large market in Lomé. Abla hopes to widen her business and ensure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy general food products and charcoal

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is 63 years old, married, and has one child. She is in an agricultural business in the Philippines. Teresa has been in business for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to sustain it. She has requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a farming rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Delia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming rice business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
