Stephen is 28 years old and married with three children, aged 8, 3 and 1 year. He is strong, youthful and hardworking. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda, and earns a living from his coffee plantation, with extra income from a bar, the sale of produce and meat selling. 

He is requesting a loan to  buy more fertilizers to apply and improve his coffee plantation. He hopes to develop into a modern farmer and have a very good, big and modern coffee plantation. His vision is limited by bad weather that affects the output from his garden, plus inadequate capital to supplement the operation costs at the farm.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to apply and improve his coffee plantation

loans.name: Judith Maria

texts.es:
Judith es una empresaria alegre, emprendedora, alentada, ella busca su futuro no espera que nadie le dé nada con sus propias manos, esfuerzo logro montar un negocio que es una distribuidora de bebidas alcohólicas, paralelo en su negocio ofrece dichas bebidas, pone música y se convierte en un bailadero muy agradable donde las personas se divierten y se salen de su monotonía.

Ella es una madre cabeza de familia, su pequeño es de 10 años, lucha pro que estudie y tenga una vida digna.

Judith Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de bebidas alcohólicas precisamente Cerveza, Ron, Aguardiente.

Con este préstamo espera mejorar sus ventas, aumentar los clientes, incrementar su utilidad y seguir haciendo que la gente goce de un momento agradable.
texts.en:
Judith is a cheerful, entrepreneurial, and courageous businesswoman. She fights for her future with her own hands, and she does not expect anyone to give anything to her. With effort, she was able to establish a business that distributes alcoholic beverages. In addition, she offers these beverages, plays music, and turns her business into an enjoyable dance floor where people have fun, escaping their monotony. She is a mother and a head of household. Her small child is 10 years old. She fights for him to have an education and a decent life.

Judith is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of alcoholic beverages including beer, rum, and aguardiente. With this loan, she hopes to improve her sales, expand her customer base, increase her profitableness, and continue helping people enjoy a good time.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of alcoholic beverages including beer, rum, and aguardiente.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is age 36 and married with four children, who all attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He sells clothes in the market, and in order to supplement his income, he rides a motorcycle for transport. He desires to expand his business and pay school fees for his children; hence, he is seeking a loan to buy more shirts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shirts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a lot of bowls and thermoses to resell  for profit.

loans.name: Nayeli Guadalupe

texts.en:
Nayeli is 22 years old, married, and has two sons. 

She works in a clothing store and also sells clothes through a catalog to earn extra income.  She enjoys the sales process. 

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandize and this will hopefully increase her catalog sales. 

Her biggest accomplishment is helping her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes to sell through a catalog

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina is 52 years old, married, and has two sons.  She lives in her parents' house

She has two lines of business: she owns a small grocery store and also sells food.  

She says that she has been working for more than 10 years and sells to both retail clients and established businesses. 

She describes herself as very responsible. 

She is asking for a loan to restock her grocery store to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her grocery store

loans.name: Ilsen De Jesus

texts.es:
Ilsen es una mujer de 36 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos de 8, 10, 14 años de edad, se dedica a la fabricación de calzado en un almacén que tiene ubicado en su casa, es un espacio muy pequeño pero como pueden ver es muy creativa y su calzado es de mucha calidad y es por su calidad que logro ser acogida por sus vecinos y personas de los alrededores.

Inicio su negocio hace algo más de 2 años, como necesidad económica, tomando clases para poder lograr los resultados que pueden ver en las fotos.

El motivo principal que impulsa  a Ilsen para arrancar su negocio fueron sus hijos, la preocupación que le dio el futuro de ellos y poco a poco ha servido como un ejercicio de superación personal hasta convertirse en su única fuente de entrada de dinero.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar inventario como lo son suelas, cuero, cuerina, cuerro artificial, accesorios para las sandalias, hilos, pegamento entre otros.

Con la ayuda de este préstamo Ilsen espera mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, optimizar su operación y seguir sacando su negocio adelante.
texts.en:
Ilsen is a 36-year-old woman, she is married and the mother of 3 children who are 8, 10, and 14 years old. She works making shoes in a warehouse located in her home. It is a very small space, but as can be seen, she is very creative, and her shoes are of high quality. It is because of the quality that she managed to be welcomed by her neighbors and people in the surrounding areas.
She started her business about 2 years ago, because of economic need, taking classes to be able to afford the results that can be seen in the photo. 
The main motive that drove Ilsen to start her business were her children, the worry about their future, and little by little, it has helped as an exercise in personal improvement until it became her sole source of income. 
She asks for a loan to purchase inventory, such as soles, leather, imitation leather, artificial leather, accessories for sandals, thread, glue, among others. 
With the help of this loan, Ilsen hopes to improve sales, increase her clientele, optimize her operation, and keep improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory, such as soles, leather, imitation leather, artificial leather, accessories for sandals, thread, glue, among others.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María es una joven de 26 años de edad, muy responsable y trabajadora, madre de dos hijos de 5 y 7 años de edad, por ellos trabaja arduamente en su negocio de cafetería donde ofrece bebidas, alimentos de panadería, desayunos y almuerzos. 

Ella es madre cabeza de familia que laboralmente pasa por ciertos inconvenientes financieros, no cuenta con mucho capital para abastecer su negocio por ello en la foto lo podemos ver falto de mercancía y si permite que esto continúe así podría ser posible un cierre de negocio, y al ella ser cabeza de familia no puede permitir esto.

María solicita un préstamo para abastecer su negocio, comprara refrescos, mecato, insumos para el restaurante y la panadería.
texts.en:
Ana María is a 26-year-old young woman. She is a very responsible and hardworking mother of two children who are 5 and 7 years old. For them, she works arduously in her café where she sells drinks, baked goods, breakfasts, and lunches.

She is a single mother who is experiencing work-related financial difficulties. She doesn't have much capital to stock her business; we can see the lack of merchandise in the photo. If she lets this continue, her business could close, and as head of the household, she cannot allow this.

Ana María is requesting a loan to stock her business; she will buy soft drinks, snacks, and supplies for the restaurant and the bakery.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snack foods, supplies for the restaurant and the bakery.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is 28 years old, married, and has three sons. She lives with her in-laws and has worked in retail for more than five years. 

She started selling clothes and then switched to home cleaning and seasonal products. 

She is asking for a loan to restock her inventory and offer more product variety to her clients. 

She says that her work has helped to support her family and achieve some financial stability.

loans.use: to buy home cleaning products for sale

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 47 años de edad, es una mujer muy conservadora, estudió hasta tercer grado de educación básica, es madre soltera, su hijo trabaja para una radio cristiana y está por graduarse de la carrera de psicología, vive en casa de su patrona junto con su hijo y la nieta de la jefa. 

Julia, desde los 13 años de edad ha trabajado realizando oficios domésticos; cuando tenía 18 años, fue contratada por su actual patrona y ahora tiene 30 años de trabajar en ese mismo lugar, casi es considerada como de la familia.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar una casa que sus familiares han construido en su terreno y ahora ella quiere vender el terreno, pero tiene que pagarles la casa a sus familiares.

Julia, sueña con llegar a tener su propia casa, en donde pueda vivir junto con su hijo de forma independiente.
texts.en:
Julia, who is 47 years old, is a very conservative woman. She studied until the third grade of basic education. She is a single mother, her son works for Christian radio, and is about to graduate with a degree in psychology. She lives in her employer’s house with her son and the granddaughter of her boss. 

Julia has worked since she was 13 doing housework. When she was 18, she was hired by her current employer, and now she has been working there for 30 years. She is almost considered as part of the family.

The requested loan is to purchase a house that her relatives have built on her land, and now she wants to sell the plot of land, but first, she must buy the house from her relatives.  

Julia dreams of having her own home, where she can live with her son independently.

loans.use: to buy a house that her relatives have built on her land.

loans.name: Damaris Maria

texts.es:
Un día cualquiera del año 1998 la señora Damaris inicio su vida como independiente adentrándose al mundo del comercio, vendiendo productos de uso personal una actividad que le permitió generar recursos y criar a sus hijos quienes a estas alturas ya tienen 18, 16, 12 años de edad.

Su afán con su negocio es poder generar recursos para mantener a sus hijos estudiando, aunque hoy en día hay mucha competencia su largo recorrido le permite seguir teniendo clientes fieles. 

Damarís quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido e iniciar a progresar pues le preocupa que desde el año que fundo el negocio no ha cambiado si quiera su vitrina, pero con este préstamo lo que busca es comprar surtido de productos de uso personal y una vitrina donde exhibirlos.
texts.en:
On a typical day in the year 1998, Damaris started her independent life, venturing into the world of retail, selling personal use products, an occupation which allowed her to generate an income and raise her children, who at this time are 18, 16, and 12 years old. 
Her ambition with her business is to be able to generate an income to keep her children in school. Although nowadays there is a lot of competition, her long rounds allow her to keep having  loyal customers.

Damaris wants to ask for a loan to purchase a stock and start to progress, because she is worried that since last year she has not even changed her window display. But with this loan, what she wants is to buy a stock of personal use products and a display where she can show them.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of personal use products.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica describes herself as a sociable person that likes to interact with people.  She is calm, a homebody, and very responsible.  In her free time, she enjoys reading and listening to music.  

She works in a general store that was started by her mother more than 20 years ago. It is a general store that sells food, seeds, raw materials for baking, and even articles for parties. 

She is asking for a loan to restock the inventory of her store. 

Her biggest accomplishment is sending her daughter to college.

loans.use: to restock her inventory of food, seeds, and materials for baking

loans.name: Famille Mubalama Group

texts.fr: Burafiki a été intéressé à planter le café car c'est une activité qui, depuis sa naissance, était pratiquée par ses parents et grâce à laquelle ils ont pu étudier et répondre à d'autres besoins de la vie. Actuellement, les freins à la culture du café sont les maladies et l'absence de marchés sûrs pour l'écoulement de leurs produits. Ils souhaitent, avec sa mère (voir photo), bien aménager et entretenir leur champ afin d'accroître leur récolte. Cette production aura un impact sûrement sur le changement positf de conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Burafiki was interested in planting coffee because it is an activity that has been practiced by his parents since his birth, and thanks to which they were able to study and respond to his life's needs. Currently, the obstacles in farming coffee are illness and the lack of a guaranteed market for gathering their products. With his mother (see photo), he would like to rearrange and maintain their fields in order to increase their harvest. This production will surely have an impact on positively changing his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain and mulch the fields, buy phytosanitary products and pay the labour wages for harvesting

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a natural medicine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transportation, and raising pigs. 

Lourdes is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more bottles of natural medicines to sell.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bottles of natural medicines to sell

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire works hard to support her family. Claire is single and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now. Claire requested a 6,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase more fish and other materials for her business. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other materials for her business

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a single woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dolores is 39 years old, and both children are presently in school.

Dolores has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Dolores requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish, salt and other materials for making dried fish.

Dolores has been in this business for 13 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, salt and other materials for making dried fish

loans.name: Wel

texts.en:
Wel is 60 years old, married, and has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Wel has a direct selling business in the Philippines.  Wel has been in this business for 3 years. 

Wel requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products, shoes, pants, etc.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal care products, shoes, pants, etc

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are in school.  

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvira is 47 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Elvira has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to pay for additional fishnet, bamboo and maintenance for her boat.

Elvira has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for additional fishnet, bamboo and maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Mary Chris

texts.en:
Mary Chris works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Mary Chris requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish net and other materials for her business.

Mary Chris has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie is 47 years old and married with four children. With four children who are presently in school, Menchie works very hard to provide for her family.

Menchie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, bread, etc.

Menchie has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, bread, etc.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a widowed lady who carries out crop production in Hoima, Uganda. In order to supplement her income, she operates a retail shop, mainly selling items like sugar, salt and soap, among other items. She has hopes of growing and becoming self-supportive; however, her main challenge is inadequate capital. She will use the credit facility to plant cassava.

loans.use: to plant cassava.

loans.name: Jennefer

texts.en:
Jennefer is 41 years old and married with three children. With three children presently in school, Jennefer works very hard to provide for them.

Jennefer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, soft drinks, coffee, milk, bread, etc.

Jennefer has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, soft drinks, coffee, milk, bread, etc

loans.name: Aisha

texts.ru: Айша, 34 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1999 году с 1,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Айши, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется корова, на участке мерою 2,20 Га она выращивает фасоль.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айша обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений, селитры для обработки земли и выращивания экологически чистой фасоли. Доходы от кредита Айша планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Aisha is 34 years old, married and has two children. She has received secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she raises livestock and grows farm crops, having launched this business in 1999 with a starting capital of 1,000 KGS. Thanks to Aisha's hard work, at present she owns a cow; she also grows beans at a land plot of 2.2 ha [5.5 acres]. In order to develop her business further, Aisha has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS in order to buy mineral fertilizers and niter [saltpeter] to treat her soil and grow environmentally clean beans. Aisha plans to invest the revenues from her loan in a further growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and nitre for land cultivation in order to grow organic haricot beans.

loans.name: Ma. Marisa

texts.en:
Ma. Marisa is 37 years old and single, with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Two of her children are still in school.

Ma. Marisa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fish nets and other materials for her business.

Ma. Marisa has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and other materials for her business

loans.name: Rodolfo Alexander

texts.es:
Rodolfo, de 24 años de edad, se graduó en mecánica automotriz, está soltero y vive junto con su madre, la cual tiene un negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, en el cual le va muy bien pues se encuentra ubicado a la par de una universidad y está frente a una parada de buses.

Rodolfo, desde pequeño se ha interesado por los carros, luego de haber culminado sus estudios de bachillerato, se dedicó al comercio de vehículos usados, los cuales compra cuando encuentra alguna oferta, los repara y luego los vende, actividad que lleva realizando por varios años.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar materiales de construcción y pagar mano de obra para construir una cochera enfrente de su casa, esto le ayudará pues así no tendrá que molestar a un tío, para paquear los vehículos.

Rodolfo, sueña con seguir mejorando su casa y llegar a tener un negocio grande de venta de vehículos usados, para gozar de una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Rodolfo who is 24-years old, graduated as an automotive mechanic.  He is single and lives with his mother.  His mother has a business selling basic goods.  Her business has been going very well as it is located alongside a university and in front of a bus stop. 

Since Rodolfo was little, he has been interested in cars.  Later, after completing his high-school education, he started making his living selling used cars.  He buys them when he finds a good deal, he repairs them and then sells them.  He has been doing this for a number of years. 

The loan Rodolfo has requested is for purchasing construction materials and to pay for labor for building a carport in front of his house.  This will help him, as he will no longer have to bother an uncle about parking his vehicles. 

Rodolfo hopes to keep improving his house and to one day have a large used-car sales business so that he and his family can enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and pay for labor to build a carport in front of his house so he can park cars for sale.

loans.name: Aguida

texts.en:
Aguida is married and has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day.  She has been in this business since 2010. 

Aguida is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to improve her business.  She will buy some additional supplies such as shirts, pants, lights, body lotions, and bags.

She feels comfortable managing her business because she can earn money every day.  Running a business has made Aguida independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. 

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, light, body lotions, and bags.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married. 

She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as eggs, noodles, slippers and Coca-Cola. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  

She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy eggs, noodles, slippers and Coca-Cola.

loans.name: Fouroutono 03 Group

texts.fr: Mariam, membre représentatif du groupe est une femme mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 4 sont scolarisés. Cette brave dame vit à Bobo, capitale économique du Burkina. Elle fait le commerce des pagnes et des bijoux afin de s'épanouir et aussi d'assurer un avenir à ses enfants. Mariam et les autres membres respectent leur engagement vis à vis de ACFIME et elles font leur remboursement à la bonne échéance. Mariam a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter plus de pagnes et de bijoux pour vendre. A la fin du prêt, Mariam aura épargné 17 500 francs en son nom dans notre institution et elle pourrait avoir aussi un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer son activité.
texts.en: Mariam, the representative for the group is a married woman and a mother of 5 children, 4 of which attend school. This brave woman lives in Bobo, the economic capital of Burkina. She trades pagnes and jewelry in order to prosper as well as to ensure for her children's future. Mariam and the other members respect their commitment to ACIFME and they repay their loans by the due date. Mariam needs this loan to purchase pagnes and jewelry to sell. By the end of her loan, Mariam will have saved 17 500 francs to her name with our institution and she will be able to have a profit that will allow her to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela de 35 años de edad, tiene una linda familia  de tres hijos de las edades entre uno y diez años, esta hermosa familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Micaela trabajadora y disciplinada ella para generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa trabaja como maestra de educación primaria, desde hace ocho años, ella con el talento y paciencia que la caracteriza  es muy destacada como maestra. Aunque ella tiene una profesión se dedica también al cultivo de café y banano, por lo que en este momento necesita más terreno donde pueda seguir cultivando, pero una de las limitaciones que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente por lo que solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comparar media cuerda de terreno para cultivo de banano.
El gran anhelo de Micaela es poder tener una librería y seguir ayudando a sus hijos en la escuela.
texts.en:
Micaela is 35 years old. She has a lovely family of 3 children between the ages of 1 and 10 years old. This beautiful family lives in a community in Solola.

Micaela is hard-working and disciplined. In order to generate some earnings and support her husband with the household income, she has been working as an elementary school teacher for the past 8 years. As a result of the talent and patience that characterize her, she really stands out as a teacher. 

Although she has a profession, she also makes a living cultivating coffee and bananas. At the moment, she needs more land where she can continue cultivating. However, one of her limitations is that she does not have enough money. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy a plot of land for the cultivation of bananas. Micaela's greatest dream is to have a library and to continue supporting the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for the cultivation of bananas.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
María Luisa de 30 años de edad, tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre catorce y quince años, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
María Luisa para generar sus ingresos y poyar a su familia, ella trabaja como injertador de café desde hace 12 años, ella cuenta que gracias a esta labor ha logrado sacar a delante a su familia.
Ha María Luisa le gusta mucho la naturaleza es por eso que ahora ha pensado en compra media cuerda de terreno que lo utilizara para cultivo de plantas de vivero, pero una de las limitaciones que tiene María Luisa es de no contar con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar su terreno.
El gran deseo de María Luisa es conseguir el crédito para tener su vivero y que sea reconocido por la gente para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María Luisa is 30 years old. She has a lovely family of two children 14 and 15 years old. They live in a neighborhood of  Sololá. 

To generate income and support her family, María Luisa has worked as a coffee grafter for 12 years. She says that thanks to this work, she has managed to provide for her family. 

María Luisa really likes nature, so now she is planning to buy half a "cuerda" [a variable Guatemalan unit of areal measurement; roughly 600 square meters] of land that she will use to grow nursery plants. However, one of María Luisa's limitations is not having enough money to be able to buy her land. 

María Luisa's greatest wish is to get a loan in order to have her nursery, and to become known by people in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy land to use as a nursery

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: Aurelia is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married and she is running a carpentry business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as wood, Wood Defender machines, saws and wood glue. She opened her business a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Aurelia is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood, Wood Defender machines, saws and wood glue,.

loans.name: Kimseang

texts.en:
Kimseang, 35, is a married woman and lives in a small community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two children whom she supports. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small plot of farmland that is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice. She sells her agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this business for 15 years. On average, she can generate earnings of 2 USD per day.

The current farmland that she owns is small and does not provide enough benefits for her. She wants to enlarge her farmland area, but she cannot afford to do that. Therefore, she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy another plot of farmland for growing rice. She hopes this additional farmland will help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en:
Saroem, 52, lives in a small community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she works very hard on her own rice farmland by growing and selling the crop to the local dealers and customers in the market. On average, she is able to make an income of USD $3.00 a day. 

She is a lovely mother of four single children. One of her children is going to be married soon. However, she doesn't have enough money to prepare a proper wedding party. Thus, she is applying for a Kiva loan to pay for her child’s wedding party. 

Through this loan, she hopes that it can bring a real happiness for this new couple. She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her child’s wedding party

loans.name: Fay

texts.en:
Fay is 62 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has 3 children, all of adult age. 

Fay is engaged in agriculture, particularly in rice production. She earns approximately 2,700 PHP a month, which she said is helpful to meet her needs. 

At present, she is receiving a monthly pension as a surviving spouse of her late husband.  

She has requested a loan to be used in paying the taxes in arrears of their real estate properties. 

Fay has been a member of PMPC for almost 3 years. 

In the future, Fay hopes to expand her agri-business by means of acquiring more rice land.

loans.use: to pay the taxes in arrears

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma has a vegetable garden. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and also earning income for her family. 

As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she seeks financial help to purchase a variety vegetable seedlings that she can grow and sell, as well as to pay for the land and seedbed preparation. 

In the future, Vilma wishes to become the supplier of vegetables in her town and surrounding neighborhoods.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetable seedlings that she can grow and sell, as well as to pay for the land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Rossana

texts.en:
Rossana is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has one child still in school.

Rossana has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and other materials for her business.

Rossana has been in this business for two years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other materials for her business

loans.name: Salle

texts.en:
Salle works hard to support her family. She is a married woman with six children and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

Salle requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish and other materials for her business.

Salle has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other materials for her business

loans.name: Mechill

texts.en:
Mechill is 38 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Mechill requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mechill has been fattening pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mechill would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a single mother of six children.  Analie works hard to support her family. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Analie has been in this business for 10 years now.

Analie requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish nets and other materials for her business.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets and other materials for her business

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 47 years old and married with one child, who is still in school. Jonalyn works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Jonalyn has been in this business for eight years. 

Jonalyn requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, milk, coffee, noodles, bread, spices, etc. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, milk, coffee, noodles, bread, spices, etc.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 53 years old and married with four children.

Catalina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Catalina has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Catalina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 46 years old and has two children. Chona is married, and one of her children is currently in school.

Chona is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Chona requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Chona has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Chona would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta works hard to support her family. Crisanta is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Crisanta requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her business.

Crisanta has been in this business for 7 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Crisanta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Julieta

texts.en:
Ma. Julieta is 51 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Ma. Julieta has a business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and to pay for her laborers.

Ma. Julieta has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for laborers.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  Remy has been in this business for 10 years now.  She works hard to support her family. 

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase new fish nets and materials for boat repairs.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new fish nets and materials for boat repairs

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela works hard to support her family. Adela is married and has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Adela has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Adela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is 38 years old and she is married. She has a food stall to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will buy items such as meat, beef, pork, chicken, rice and vegetables. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) for offering loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy meat, beef, pork, chicken, rice and  vegetables.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 33 years old, married, and has five children.  Her husband is a farmer.

She is a very hard working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 14 years. 

She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100.00.  She earns a good income from her business.

Alice is applying for a loan of $700.00 to improve her business.

She will use her loan to buy some items such as Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko juice, beer, water, noodles, cigarettes, biscuits, and oils.

She wants to expand her business and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beer, water, noodles, cigarettes, biscuits, and oils

loans.name: Alzira

texts.en:
Alzira is married.  She opened her kiosk in 2009, and is generating a good income from selling.

Alzira is requesting a loan of $600 USD to improve her business. 

She will use the loan to buy noodles, sugar, cigarettes, coffee, candles, salt, and soap.

In the future, she hopes of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, cigarettes, coffee, candles, salt, and soap

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, 51, lives in rural area of Cambodia. She has five children; three are married and two are single. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small plot of farmland that is located near her house. On her farmland she grows rice, and she sells her agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, she can generate an earning of USD 3.00 per day.

The plot of farmland that she  currently owns is small and it can provide less than adequate benefit to her. She wants to enlarge her farmland area but she cannot afford to. Therefore, now she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy another plot of farmland for growing rice. She hopes that having this additional farmland will help to improve her living condition. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro es un hombre de 21 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la compra de ganado vacuno lechero para engordar.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Sojata’ situado en una altura aledaña al lago sagrado Titicaca, caracterizado por mantener sus edificaciones de piedra. Al pasar el tiempo los comunarios de esta área han aprendido los actos más sagrados para vivir en paz y en armonía con todo lo que les rodea. Herederos de  la destreza para observar y mantener vivas las costumbres ancestrales, las ceremonias que realizan son místicas y espirituales.
Alvaro es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que son mayores de edad y no trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado, él se encarga de visitar las ferias de la zona en busca de terneros para engordarlos y venderlos. Actividad que le quita todo el tiempo porque su negocio es constante. “heredé este negocio de mi familia, como es la costumbre del lugar, ahora mis padres no trabajan y yo aporto con todos los gastos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la experiencia que tiene es de toda su vida, la desventaja es el clima del lugar que hace que no exista forraje en abundancia. Su sueño es construir un establo grande dónde entren más cabezas de ganado, el desea realizar la compra de ganado vacuno y lechero para engordarlos y venderlos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Alvaro solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno y lechero para engordarlo y cuidar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Alvaro is a 21-year-old single man with no children, and his business is buying milk cattle to raise. He is resourceful, independent, patient, responsible, and very hardworking. 

He runs his business in the Solata community, situated at high altitude adjacent to sacred Lake Titicaca. The community is known for still having its stone buildings. With the passage of time, the residents of this area have learned the most sacred ceremonies in order to live in peace and harmony with everything around them. Having inherited the ability to observe and keep alive the ancestral customs, they take part in ceremonies that are mystical and spiritual.

Alvaro has dark skin, short black hair, brown eyes, short stature, and a thin build. His native tongue is Aymará, which is spoken in the area, and he speaks Spanish because of the general culture and the business that he is in. He shares his life with his parents, who are elderly and don't work. They live in their own house made of adobe with a corrugated metal roof; they have electricity and well water. 

Alvaro's business is the sale of cattle. He is responsible for visiting the markets in the area in search of calves to fatten and sell. This activity takes all his time because his business is constant. "I inherited this business from my family, as is the local custom. Now my parents don't work and I pay all the expenses," he says. 

The advantage of his business is that he has a lifetime of experience; the disadvantage is the local climate, which does not make for abundant forage. His dream is to build a large stable to hold more head of cattle. He would like to purchase beef and dairy cattle to raise and sell. 

This is his first lending cycle with the institution in the year that he has been running this business independently. For these reasons, Alvaro is requesting a loan for the purchase of beef and dairy cattle to raise and to take care of his parents.

loans.use: to purchase beef and dairy cattle to raise and to take care of his parents

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of reinforcing the pig pens with concrete, she wants to add heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.name: Lougina

texts.en:
Lougina is 44 years old and a married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lougina has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Lougina has requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of clothes to resell.

Lougina has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Lougina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Danilyn

texts.en:
Danilyn is 28 years old and married.

Danilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like cereals, coffee creamer, fabric conditioners, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Danilyn has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Danilyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like cereals, coffee creamer, fabric conditioners, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Solaya

texts.en:
Solaya is 46 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.  Solaya works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines.  Solaya has been in this business for 7 years.

She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more dried coconut meat to sell.

In the future, Solaya would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Aida works hard to support her family. She has a business making cooking stoves in the Philippines, and she also earns income from raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like cement, sand and gravel for her cooking-stove-making business.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like cement, sand and gravel

loans.name: Barcelisa

texts.en:
Barcelisa is married and works hard to support her family.                      

Barcelisa has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Barcelisa requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Barcelisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Sarum's Group

texts.en:
Sarum’s group lives in a rural village in Pailin province in Cambodia. 

Sarum works as a farmer to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Chrib's Group

texts.en:
Chrib’s group lives in a rural village in Pailin province in Cambodia. 

Chrib works as farmer and she also does extra work as seller to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families,  to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en:
Yet’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. 

Yet makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Thean's Group

texts.en:
Thean’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. 

Thean makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work selling groceries to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Epilina

texts.en:
Epilina is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as biscuits, noodles, Fanta, water, eggs, cigarettes, coffee, sugar and noodles.

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $300. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, Fanta, water, eggs, cigarettes, coffee, sugar and noodles

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 60-year-old married woman and mother of eleven children. Three of her children are in school.  

Gloria has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Gloria has been in this business for 18 years. 

Gloria requested a 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more rice to sell.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Dedeh

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Dedeh. Dedeh lives in North Tangerang, a suburban area located about two hours’ drive from Jakarta. She is happily married. She lives there with her husband and her children.  Dedeh owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits. She joined Ruma almost two years ago and was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Dedeh is a hardworking woman and her community sees her as a friendly and informative mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Dedeh needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community.  As seen in the photo, Dedeh is the one who is sitting in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her local community.

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru: Ее зовут Анна. Анне 36 лет. Она замужем за Евгения. У Анны и Евгения трое сыновей. Сыновьям 8, 6 и 2 года. Анна работает в школе преподавателем. Ее муж работает строителем, и его работа является сезонным. Анна с помощью мужа и заемных средств хочет открыть новый бизнес по производству и продаже меда. Анна у своего отца научилась этому ремеслу. Сейчас, когда ее семье необходим новый источник дохода, чтобы прокормить детей, Анна будет применять на деле то, что отец научил ее в свое время. Анна уже приобрела 15 пчелиных ульев. На данный момент ей необходимо купить сахар и полезные вещества для начала ее деятельности. Она надеется, что с Вашей помощью ей удастся совершить задуманное и принести в дом новый источник дохода.
texts.en:
This borrower's name is Anna. She is 36 years old and married to Eugene. Anna and Eugene have three sons, who are eight, six and two years old. Anna works as a secondary school teacher. Her husband is a construction worker, and has only seasonal work. 

Relying on her husband's support as well as loaned funds, Anna would like to launch a new business producing and selling honey. She learned beekeeping from her father. Now that her family needs a new source of income in order to provide for the children's needs, Anna will apply the skills she learned from her father some time ago. Anna has already bought 15 beehives. At present she needs to buy sugar and treatments to launch her business. She hopes that, with your help, she will be able to realize her plans and create a new source of income for the household.

loans.use: to buy sugar and treatments in order to launch a beekeeping business.

loans.name: Santos Reynaldo

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre de 34 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la venta y elaboración de papas fritas.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, de buena actitud, comprometido con su trabajo, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Tilata’, que se caracteriza por abastecer con 32 pozos de agua subterránea a la ciudad, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Santos es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su mamá que trabaja como comerciante y con su hermano que ayuda en el negocio, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de papas fritas. El proceso de elaboración comienza con el lavado de las papas para quitarles la tierra, luego las pela con un pelador industrial para cortarlas a máquina en láminas delgadas para que queden crujientes, una vez realizado el proceso se fríen en una freidora industrial. Todo el proceso lo realiza junto a su hermano. “inicié mi actividad porque mi familia tenía experiencia en el negocio, conseguí clientes y realizo buenas ventas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que mantiene una lista de clientes fijos a los cuales les realiza entregas semanales, la desventaja es que no cuenta con vehículo propio para realizar las entregas. Su sueño es conseguir más clientes y realizar ventas a supermercados grandes, él desea refaccionar su cocina para producir higiénicamente productos de mejor calidad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Santos solicita un préstamo para la refacción de la cocina para producir papas fritas higiénicamente y de buena calidad.
texts.en: Santos is a 34 year old man, single, childless, and his business is selling and making potato chips. He is enterprising, independent, with a good attitude, committed to his work, responsible, and very hardworking. His business developed in the area 'Tilata,' which is characterized by supplying 32 underground water wells in the city. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies between 0-12 degrees Celsius during the day. Santos has a dark complexion, short black hair, brown eyes, short stature, and a medium physique. His mother tongue is Aymará which is spoken in his family, and he speaks Spanish for general culture and carrying out business. His life is shared with his mother who works in trade and his brother who helps in the business. They live in a house owned by their family, constructed of brick and cement with a tin roof. It has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system. His business is making and selling potato chips. The process begins with washing the potatoes to remove dirt, then they are peeled with an industrial peeler machine to cut into thin slices so they remain crispy. Once this process is finished they are fried in an industrial fryer. The whole process is done with his brother. "I started my business because my family had experience in this business, had clients, and made good sales..." says Santos. The advantage of his business is keeping a list of regular clients for weekly deliveries, the disadvantage is that he does not have his own vehicle to make deliveries. His dream is to get more customers and make sales to large supermarkets. He wants to renovate his kitchen to be able to produce hygienic (food safe) products of the best quality. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in year 1 of developing this activity in an independent form. It is for these reasons that Santos is requesting a loan for the renovation of the kitchen to make potato chips hygienically and with good quality.

loans.use: with the refrigeration of his kitchen to produce hygienic and good quality chips

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.  Grace has been in this business for 5 years now and works hard to support her family.

She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old and married. She has three children; one of them is currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Elizabeth has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain it. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Santos Orlando

texts.es:
Santos, de 44 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado, está acompañado y su pareja es comerciante, se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, tienen dos hijos, que aún viven en casa, uno está estudiando.

Santos, se dedica a cultivar y a criar ganado bovino, tiene 20 años de dedicarse al negocio y lo aprendió por medio de su padre, quien le inculcó desde pequeño; también se dedica a la carpintería.- Viaja a pie a su trabajo y su horario es de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.

Santos, necesita el dinero del préstamo para arreglar todo el techo de su casa, porque está dañado y se acerca y el invierno y no se quiere mojar. 

Él, sueña con mejorar su casa, para que su familia viva en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Santos, 44 years old, studied until the eighth grade. He is married and his wife is a businesswoman who works selling fruits and vegetables. They have two children who still live at home and one is studying.

Santos works raising cattle. He has been in this business for 20 years and learned it through his farther who taught him when he was little. He also works in carpentry. He travels by foot to work and his schedule is 7:00am to 4:00pm.

Santos needs the money from the loan in order to fix the entire roof of his house because it is damaged. Winter is coming and he doesn’t want it to get wet.

He dreams of improving his house so that his family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: to fix the entire roof of his house because it is damaged. Winter is coming and he doesn’t want it to get wet.

loans.name: Dolores Armando

texts.es:
Armando, de 57 años de edad, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, el primero de sus hijos está estudiando en la universidad.

Armando, se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde muy pequeño y hace cuatro años decidió poner un pequeño taller de reparación de bicicletas, para poder elevar un poco más sus ingresos, ya que es bastante el gasto de sus hijos con sus estudios. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar repuestos de bicicletas, porque debido a una enfermedad que sufrió su esposa, él se quedó sin capital para continuar con su trabajo; gracias a Dios, su esposa ya está bien de salud.

Armando, sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en: Armando, 57 years old, is married and has 3 children. The eldest of his children is studying at university. Armando has made a living in agriculture since he was very little. Four years ago he decided to start a small bicycle repair shop so he could raise a little more income, since the studies of his children are quite the expense. The loan is needed to purchase bicycle parts. Due to illness suffered by his wife, he ran out of capital to continue his work; thank God, his wife is now in good health. Armando dreams that his children will become professionals and good people in society.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle parts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old, married, and has six children. With five children currently in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, diapers, sanitary pads, face powder, etc. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur and mother of four children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.   She supplements this income with earnings from her restaurant business.

Helen is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Helen dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emeliana works hard to support her family.

She has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming bananas.  

Emeliana is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more bamboo for her weaving business.

Emeliana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo for her weaving business

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz is 41 years old, married, and has four children who are in school.

Flordeliz is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. 

Flordeliz requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Flordeliz has been buying and selling livestock for 12 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flordeliz would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Lin's Group

texts.en:
Lin’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. 

Lin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these members (one man and one woman) to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Ley's Group

texts.en:
Ley’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. 

Ley makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Famille  Mulyane Group

texts.fr: La famille MULYANE dont le représentant est Bidugu( père de famille)cultive le café pour leur survie étant donné que c'est une culture qui occupe une place de choix et résouds multiples problèmes du ménage. Néanmoins les maladies et l'absence de marchés d'écoulement constituent un obstacle. Malgré cela, Bidugu songe à élargir son champ et remplacer les vieux tiges par des jeunes plants. Il espère aider grandement sa famille par une alimentation saine, la scolarisation des enfants et une bonne santé pour tous. D'où elle remercie toutes personnes de bonne volonté à travers PAIDEK pour cette action en faveur de paysans.Sur la photo, Bidugu est au centre, entouré de sa femme et son fils.
texts.en: The MULYANE family’s representative is Bidugu (father). He grows coffee for a living, given that this is a top crop which resolves multiple household problems. Nevertheless, diseases and the absence of markets for selling the product constitue obstacles. Despite this, Bidugu is thinking of expanding his field and replacing the old plants with young ones. He hopes to help out his family in a big way, through safe food, schooling for the children, and good healthcare for everyone. Thus, he thanks anyone of goodwill through PAIDEK for this action favoring peasants. In the photo, Bidugu is in the middle and flanked by his wife and son.

loans.use: to maintain farm fields

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 53 years old with four children. Her husband is a tricycle driver with an income barely supporting their needs. She started her business of a sari sari store (small grocery store) with a working capital of PHP 500 she saved from her husband's income and bought snack foods, candies, coffee and other items which gains PHP 200 daily that helps with their daily expenses.

Through a series of loans and good management, Pacita's business greatly improved. Her store is much bigger and holds more items. She also renovated her house to add three rooms which are for rent. Through the revenue of her income, her youngest child graduated from college. She also helps support her grandchildren in their education.

Pacita is requesting another loan of PHP 20,000 to buy soft drinks, cooking oil, electronic cellphone loads, eggs, ham mayonnaise and burger patties for additional new items to her store and to open a burger stand in front of her store. These will help to increase the potential for more customers.

Pacita hopes to expand her store to help them with their daily expenses and save for their old age and health.

loans.use: to buy one case of soft drinks, five bottles of cooking oil, electronic cellphone loads, two trays of eggs, ham mayonnaise and burger patties.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. 

Chanthy makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Phally works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Samsin's Group

texts.en:
Samsin’s group live in a rural village in Pailin province in Cambodia. Samsin works as a farmer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Samsin and his fellow group member to safeguard the health of their families and to save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a patio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel, iron and labor to build a mud wall in his home.

loans.name: Cruz Del Carmen

texts.es: Cruz de 25 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que pone todo su esfuerzo cada día para sacar adelante a su familia apoyada en su negocio de elaboración y venta de tamales actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años, lo que la hace muy feliz, ya que su clientela crece cada día, por el exquisito sabor de sus tamales y sus precios accesibles. Cruz desea construir un tapial en los alrededores de su vivienda, ya que actualmente solo la protege con postes y alambre de púas, lo que no le brinda una mayor seguridad y teme que su pequeña hija se lastime con ello, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un tapial en su vivienda.
texts.en: Cruz is 25 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and their 4-year-old child. She is a woman who makes an effort every day to get ahead. Her family helps in her business, which is making and selling tamales. She has done this for 3 years, which makes her very happy. Their clientele grows every day because the tamales are affordable and delicious. Cruz wants to build a wall around her home, as currently the only protection is poles and barbed wire, which does not provide good security. She worries that her little daughter will get hurt as a result. Because of this she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a wall around her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a wall around her home

loans.name: El Puma Group

texts.es: Tres mujeres y un varón tomaron la iniciativa de unirse para formar un grupo al que nombraron “El Puma”, estas personas que viven en la misma comunidad, comparten necesidades y valores similares, ya que poseen negocios y ganas de trabajar pero necesitan invertir más capital en sus negocios, para eso enfocaron sus metas y decidieron tomar la decisión de trabajar juntos y ser coordinado por el joven Carlos que tiene la edad de 21 años, quien desde pequeño aprendió los labores de un comerciante, él se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras en barrios de la capital, y para cubrir la demanda que tiene de estos productos, invertirá en piña, sandía, aguacate, mandarinas, etc., esto le permitirá cubrir la demanda que tiene  de los productos ofrecidos, y por ende cubrir los gastos familiares. El resto de los integrantes son, Flor una joven de 19 años y quien comercializa cosméticos y bisutería en su comunidad, Paula una mujer de 44 años que comercializa frutas y verduras en un barrio de la capital y cuenta con una experiencia de veintidós años, y Arminta una señora ejemplar que a sus 53 años de edad comercializa frutas  verduras en el mercado más populoso de la capital.
texts.en: Three women and one man took the initiative to unite to form a group they named "El Puma." These people live in the same community, share similar needs and values, own businesses, and have a desire to work but need to invest more capital into their businesses. For that they focused their goals and decided to work together and be coordinated by young Carlos, aged 21. As a child he learned the workings of trade. He makes a living selling fruits and vegetables in neighbourhoods of the capital. To meet the demands he has for these products, he will invest in buying pineapple, watermelon, avocado, mandarin oranges, etc. This will allow him to meet the demand of the products he offers, and thus cover family expenses. The rest of the members are: Flor, a young woman of 19 who sells cosmetics and costume jewellery in her community; Paula, a woman of 44 who sells fruits and vegetables in a neighbourhood of the capital and has twenty years' experience; and Arminta, an exemplary lady who at 53 sells fruits and vegetables in the most populated market of the capital.

loans.use: to buy pineapple, watermelon, avocado, mandarin oranges, etc.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve her business even more, if you will help her borrow 22,000 PHP. This new loan will be used to buy additional grocery items to sell. This increase in inventory will help her sustain the needs of her family.

Marichu wants to expand her business so that she will be able to help support the educational needs of her child. 

She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as rice, peanut butter, and hot dogs to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur and the mother of two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling charcoal.

Josephine requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, coffee, eggs, milk, etc.

Josephine dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, coffee, eggs, milk, etc

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and works hard to support her family. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines.  Gloria has been in this business for 17 years now.

Gloria requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her business.

Gloria would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets for her business

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 40 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Suzette is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs, sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies to use for her business.

Suzette has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs, sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies to use for her business.

loans.name: Vilenda

texts.en:
Vilenda is a married woman, 23 years old, with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Vilenda has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish, sacks of salt and other supplies to be used for her business.

Vilenda has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, sacks of salt and other supplies to be used for her business.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice grain business in the Philippines.  Jasmin has been in this business for 4 years.   Jasmin earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grain to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

In the future, she dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grain to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 100 items of perfume, 15 blankets and 10 curtains for her buy-and-sell business and 10 kilos of meat, chicken and vegetables to fill the orders of her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more crops from the farmers to sell from his stall.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang, 46, lives in a community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four dependent children. To support the family, she works very hard on her own rice farmland by growing and selling the crop to the local dealers and customers in the market. The net profit that she can generate is USD 3.00 a day, on average. So far, she has been in this type of business for almost 30 years.

Besides being a rice farmer, she has another agricultural business: raising ducks for sale. Currently, she is requesting a Kiva loan to buy duck food for her ducklings.
