With the support from this loan, she hopes that she can help all of her duckling grow better and faster. She is thankful for your generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy duck food for her ducklings

loans.name: Jean Caryl

texts.en:
Jean Caryl is 27 years old, married, and has one child.  Jean Caryl works hard to provide for her family. 

Jean Caryl runs a general store in the Philippines.   She has been running the general store for 7 years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further improve her business.

She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell in her general store.

Jean Caryl aspires expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell in her general store

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is 52 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school.  Librada works very hard to provide for them.

Librada runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 20 years.

She requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods eggs, milk, shampoo, etc.

In the future, Librada would like to expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods eggs, milk, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Lidia Antonia

texts.es:
Lidia, es una persona trabajadora y responsable con sus obligaciones, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada, pero su esposo los abandonó, dejándola cuando sus hijos tenían 10 y 5 años de edad y ella tuvo que ser madre y padre desde ese entonces, ahora sus hijos están grandes y el mayor de ellos emigro a U.S.A.

Lidia, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, principalmente siembra granos básicos, de lo cual ella obtiene ganancias, para suplir la necesidad de la familia.

El crédito lo necesita para pagar el arrendamiento de 14,000 metros cuadrados de tierra  para sembrar, ya que este año quiere aumentar su producción de granos. 

Lidia, sueña con darles lo necesario a sus hijos, para que logren ser profesionales y también desea poder ir a conocer a los EE.UU y visitar a su hijo que hace mucho tiempo que no lo ve.
texts.en:
Lidia is a hardworking, responsible person with a grade 4 education. She is married but her husband left her when her children were 10 and 5 years old. As a result she had to be both mother and father to them. Now her children are grown up, and the older one has emigrated to the USA.

For ten years now Lidia has been working in agriculture, mainly growing grains, from which she earns money to pay for family necessities.

The loan will be used to rent 14,000 m2 of land on which to grow crops. This year she wants to increase production of grains. Her dream is give her children the basic necessities so they get good jobs. She also wishes to be able to visit the USA and see her son whom she hasn’t seen for a long time.

loans.use: rent 14,000 m2 of land on which to grow crops

loans.name: Melena

texts.en:
Melena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a raising livestock business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her raising livestock business.

Melena has been in this business for 10 years. Melena earns more income from food vending.

Melena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Gofran

texts.en:
Gofran is a 44-year-old married woman from Ramallah City. She is a mother of one son and one daughter. Her husband works as an employee in a local company. Gofran works as a teacher in a public school, where she teaches English. She also gives special lessons at her house.

Gofran took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her business. By taking this loan, Gofran will be able to use new ways of teaching her students.

Gofran appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her business

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Luz es una mujer de 32 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 15, 13 y 10 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando actualmente con su apoyo. Ella es una mujer que pone todo su esfuerzo para sacar adelante a su familia por medio de su negocio de elaboración y venta de platillos típicos actividad que realiza desde hace 1 año, por lo que ya cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Luz siempre pensando en lo mejor para su familia ha tomado la decisión de repellar las paredes de su vivienda, ya que estas son de adobe y se están deteriorando, además el techo de la misma tiene muchas filtraciones que en época de invierno permiten el ingreso de la lluvia deteriorando sus pocas pertenencias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, tejas y láminas para repellar las paredes y cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Luz is a 32-year-old woman who lives in her own home with her life's companion and her three children, ages 15, 13, and 10, who are currently studying with her help. Luz is a woman who puts all her efforts into advancing her family by means of her business, preparing and selling typical dishes, an activity she has performed for the last year. She has already developed a large clientele who solicit her products.

Luz, has always thought of what's best for her family, and has decided to re-finish the walls of her house. Constructed from adobe, the walls are deteriorating. In addition, the roof has lots of holes that, in this winter season, allow rainwater to get in, destroying her few furnishings. 

That's why Luz is requesting a loan through FUSAI, to invest in cement, sand, roofing tiles and laminated metal sheets to re-finish the walls and install a new roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, roofing tiles and laminated sheets to cover the walls and replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man, 35, lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business; she primarily grows rice and sells the crops to local dealers. On average, she is able to make an income of USD $2.00 per day. So far, she has been in this type of business for 10 years.

For supplementary income, she wants to raise a cow and resell it when it is big enough. Because there is not enough money, she is applying for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a cow. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it will help to increase her income. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan entrenched her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for her vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business further if you will let her borrow again an amount of 25,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts of her jeepney. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Teresita wants to become successful both in life and business. She only dreams of a simple yet healthy life for her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her food stall for her vegetable business.

Rosie has been in this business for five years. Rosie earns additional income from a restaurant.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 48 years old and married with seven children. With five children still in school, Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, detergent, coffee, bread, milk, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, etc.

Gemma has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, detergent, coffee, bread, milk, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market for her fish vending business.

Rosita has been in this business for eight years. Rosita earns more income from her general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda is 31 years old and married. She is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Linda has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to sustain her business.

Ma. Linda requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Ma. Linda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 62-year-old widow woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a buy and sell of root crops business in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell.

Rosie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Rosie would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 40 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Marissa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marissa has been in pig fattening for four years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 38 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Natividad has a bamboo strips weaving business in the Philippines. Natividad requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Natividad has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Natividad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a married woman, 36 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jasmin has a buy and sell of ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines. Jasmin requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell like pants, wallets, slippers, etc.

Jasmin has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear clothing to sell like pants, wallets, slippers, etc

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, de 50 años de edad, toda su vida se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos, no tuvo la oportunidad de  estudiar, está casada y junto a su esposo procrearon un hijo, el cual ya tiene 18 años de edad y estudia su último año de bachillerato.

María, tiene tres años de tener tienta y también sale de su casa a vender verduras, para tener ingresos para ayuda en los gastos de su hogar.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar dos terneras  para  cuidarlas, porque tiene terrenos con pastos donde poder alimentarlas, ya que en un futuro le serán de mucha utilidad para las necesidades de su familia.

María, primero quiere ayudarle a su hijo para que continúe con sus estudios, también quiere tener unas cuatro vacas lecheras.
texts.en: María, 50 years old, has worked her entire life at domestic tasks. She had no opportunity to study. She is married and with her husband fathered a son who is now 18 years old and in the final year of a diploma. María has had a shop for 3 years and also leaves home to sell vegetables, to have income and help with her home expenses. The loan is needed to buy two calves to raise, because she has land for grazing where they can feed. In the future they will be very useful for the needs of her family. María first wants to help her son to continue in his studies, and also wants to have four dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gaudiosa works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store.

Gaudiosa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, flour, etc. for her food production business.

Gaudiosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, flour, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, de 44 años de edad, no estudio debido a la falta de recursos económicos, está soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con su mamá. 

Miguel, tiene 8 años de cultivar la tierra, anteriormente trabajo en una panadería, pero decidió mejor dedicarse a la agricultura, que es de donde él obtiene, ingresos para poder suplir sus necesidades. 

El crédito lo necesita para arrendar un terreno para poder cultivar, porque necesita cancelarlo antes de que sea arrendado a otra persona.

Miguel, sueña con formar su propia familia y continuar ayudando a su mamá en lo que pueda.
texts.en:
Miguel, 44 years old, did not study due to a lack of economic resources. He is single, does not have children, and lives with his mother.

Miguel has farmed for eight years. Previously he worked in a bakery, but decided it was better to work in agriculture, as it is where he obtains income to be able to cover his needs.

He needs the loan to rent land to farm because he needs to pay it before it is rented by another person.

Miguel dreams of forming his own family and continuing to help his mother in what he can.

loans.use: to rent land to farm.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 51 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Salvacion has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns income from fish vending. 

Salvacion has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) before this loan. She has requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
Ezequiel, de 42 años de edad, es una persona responsable en sus obligaciones, no asistió a la escuela, está casado, tiene dos hijos, que están estudiando.

Ezequiel, toda su vida ha trabajado en la agricultura, porque fue el rubro que sus papas le enseñaban día a día.- Ahora Ezequiel, cultiva 14,000 metros cuadrados de tierra, para sembrar granos para su alimentación diaria y para vender.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar dos novillas, porque tiene un terreno con mucho pasto donde poder cuidarlas y un en un año poder venderlas, para obtener ganancias.

Ezequiel,  sueña con tener su corral y al menos seis vacas lecheras, ya que de esa manera podrá obtener mejores ingresos y por su puesto ayudar a sus hijos a que terminen sus estudio, para que puedan servir a la sociedad .
texts.en:
Ezequiel, age 42, is a really responsible person regarding his obligations.  He didn’t attend school.  He is married and has two children who are in school.

All his life Ezequiel has worked in agriculture because it is what his parents taught him from day to day.  Now Ezequiel farms 14,000 cubic meters of land, sowing grains for his own daily use and to sell.

He needs this loan to buy two heifers, because he has a plot of land with a lot of grass where he can take care of the heifers.  In a year he will be able to sell them, to get some income.

Ezequiel dreams of having a farmyard with at least six dairy cows because in that way he will be able to get a better income.  Of course, this allows him to help his children to finish their studies, so that they can serve society.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Nyonko-Do Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of four people, who all live in the same neighborhood. They are selling vegetables, towels, curtains, bedspreads, smoke, electrical appliances, and maize.

The group’s representative, Memuna (standing second from left in the photograph), is 38 years old. She did not go to school much. Memuna lives with her husband and her children, all of whom go to school.

Memuna takes care of the household’s varied expenses and supports her husband to take care of the children. To support her family, she has been selling vegetables, dry fish and other foodstuffs in her region for 12 years. Memuna gets her supplies from a market in Accra.

To strengthen her business and meet her clients' demands, Memuna, together with her group, is requesting financial support from ID Ghana for the third time. They will hold each other accountable for the repayment of the loan.

Memuna needs this loan to buy more vegetables, dry fish and other foodstuff to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, dry fish and other foodstuffs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es una mujer de 40 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 2, 10, 15 y 18 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el barrio ‘villa Alegre’ de la zona sur de la ciudad un área caracterizada porque los suelos son arenas, finas y arenas limosas, de clima cálido subtropical donde los meses de mayor precipitación pluvial son enero y febrero, con una temperatura que varía durante en día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Paulina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que trabaja como ayudante de carpintero y con sus hijos; los 3 mayores estudian en la escuela el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional cruceña, como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui), sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), y otros. Actividad que realiza en 2 turnos; uno a la hora de almuerzo y otro a la hora de cena, de lunes a viernes. “tuve otras actividades, pero este negocio es constante la venta se realiza a diario y siempre se acaba toda la comida…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que tiene mucha experiencia en la cocina, la desventaja es la competencia. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante grande y popular, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de un carrito hamburguesero para poder trabajar ambulantemente los fines de semana. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma continua e independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Paulina solicita un préstamo para la compra de un carrito hamburguesero para trabajar de forma ambulante durante los fines de semana.
texts.en:
40-year old Paulina lives with her husband and their four children aged 2, 10, 15, and 18. She earns her living selling traditional food. She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, patient, responsible, and hardworking. Her business is located in the neighbourhood of Villa Alegre in the south part of the town. It is an area known for its fine, sandy soil, and its sub-tropical climate with most rain falling in January and February. During the day the temperature varies between 21 and 35 C.

Paulina is dark skinned and has long black hair which she ties back. Her eyes are dark and she is of short stature. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks at home, but she speaks Spanish for cultural and business purposes. Her husband works as a carpenter’s assistant. Her three older children attend school, but the youngest is not yet of school age. They live in their own house made of bricks and cement with a corrugated sheet roof. They have water, electricity, and a sewage system.

Paulina makes traditional food from the Santa Cruz area: majadito de charque (dried meat, rice, fried egg and bananas), sopa de remojada (soup made from bones), cogote relleno (stuffed chicken neck), groundnut soup etc. She works two shifts, one to cover the lunch hour and one the supper hour, Monday to Friday.

She said that she had other jobs but this is a business with regular daily sales and her customers always finish the food. Her big advantage is that she has a lot of cooking experience; her disadvantage is the number of competitors. Pauline’s dream is to open a big popular restaurant. 

She now wishes to expand her business by obtaining a loan so she can buy a hamburger cart so she can walk through the streets with it at weekends. This is her first loan with this institution in the four years she has had her food business.

loans.use: buy a hamburger cart so she can walk through the streets with it at weekends

loans.name: Samoeurn

texts.en:
Samoeurn, 36, is a married man who lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has three children in total. 

To make a living and support his family, he works as a construction worker and earns, on average, an earning of 7 USD per day. So far, he has been in this career for almost ten years. Beside this, he also has a small rice farmland where he operates a farming business seasonally.

The current farmland that he owns is small, and it can provide less benefit to him. He wants to enlarge his farmland area, but he can’t afford to. Therefore, now he would like to get a Kiva loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice. 

He hopes this additional farmland will help to improve his living condition. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in mangoes, cashews, “morro” seeds [a native fruit], lemons, and milk.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. Juliet is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

She requested a 12,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of flour, margarine, yeast, sugar, and other items.

Juliet has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of flour, margarine, yeast, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, de 31 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora y responsable, solo estudio hasta tercer grado, porque su familia no tenía los recursos suficientes, para seguir ayudándole, por eso se dedicó a la agricultura junto a su padre, luego un amigo le enseño el oficio de la albañilería.- Hoy en día está casado y tiene dos hijos, que están estudiado.

Víctor, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la albañilería y a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad y de estas dos actividades él obtenía los ingresos suficientes para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar una motocicleta, para poderse transportarse de su casa a su trabajo, ya que muchas veces, tiene que ir a trabajar lejos.

Víctor, desea ayudar a sus hijos a que continúen estudiando y que se preparen académicamente y tengan una vida más tranquila, que la que el tuvo.
texts.en:
Víctor, 31 years old, is a hardworking and responsible person. He went to school only up until the third grade, because his family didn't have sufficient resources to continue helping him. For this reason, he worked in farming with his father, and then a friend taught him masonry. Today he is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.

Víctor has worked in masonry for 10 years, and in agriculture since he was 12 years old. From these two activities, he has been obtaining enough income to cover the needs of his family.

He needs the loan to buy a motorcycle in order to get to work from his house, since he often has to work far from home.

Víctor wants to help his children to continue their studies, to prepare themselves academically, and to have a more tranquil life than he has had.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 55 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, and other items.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, and other items

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 48 years old and single with one child, who is still in school. Rosalie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Rosalie has been in this business for four years. 

Rosalie requested a 18,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, detergent, coffee, milk, sugar, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, detergent, coffee, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is taking a loan of $1,500 to improve her business. She is married, and she has three children. 

She is running a food stall that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy items such as meat, beef, pork and chicken. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.

She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy meat, beef, pork and chicken.

loans.name: Tracy Briggit

texts.es:
Briggit vive en el departamento de Cochabamba – Bolivia, es la penúltima hija de siete hermanos, su mamá realiza trabajos temporales de repostería y su papá está jubilado. 
Briggit comenta que estudió la carrera que más le apasiona que es Contaduría Pública, pero hasta el día de hoy no pudo obtener su titulación ya que empezó a trabajar como Auditor Financiero, para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ella se considera una persona estudiosa, trabajadora y perseverante, por lo que solicita un crédito educativo para culminar sus estudios y así obtener su titulación.Su sueño es conseguir un mejor cargo en la empresa que trabaja, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su situación económica y ayudar en su hogar, haciéndose cargo de sus papas y apoyando a sus hermanos.
Briggit agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a los jóvenes y generan nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento.
texts.en:
Briggit lives in the department of Cochabamba – Bolivia. She is the next-to-last daughter of seven siblings. Her mother carries out seasonal baking jobs and her father is retired.

Briggit studied the major that inspires her the most and that is Public Accounting. However, to this day, she could not obtain her degree since she started working as a Financial Auditor to economically support her family. She considers herself a studious person, hardworking, and persevering. She requests an educational loan in order to finalize her studies and in that way obtain her degree. Her dream is to achieve a better position in the business where she works, which will help her improve her economic situation and help at home, looking after her parents and supporting her siblings. 

Briggit thanks the people who, through their economic resources, help young people and create new opportunities for growth.

loans.use: to pay for her Public Accounting degree.

loans.name: Maria Celina

texts.es: Maria vive encasa propia con sus dos nietos, ella se dedica a trabajar como agricultora especialmente a la siembra de maíz, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en esa actividad, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside y ya tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria lives in her own home with her two grandchildren. She works in agriculture, especially the planting of corn. She has ten years of experience in this business. She sells her products in the surrounding areas of her zone where she resides, and she already has many customers. With what she obtains from her sales, she is able to cover some household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as: seed, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicide, etc. to be able to continue with her crops and in that way be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as: seed, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una sala de belleza cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: The young woman's face has been pixelated because she is 22 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. She owns a beauty salon close to her home in a busy area. She has many customers because of her good work. With what she obtains from her earnings she aims to pay for some living expenses. The woman is a single mother in her own home with her son. She is applying for a loan to buy creams, shampoo, hairpins, and scissors, among other products that she needs, and in this way obtain better profits that will help them to have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase creams, shampoos, hairpins, and scissors, among other goods

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: Jose de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica  a la siembra de maíz y frijol, tiene 28 años de dedicarse a esas actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia y con las ganancias que obtiene es como ha logrado salir adelante, el esta solicitando u crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y herbicidas para poder tener una mejor cosecha y asi tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Jose is 62 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife. He makes a living growing corn and beans. He has spent 28 years working in this activity, which he started with his own money. He sells his products in different markets located near his place of residence. It is with the profits that he obtains that he has achieved success. He is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to be able to have a better crop and in this way greater economic earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la veta de ropa de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados y colonias, tiene 3 años de dedicare a la venta la cual le genera buenas ganancias, y con esas ganancias es como logra salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa para damas y caballeros todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been blurred is 26, and lives in a high risk area.  She is a street vendor, selling clothing throughout various markets and communities.  She has been engaged in this business for three years, which generates good profits, and this is how she manages to get ahead.  The young woman lives in her own home with her life partner and daughter.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale men’s and women’s clothing, which will enable her to continue selling and thus, earn better profits..

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale men’s and women’s clothing.

loans.name: Kakda

texts.en:
Kakda, 29, is residing in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. She has two children. 

To make a living and support her family, she works in a private garment factory. So far, she has been in this career for five years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 7.60 a day. 

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. 

She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is into buying and selling a of variety vegetables in the public market. She has been in this kind of business for 30 years.

Catalina is 54 years of age, married, and had three children. With her hard work and patience, she was able to keep her business profitable.

Now, she's hoping for continuous growth of her buy and sell vegetable business.

To maintain her business, she is seeking financial assistance from lenders amounting to 4,000 PHP.

She hopes that lenders will approve her requested loan.

loans.use: to buy a variety vegetables such as bitter gourd, eggplant and string beans

loans.name: Baby Chona

texts.en:
Baby Chona is 56 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Baby Chona has a general store business in the Philippines. Baby Chona requested a 15,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, candies, noodles, sanitary pads, diapers, bath soap, toothpaste, and other items to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Baby Chona has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, candies, noodles, sanitary pads, diapers, bath soap, toothpaste, and other items to sell

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro, de 42 años de edad, por falta de interés de sus padres no lo pusieron a estudiar, está casado, tiene dos hijos. 

Pedro, prácticamente toda su vida se ha dedicado a la ganadería, aprendió el oficio gracias a sus padres; ahora día a día sale al campo a negociar su ganado, para poder obtener ingresos.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar cuatro terneros para poder cuidarlos y venderlo después de un tiempo, para que le generen una buena ganancia. 

Pedro, sueña con tener un gran hato de ganado y que su corral este bien establecido, para que sus ganancias sean mayores, ya que de esa manera podrá ayudar a sus hijos a que terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
Pedro is 42 years old. Due to his parents' lack of interest, he was not put in school. Pedro is married and has two children. 

Pedro has worked raising livestock for practically his entire life. He learned the work thanks to his parents. Now, everyday he leaves for the field to work with his livestock in order to earn a living. 

He needs the loan to buy four calves to raise them and sell them after a time, in order to generate good profits. 

Pedro dreams of having a large herd of cattle and a well-established farm so that his earnings will be greater, since this is the way he will be able to support his children so that they may complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy four calves so that he may be raise them and sell them after a time

loans.name: Ivan Rodrigo

texts.es:
Ivan es un joven de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba- Bolivia, trabaja como vendedor en una tienda de repuestos para autos en el centro de la ciudad, los ingresos que percibe le sirven para mantenerse y ayudar a su familia. Su mamá trabaja en una heladería y su papá es albañil y sus cuatro hermanos pequeños siguen en colegio.
Ivan comenta que cuando terminó el colegio, tuvo que trabajar inmediatamente por lo que postergo sus estudios universitarios, por tal motivo ahora decidió iniciar sus estudios en la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, por lo que solicita un crédito educativo, de esta manera podrá cumplir su sueño de ser una excelente profesional para poder dar apoyo económico a su familia. Lo que más anhela es  crear su propia de empresa para poder brindar una mejor vida a sus hermanos menores.
Ivan de antemano agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a otros y generan nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento, así como a él se le están otorgando ahora.
texts.en:
Ivan is a young man of 21 years. He lives in the city of Cochabamba, Bolivia. He works as a salesperson in a store selling spare parts for cars in the center of the city. The earnings he makes help him to support himself and help his family. His mother works in an ice cream shop and his father is a construction worker. His four siblings are in school. 

Ivan says that when he finished high school, he had to work immediately so he postponed his university studies. For this reason he now decided to start his studies in Industrial Engineering, and so he is applying for an educational loan. In this way he will be able to achieve his dream of being an excellent professional in order to help support his family financially. What he longs for most is to start his own company to be able to provide a better life for his younger siblings. 

Ivan thanks in advance the people who help others through their resources and create new opportunities for growth, and to the one which they are contributing to now.

loans.use: to pay for his studies in Industrial Engineering

loans.name: Camra

texts.en:
Camra is 49 years old and has six children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Camra requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional varieties of seeds for farming vegetables.

Camra has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Camra would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of seeds for farming vegetables.

loans.name: Kemhim's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Kemhim is 51 years old. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school.

For her family condition, she grows rice as the main source of income. She has been involved in this business for 33 years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 37,700 KHR per day.

This is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), as she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads the group of six to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide, fertilizer, and rice seed to support her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions to be better than before.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, fertilizer, and rice seed to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San, 30, lives in a rural area of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has two children who are currently in school. To make a living and support his family, he works as an electrician. So far, he has been in this career for ten years. On average, he is able to make earnings of USD 5.00 a day.

He is residing a little bit far from a water source so it is hard and time consuming for him to get water. For this reason, he is applying for a Kiva loan to dig a well for household use. With the supporting of this loan, he hopes that he can get water for use more easily and spend a shorter time getting it than before.

He is thankful for the lenders for their financial support towards poor people.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Las Cinco Mujeres Group

texts.es: Cinco mujeres emprendedoras se unieron y formar un grupo al que llamaron “Las Cinco Mujeres” y así solicitar por primera ocasión el financiamiento en ADIM con el objetivo de capitalizar sus negocios, quien lo coordina es Mireya una mujer que tiene la edad de 46 años y se dedica a comercializar especies en departamentos de la región norte del país, este negocio lo impulsó hace dieciséis años con ayuda financiera de su esposo, este crédito lo invertirá en canela, manzanilla, algodón, achote, clavo de olor, pimienta de chapa, punto azul, etc., una de sus metas es abrir nuevas vías para comercializar sus productos y confiada en Dios en que este préstamo será uno de los muchos que le permitirá cumplir sus metas, y así ofrecerles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. El resto de las integrantes son, Esperanza una señora que a sus 54 años demuestra que la edad no es motivo para dejar de trabajar, comercializa perecederos en el mercado de Masaya y cuenta con una experiencia de quince años, María una mujer de 44 años que comercializa especies en algunos departamentos del país, Juana una mujer ejemplar que a sus 70 años, se dedica  a la hecha y venta de tortillas, este negocio lo impulsó hace veinte años, y Yeslenia una joven que tiene la edad de 21 años, quien desde muy joven aprendió los oficios de lo que es el comercio, se dedica a comercializa especies en departamentos del país.
texts.en:
Five enterprising women united to form a lending group called "The Five Women" so that they could request financing from ADIM and thereby capitalize on their businesses. 

Mireya is the group coordinator; she is 46 years old and makes a living selling goods in the northern region of the country. She started this business 16 years ago with financial support from her husband. She will invest this loan in cinnamon, chamomile, cotton, annatton, cloves, black pepper kernels, "punto azul" [literally translating to "blue point"], etc. One of her goals is to open new routes and means to trade her products. She trusts in God that this first loan will be one of many that permits her to reach her goals. In doing this, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life.

The group also includes member Esperanza, who is 54 years old and demonstrates that age is not a reason to stop working; she works selling perishable goods in the Masaya market, and has been doing this for the past 15 years. Maria is 44 years old and sells goods in a few different areas in the country. Juana is an exemplary woman who, at 70 years old, makes a living making and selling tortillas; she began this work 20 years ago. Yeslenia is a young 21-year-old woman who learned at a very young age all about trade; she also makes a living selling goods in different departments throughout the country.

loans.use: to buy goods like cotton, annatton, cloves, black pepper kernels, "punto azul", etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chickens and feed concentrate to grow them

loans.name: Joel Adonay

texts.es: Joel de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up desde hace 10 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo una fosa séptica y el baño en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para l compra de los materiales necesarios como: cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro, laminas y pago de mano de obra para poder realizar la obra y asi el y su esposa puedan vivir mas cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en: Joel, 46, lives in his own home with his wife.  For ten years, he has been engaged in making trips with his pick-up, and manages to pay for some household expenses with the earnings from his job.  He wishes to improve his home by building a septic tank and bathroom in the place shown in the photo.  However, the money he earns in sales is not enough to complete this project.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase the needed materials such as cement, sand, bricks, iron, and laminated sheets, and to pay labor costs to complete this project. In this way, he and his wife can live more comfortably, and in sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase the needed materials such as cement, sand, bricks, iron, and laminated sheets, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is married with five children, and the family lives in Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. She is a diligent and persevering mother when it comes to the welfare of her family, and she has always been known to provide the best for them.

Genara is earning a living by making snacks that she sells on consignment in shops and cafés. She decided to expand her business after learning that she could obtain financial assistance through PMPC. Consequently, she has requested a 14,900 PHP loan to buy additional ingredients to increase production. Her goal is to be able to display her snacks in every shop and place to eat in the area.

With the help and support of her husband, Genara smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for the snacks she makes and sells.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 53 years old and married. She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Editha is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Editha has been farming bananas for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Segunda

texts.en:
Segunda is 56 years old and married with six children. With two children still in school, Segunda works very hard to provide for them.

Segunda runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cooking oil, canned goods, shampoo, cereals, coffee, biscuits, soft-drinks, etc. Segunda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Segunda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eliana Acenet

texts.es:
Eliana es una mujer de campo soltera y ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de pollos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos pollos para cría y materiales para la construcción de un galpón.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en: Eliana is an unmarried country woman, and has been through many hardships in her life.  However, she has always had the strength to move forward and continue progressing with her family.  For a long time, she has wanted to start a business raising and selling chickens.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase some chickens to breed and materials to build a barn.  With this new business, she will be able to generate income for her family, which is everything to her, and she will be able to improve her parents’ quality of life. She works every day to promote her business, and make it a sustainable and profitable activity.  Please support a hardworking woman with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase some chickens to breed and materials to build a barn.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor operates her hog-raising business in Oroquieta, an enterprise that enables her to support her family. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. 

Eleonor is diligent about both her business and her membership in PMPC, as the latter provides for her financing needs. She has requested this loan of Php 30,000 to help her build a concrete pig pen that will improve sanitation and allow for additional heads of pigs.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig pen

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Solidad works hard to support her family. She has a seafood vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Solidad is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more seafood like shells, seaweed, etc. to sell for her seafood vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Solidad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood like shells, seaweed, etc. to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analiza is 42 years old and has two children who are presently in school.

Analiza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Bertha Miryam

texts.es:
Bertha, con 48 años de edad, se ha dedicado por muchos años a vender abarrotes en una tienda en el municipio de Santa Barbara; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto lo impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar una vitrina y comprará surtido al por mayor como mecato, gaseosas, dulces, productos de panadería, entre otros, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y tendrá más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a los clientes, mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos.

Bertha manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir un local propio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad para montar su negocio y lograr que sea mucho más rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Ella confía en el apoyo de la Corporación interactuar y en los prestamistas de Kiva para lograr este objetivo.
texts.en:
For many years, Bertha, 48, has been engaged in selling groceries in a store in the town of Santa Barbara.  In this way, she supplements her income, with which she has gotten her children ahead.

Her tenacity and perseverance have enabled her to strive tirelessly, always looking for a way to get ahead.  This propelled her to request the loan to purchase a display cabinet, and she will purchase wholesale stock such as cake, soda, candy, baked goods, and other products.  This will allow her to continue with her work, and she will have a wider variety of products to offer her customers and, in this way, continue improving sales and income.

Bertha says that her greatest dream is to be able to acquire her own local in the city center to establish her business, and make it much more profitable.  This will guarantee her favorable financial stability, and provide her family with a better quality of life.  She trusts in the institution’s support, and in the Kiva loans to achieve this goal.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale stock such as cake, soda, candy, baked goods, and other products. ,

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth de 29 años de edad, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. 

Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital, esta mujer inició con un negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de estanterías para ubicar sus productos y hacerlos más visibles y atractivos a sus clientes, además comprara surtido de productos de la canasta familiar para abastecer su negocio. 

Espera poder mejorar su condición económica, poder tener una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias y garantizarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 29 years old. She has won the love of all of her neighbors because of her kindness and good sense of humor. She loves her family, which is the primary reason she fights everyday and generate sustenance to survive. 

Although she didn’t have resources to start her business, this was a barrier to achieve her dream of becoming a businesswoman. With her little capital, this woman started a grocery story business. 

Her dreams don’t stop. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in buying shelves on which to put her products and make them visible and attractive to her clients. In addition, she will buy a supply of family food products to stock up her business. 

She hopes to be able to improve her financial condition, so that she can have an old age without money concerns and to guarantee her family a better future.

loans.use: to buy a supply of family food products to stock up her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de granos básicos, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en el cultivo su padre fue quien le enseño el trabajo de la siembra, el joven vive en casa propia con su hija, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, fertilizantes, etc. y mejora el terreno que muestra en la  fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man, whose face has been pixelated, is 23 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He is dedicated to agriculture and grows basic grains. He has 5 years old experience in farming. His father was the one that taught him this work. The young man lives in his own house with his daughter.

He is requesting a loan to buy manure, disease controls, herbicides, fertilizers, etc. and to improve the land, which is shown in the photograph, so that he can continue with his work and, thus, have a better income.

loans.use: to buy manure, disease controls, herbicides, fertilizers, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Aydar

texts.ru: Его зовут Айдар. Она веселый, добрый отзывчивый житель маленького района Хуросон. Ему 49 лет. Айдар работает строителем, ремонтирует дороги. Айдар женат и имеет двое сыновей. Он также заботиться о пожилой матери. Айдару необходимо найти другой источник дохода, потому что его зарплата не позволяет ему прокормить родных. Айдар принял решение обратиться за кредитом и открыть свой продуктовый магазин. Он выбрал МДО "Хумо" потому, что это организация поддерживает начинающий предпринимателей и помогает составить бизнес план. Айдар уже нашел помещение, поставил стеллажи, и ему осталось только купить товар. Он планирует привести товар за счет заемных средств. Поддержите Айдар в его начинаниях.
texts.en: Meet Aydar, a happy, kind and generous resident of the small Khuroson district.  Aydar is 49 years old and works in construction, repairing roads.  He is married and he has two sons.  He's also taking care of his elderly mother.  Aydar absolutely needs to find another source of income because his salary is not enough to feed his family.  For this reason, he has decided to take a loan and to open his own grocery store.  He chose MLO Humo because this organization supports aspiring entrepreneurs and helps them to make a business plan.  Aydar has already found a store, he has equipped it with some racks, and now only has to buy merchandise.  He plans to use his loan to bring in food products.  Please support him in his new endeavor.

loans.use: to buy food products and open a grocery store.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Married to a farmer and blessed with four grown-up children, Milagros has owned and operated her variety store for one year. She is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 to buy grocery items such as assorted biscuits, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks and canned goods to sell. These purchases will improve both her business and her income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta started her small business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. 

Every day she has made good sales since she is the only store in their barangay. Recently she approached Paglaum for much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, etc.

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
Clarissa signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

She was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

In the future she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Veata

texts.en:
Veata is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Veata is 42 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Veata requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Veata would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 33 years old and married with two children.

Francisca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Francisca has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Francisca aspires to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Luisa is 54 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Luisa has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell like potatoes, onions, garlic, peppers, chili, etc.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for 23 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell like potatoes, onions, garlic, peppers, chili, etc

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Glenda has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en:
Ma. Lina works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Sreynak

texts.en:
A mother of three schoolchildren living in Kratie province, Sreynak is 36 years old. For her living, she grows cassava as a single main source of income. 

She has been involved this business for ages and earns about 40,300 KHR per day. This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully paid back her past loan completely. 

She will spend her loan to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more income to support her children’s studying.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en: A local farmer from the Kampong Cham province, Ren is 53 years old and the mother of one child. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice and is a primary physician. She earns about 10 USD per day to support her cost of living. For Ren, this is not her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. She will spend her loan portion to pay tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in nursing. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in nursing

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Hart's Group

texts.en: A villager living in Dambae district of the Kampong Cham province, Hart is 28 years old and is the mother of three children. Three of her children are dependent on her and still in school. To improve her family’s living, she grows cassava and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. For Hart, this is her third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads the group of five to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and plow her rice field. She hopes that she can expand her current business and earn more income to improve her family conditions so they are better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and plow her rice field

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is from Oroquieta City, Philippines. He is married and has four children. Ernesto joined PMPC and he appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. 

The co-op supported him by providing the capital to start his retailing business, helping the family survive. Fortunately, he makes promising sales every day and is able to save from it. 

Ernesto keeps on running the business well, to continuously provide for his family. He believes that with their support, they will keep going and sustain the business. 

Ernesto wishes to have safe and comfortable living quarters, with a house constructed with a durable ceiling and walls. 

He has applied for a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy additional construction materials for the completion of his house, like bags of cement and floor tiles. 

Ernesto wants nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life with his family.

loans.use: to buy additional construction materials for the completion of his house, like bags of cement and floor tiles

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is from Oroquieta. She is 43 years old. She and her partner have four adult children. 

She joined Paglaum MPC in 2010, and she appreciates the co-op's programs and services. 

For a living, she engages in selling assorted fruits and vegetables in different barangays in the city and nearby towns. 

She has used her motorcycle as her only source of transportation. Her husband is the driver, enabling her to reach the different barangays to sell her fruits and vegetables. This source of income has existed for 4 years now. 

As Alma needed additional working capital, she requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in an amount of 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase more stock of assorted fruits and vegetables for resale. 

Through this purchase, she hopes to increase her income so she is able to provide for her family's daily needs. In the future, she hopes to arrange for a decent house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of assorted fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Cheery

texts.en:
Cheery is a hardworking mother of one child. Her feeds business is blessed because of her good management. Her previous loan from Paglaum Cooperative paid off in only two months. Cheery is very happy seeing the progress of her business, and she hired store assistants who work for her. 

Cheery has applied for her third cycle loan from Paglaum amounting to 50,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional stock of feeds. She plans to sell wholesale to the piggeries of the nearest village where her business is located. Cheery hopes and prays that her business will still progress so that she can hire an additional boy to assist with the business.

loans.use: to buy additional bulk feeds for retail and wholesale

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.en: Eleuterio, a carpenter, is married and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta, Philippines. For a living, he cultivates a small rice land for their consumption, and he also has a coco land. Eleuterio has been doing this for 25 years. He hopes to live comfortably, with simple yet comfortable living quarters for all of those in the family. Therefore, he applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for house repair and expansion. Eleuterio is a new member of PMPC. In the future, he hopes to save money for future emergencies. He wants nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for house repair and expansion

loans.name: Amado

texts.en:
Amado is married and lives in Layawan, Oroquieta City. He earns a living through agriculture, focusing on farming and hog raising. He also operates a small sari-sari (general) store. As the responsible father of his children and loving grandfather to his grand children, he believes education is the key to succeed in life. 

Amado hopes to provide for his family's needs. With the loan of 5,000 PHP he will be able to support and pay for the tuition fees of his granddaughter. He wants nothing more than to see all of those in the family be happy and live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his granddaughter.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, 57, is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Aneceto and has three children, of which two are already working and the youngest is in high school. She manages her household while operating a business. She works hard to augment her income to support and meet the family's daily personal and household needs.

Violeta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store that sells fresh, dry and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 1,000 PHP per day. 

To help her continue the operations of her general store business, Violeta is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as rice, canned goods, instant noodles, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are the family's source to meet their daily expenses and to send her child to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Violeta hopes to maintain and grow her business so they can have a better life. She desires and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can, also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is a hardworking and persevering mother, who always knows to provide her family with the best. Marites wants all her children to earn a degree and become successful in their chosen fields. With the loan of 12,000 PHP she will be able to pay for the school tuition of her daughter. She deeply wishes to live a happy and healthy life, where her children will have stable jobs.

loans.use: to pay for the school tuition of her daughter.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years. Amada earns more income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store. 

Amada has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlene is 42 years old and has one child in school.

Arlene has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell in her food stall.

Arlene has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Racquel

texts.en:
Racquel is 52 years old and married with 9 children.

Racquel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, candies, shampoo, fabric and hair conditioners, salt, eggs, coffee, etc. to sell.

Racquel has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Racquel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, candies, shampoo, fabric and hair conditioners, salt, eggs, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Araceli is 43 years old and has two children who are in school.

Araceli has a bakery business in the Philippines. Araceli requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Araceli has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Araceli would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 64 years old and has six children. Teresita is married and has children who are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Teresita has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 36 years old and married. 

Shiela is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Shiela requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Shiela has been in the pig fattening business for three years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Shiela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Conchita is 41 years old and has five children who are in school.

Conchita has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy gallons of coconut wine to sell in her business.

Conchita has been in this business for one year. In the future, Conchita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy galloons of coconut wine to sell in her business

loans.name: Siem

texts.en:
Siem, 47, lives with family members in a rural area of the Kratie province. She is the mother of seven children. 

She grows rice as the main source of income. Moreover, she can earn more income via fishing. 

For Siem, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully paid back her past loan completely. 

She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Erna Leigh

texts.en:
Erna Leigh works hard to support her family. Erna Leigh is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Erna Leigh has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.ru: Машхура, 43 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. На протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, мастер в своем деле. По хозяйству активно помогает вся семья. Образование у Машхуры среднее. Начала бизнес с 2,000 сом (KGS) и достигла больших успехов. В хозяйстве имеет 1 дойную корову с теленком. Также есть земельный надел мерою 0,18 Га и арендованный участок - 0,30 Га, где выращивает кукурузу и картофель. Машхура обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян картофеля. Она является лидером группы "Чертик-1"всего в группе 3 человека. На доходы от кредита Машхура хочет расширить свое хозяйство, а также накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Mashkhura is 43 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for many years, and is an expert in her field.  Her family actively help her with the farm work. Mashkhura has a secondary education.  She started her own farming business with an initial amount of 2,000 som (KGS) and has been very successful.  She currently owns one dairy cow with her calf.  She also owns 0.18 hectare of land and rents another 0.3 hectare on which she grows corn and potatoes.

Mashkhura has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and is taking a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizers and potato seeds.  She is the leader of the "Chertik-1" group, which comprises a total of three members.  She wants to use the earnings from her loan to expand her farming business and to save enough money toward her son's wedding.
