loans.use: to buy fertilizers and potato seeds in order to grow organic crops.

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra is 60 years old and married with five children. She earns a living through her pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for 30 years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Silvestra is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Belinda is 49 years old and three of her children are in school. Belinda has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy the materials needed for her business, such as nail cutters, etc.

Belinda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed for her business, such as nail cutters, etc.

loans.name: Phoeurt

texts.en: A resident from Battambang province, Phoeurt is 37 years old and a mother of two schoolchildren. Nowadays, she grows cassava on two hectares area and works for others for a fee to earn more income. This is Phoeurt's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She will spend her entire loan portion to renovate her house. She hopes that she can get a decent house which is better than before.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area in Battambang province, Mom is 37 years old and a mother of six children. She can earn income to support her living via growing cassava on 1.5 hectares area and soybeans on 2 hectares area. Moreover, she can earn more income via growing corn and working for others for a fee. This is Mom's eighth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Sreypov's Group

texts.en: A villager living in Kratie province, Sreypov is 29 years old and a mother of a young child. To pay for her family’s living expenses, she grows cassava and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has been involved this business for ages. This Sreypov's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer and pay for a plowing fee. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer and pay for a plowing fee.

loans.name: Hor's Group

texts.en: Hor, 32, lives with two children in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. Both of her children are dependent on her and still in school. To pay for her family's expenses, she grows rice on one hectare area and works for others for a fee to earn more income. Her current business earns her family about 33,300 KHR per day. This is Hor's fifth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads the group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed to support her business. She hopes that she can improve her farmland to get a higher yield, to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seed to support her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en: An old mother of two children living in Battambang province, Run is 63 years old. Because of her family's condition, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns her about 43,300 KHR per day. This is Run's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and pay for a land fee. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and pay for a land fee.

loans.name: Waheeda

texts.en:
Waheeda is a 40-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has been running a general store for one year. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Waheeda's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. But, due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all the above products to resell. 

Therefore Waheeda has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all of these commodities and will also be helpful for him to earn a maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Waheeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business

loans.name: Edelmira De Jesus

texts.es: Edelmira de 43 años de edad se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposo y su hija  en casa propia, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Edelmira, age 43, has been growing corn and beans for 20 years.  She sells her products at the different markets that are close to her house.  She lives with her husband and her daughter in her own house.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and pesticides, etc. and to improve the land shown in the photo.  She will do this in order to be able to continue with her work and to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and pesticides, etc. and to improve the land shown in the photo.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y jocotes, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, comercializa sus cultivos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de su ventas ayuda en los gastos del hogar, el joven vive con sus padres en casa de ellos,  el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para preparar la tierra donde desea cultivar que es la que muestra la fotografía y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos par seguir ayudando en su hogar.
texts.en: The young man who has a blurred face is 23 years old and lives in a high risk area. He works cultivating basic grains and plums. He has spent 6 years working on this activity. He sells his harvests in the different markets that can be found near his home. He uses what he obtains from his sales to help with the expenses of his household. This young man lives with his parents in their home. He is seeking a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, etc. to prepare the soil where he wants to plant, which is shown in the photo. This way he will be able to obtain better economic earnings to continue supporting his home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Elona

texts.en:
Elona, age 48, is happy tending her little store.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. 

The store is her means of earning a living to support  her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and she makes good daily sales.  Elona is able to run the store well in spite of increased competition from other stores.   Elona believes that with PMPC's support, she will sustain her business and beat the competition.  

Elona has reached her 4th year as a member to Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for 14,900 PHP for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. "Its already tested", she said.  She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and provide a good education  for her children.

loans.use: to buy grocery store stock items.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita signed up for her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Nelita is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, Nelita took out a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita enthusiastically manages her farming activities to support her family. She is a 66-year-old widow who provides for the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC to provide the capital to support her farming activities. Margarita wants to live in a decent and comfortable house.  She will use the loan to buy sticks, nails, and marine plywood to repair her house. 

In the future, Margarita wishes to buy additional agricultural land to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sticks, nails, and marine plywood.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel has been engaged in fish selling for almost five years in doing this type of job. Fish selling is her primary source of income and supports the daily expenses of her two college students.  

Isabel has been a member of Paglaum for three years because of the programs and services offered to the members.  

Isabel applied for a loan with Paglaum to buy additional stock of fish to sell. Isabel is hoping that someday, she can see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fish

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
In 2011, Tita learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. Tita tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Tita borrowed another amount to pay labor for plowing the land for her squash garden. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Tita looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay labor for plowing the land for her squash garden

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia has always had the enthusiasm for managing her farming activities, from which she earns a meager income to help her husband in support of their family. She busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She never stopped pursuing her goals for the benefit of the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her farming activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for the labor cost in land preparation for growing her crops. In the future, Virginia wishes to supply her produce to any marketplace in the province.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost in land preparation for growing her crops

loans.name: Savin's Group

texts.en:
Savin, a local residing in Battambang province, is 44 years old and the mother of five dependent children. She earns income to improve her living by growing sesame on a 2.5 hectare area. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 43,800 riels per day. 

For Savin, this is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed and pay for labor and plowing land. She hopes that she can get more income than last year.

loans.use: To buy seed and pay for labor and plowing land.

loans.name: Odinahan

texts.ru: Одинахан 44 года, замужем, мать 3 дочерей. У нее среднее образование, на сегодняшний день занимается полеводством и животноводством, в хозяйстве есть корова, а на 0,09 Га она выращивает картофель для реализации.  Бизнес начала с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду Одинахан достигла хороших успехов. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и семян картофеля. Она является участником группы "Чертик-1", всего их трое. Доходы от кредита Одинахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своей деятельности, она мечтает купить легковой автомобиль для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Odinahan is 44 years old and the married mother of three daughters.  She has a secondary education.  She is currently involved in agriculture and animal husbandry.  She has one cow on her farm and she grows potatoes for resale on 0.09 hectare of land.  She started her own business with an initial capital of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she has been quite successful.

Odinahan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and is taking a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizers and potato seeds.  She is a member of the "Chertik-1" group which comprises a total of three people.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her activity.  She is also dreaming of buying a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers to cultivate her land and grow organic crops.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy an additional new fishing net for her fishing business. Melba has been in this business for four years. Melba earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional new fishing net

loans.name: Nurtozhihon

texts.ru: Нуртожихон 49 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. У Нуртожихон среднее образование, свой бизнес она начинала 10 лет назад с 7,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Нуртожихон и ее семьи, хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает 1 дойную корову с теленком, 3 бычка. Также есть 0,27 ГА поливной земли, где Нуртожихон выращивает картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы и удобрений для обработки почвы. Нуртожихон является участником группы "Чертик-1", всего в группе 3 человека. Доходы от кредита Нуртожихон планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, а в ближайшем будущем хочет отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Nurtozhihon is 49 years old, married, and she raises three children.  She has a secondary education.  She started her own business ten years ago with an initial capital of 7,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her own very hard work and that of her family, she currently has one dairy cow with her calf and three young bulls.  She also owns 0.27 hectare of irrigated land on which she grows potatoes.

Eager to further develop her farming business, Nurtozhihon has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and is taking a loan of 35,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy one dairy cow and some fertilizers to prepare her land.  She is a member of the "Chertik-1" group, which comprises a total of three people.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business.  In the future, she wants to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow to produce and sell organic milk, and to buy fertilizers to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has had a fishing business for 3 years.

She requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fish nets and materials to repair her boat.  

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and materials to repair her boat.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 48 years old and married with five children, two attend school.

She works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store for 10 years to sell shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, and noodles.

Helen has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF. She earns an additional income from providing motorcycle transportation services.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, and noodles.

loans.name: Yoeung's Group

texts.en:
Yoeung, from Battambang province, is 33 years old and the mother of two schoolchildren. 

To support her family, she grows cassava and works for others for a fee. She has been involved in this business for ages, and she earns her about 44,200 KHR per day. 

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. In her group of two members, she is the group leader. 

Yoeung will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed and pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can earn more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy seed and pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Chury's Group

texts.en:
Chury is 27 years old and the mother of two schoolchildren.  She and her family live in Battambang province.

Chury grows cassava on two hectares area as her main source of income. Moreover, she can earn extra income by working for others for a fee. She can earn about 41,100 KHR per day. 

For Chury, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan, choosing wisely to improve her living conditions at a gradual pace. 

She leads a group of two to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed and to pay plowing fees. 

She hopes that she can get more income to improve her lifestyle to better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 51-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of four sons. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly. Because of this, her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible; however, due to lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of the repairs. 

Therefore, Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Yasmeen is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela is a 38-year-old woman and a mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a hotel. He sells different types of eatable items, e.g., chicken karahi, beef karahi, matan karahi, etc. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Raheela's husband needs to purchase different types of eatable and other items for his business purpose so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in the condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore, Raheela has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's hotel (small restaurant) business

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun is a 55-year-old  mother of four children who resides in Battambang province. She  supports her two schoo-aged children and grows cassava on five hectares as the main source of income. She works for others for a fee to supplement her income. 

This is her fourth loan cycle for Oun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her previous loans successfully. She leads a group of three.

 She will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed and pay for plowing. She hopes that she can earn more income to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy seed and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Sreyrath's Group

texts.en:
Sreyrath, 33, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province.  She has two school-aged children. She  earns income to support her family by growing cassava and selling groceries. She also works for others for a fee to earn extra income. 

This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid  previous loans. She leads a 2-member group to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed, pay  labor costs,  and plowing fees. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy seed, pay  labor costs, and plowing fees.

loans.name: Rosa Amanda

texts.es: Rosa de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica desde hace 14 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, y ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa is 49 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and her daughter. She has worked in agriculture for 14 years cultivating corn and beans. She sells her products in the surrounding towns. Currently, she has many steady customers. With the earnings she obtains from her sales she is able to get ahead. Rosa is seeking a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, herbicides, etc. to improve the land that is shown in the photograph in order to continue with her harvests because they are her only source of work, and to obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, herbicides, etc. to improve the land.

loans.name: Agapito

texts.en:
Agapito is 64 years old. He is a widower with five children and lives in Oroquieta. He is a hardworking father who has strong determination to pursue his goals for the benefit of his family.

To earn a living, Agapito manages his rice farm. He also engages in trading "palay" (rice prior to husking) and selling rice. He mastered these types of activities to support his family's needs. 

He joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in February of 2009.  He is thankful to PMPC as he has been able to improve his living conditions, especially his house renovation.

He has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase production on his rice farm and to pay for sacks of palay to sell. This will help him increase his income and provide his children with a good and decent life. 

Someday, he hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of his produce.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase production on his rice farm and to buy sacks of "palay" to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 38 years old and lives in Lusot, Baliangao, Philippines. She is married with one child. Jennifer has a coco land as her primary source of income. She realized that the income of their coco land is not enough to support their daily needs.  

She requested a loan to buy eight piglets and four sacks of feeds and materials for a pig fence as another source of income. Jennifer has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jennifer hopes to increase her income and bless her piggery someday.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and materials for a pig fence

loans.name: Porferial

texts.en:
Porferial, a 47-year-old married mother of six children, three of whom are still in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For five years she has been operating a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Porferial has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Simoun's Group

texts.en:
Simoun, 45, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province.  She has two children and grows rice and sesame on two hectares area. She earns additional income working for others for a fee. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a 2-member group and will spend her loan portion to buy seed and pay the plowing fee. 

She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seed and pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 49 years old, married, and has four children, two attend school.

She has grown  rice for 8 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to pay the laborers' salaries. 

She has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea is a 32-year-old mother with two school-aged children living in Kratie province. 

She grows cassava as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This is her second cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her  loan. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava farm. She hopes that the yield is more than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava farm.

loans.name: Samet's Group

texts.en:
Samet is a 49-year-old  mother with five children living in Steung Treng province. 

She grows rice  and fishes to earn a living. She also raises pigs and chickens to earn extra income. 

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid  her previous loan. She leads a 2-member group. 

She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and  piglets. She hopes that she can earn more income and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and piglets.

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Sieam Bouk District

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam works hard to support her family. Meriam is married and has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of dried fish to sell.

Meriam has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Meriam would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Famille Talisa Group

texts.fr: A l'âge de 18 ans, Marc s'est lancé dans la culture du café après constat des efforts fournis par sa mère pour le faire scolariser grâce aux revenus de cette activité. Actuellement, Marc s'autoprend en charge dans ses études universitaires et espère augmenter d'autres plantules dans l'espace encore disponible. Ce crédit lui sera utile dans différents travaux d'entretien de son champ; il est avec son épouse sur la photo.
texts.en: At the age of 18, Marc began to farm coffee after finishing school which was provided for by his mother, thanks to the revenue from this activity.  Currently, Marc is in charge of his university studies and hopes to grow other plants in the space on the field that is still free.  This loan will be useful in different work maintaining his field; he is with his wife in the photo.

loans.use: to maintain a field

loans.name: Kimsrun's Group

texts.en: Kimsrun, a resident living in Kampong Cham province, is 38 years old. TO help out her family, she sells grocery items as the single main source of her income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns her about 12,500 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to request a loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Davorn

texts.en:
Davorn is 22 years old, single  and a nursing student who is from Kandal province in Cambodia. He is pursuing an associate degree and is entering his third year at an institute in the city. 

His parents run a small business selling soup and drinks at home. Davorn does not have the funds to cover his university fees from the second to the third year and has decided to request a loan. This loan will help him have enough funds to earn an associate degree and learn important skills for his future job. 

In the future, he is going to find a job with a reasonable salary so he can help his parents.

loans.use: to cover his university fees.

loans.name: Felicita Del Transito

texts.es: Felicita de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesadillas con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando el techo en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero como no posee de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra y asi puedan vivir mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Felicita is 36 years old. She lives in her own home with her spouse. She works making and selling quesadillas. With the sales she completes she is able to cover some of the expenses generated by her household. Felicita wants to improve her home by placing a roof in the location shown in the photo, but she does not have sufficient capital. Because of this she is seeking a loan to purchase sheet metal, poles and to pay for manual labor to be able to live more securely and comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase sheet metal, poles and manual labor.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: Jose de 53 años de edad desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra su padre fue quien el enseño ese trabajo, por lo que se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol,  comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con su familia, vive con su esposa y su hijo, el  desea invertir en insumos para su cultivo ya que dentro de poco empieza la época de siembra, para ello solicita un crédito para invertir en la compra de fertilizante, herbicidas y abono para seguir con su cultivo con el que espera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Jose, 53, learned to work the land when he was very young; his father taught him how to farm.  This is why he works cultivating corn and beans.  He sells his products in the areas near the place where he lives, and with his sales he manages to get ahead with his family.  He lives with his wife and his son.  Jose wants to invest in supplies for his crops, because very shortly the harvest season will begin.  To do this, he is requesting a loan to buy chemical and organic fertilizers and herbicides so that he can continue cultivating his crops.  With his harvest, he hopes to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Mavjudakhon

texts.ru:
Мавчудахон проживает на районе Рудаки вблизи города Душанбе. Ей 42 года. Она замужем за трудового мигранта и сейчас ее муж тоже находится на заработках заграницей. У нее в браке двое детей. Сыну 27 лет, дочке 25 лет. 
2 года назад, Мавчудахон решила начать зарабатывать и совмещать полезное с приятным. Она начала шить и принимать заказы на шитье женской одежды. Мавчудахон умела шить, она научилась этому ремеслу у своей матери и сейчас примеряет на дело все навыки. Мавчудахон работает дома и принимает клиенток на дому. 
  Мачудахон давно мечтала отремонтировать дом и принести его в порядок. Она собрала сбережение, но ей не хватает еще $250. Для нее это большие деньги. Мавчудахон надеется, что Вы сейчас ее поддержите. Она без опозданий и задержек погасит кредит, и заранее благодарит Вас за помощь.
texts.en:
Mavjudakhon lives in the Rudaki district located near Dushanbe.  She is 42 years old.  She is married to a migrant worker who is currently making a living abroad.  She has two children from her marriage: a son who is 27 years old and a daughter who is 25.

Two years ago, Mavjudakhon decided to start making some money by turning a favorite activity into a business.  She started to sew and to take orders to make women's clothes.  She already knew how to sew, having learned this activity from her mother.  She is now applying her skills on the job.  Mavjudakhon works from home and welcomes her customers at home.

Mavjudakhon has been dreaming about renovating and repairing her house for a long time.  After gathering her savings she still needs $250, which is a large sum of money for her.  She hopes that you will be able to support her.  She will repay her loan without any delay, and she thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and to renovate her house.

loans.name: Hou's Group

texts.en:
An older mother of five dependent children living in Battambang province, Hou is 63 years old. She earns income to improve her family’s living via growing beans and vegetables. For Hou, this is her eighth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. 

She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farm. She hopes that she can get more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farm.

loans.name: Narcesta

texts.en:
Narcesta is 43 years old and single. She works very hard to help her parents.

She runs a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Narcesta has been in this business for eight years. 

In the future, Narcesta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ritchell

texts.en:
Ritchell works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other materials for her business. Ritchell has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Ritchell would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Keymah's Group

texts.en:
Keymah, 28, lives with family members in a village of the Kratie province. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school, and one is too young. She overcomes her family’s hardship via growing cassava on a 2-hectare area. Moreover, she can earn more income via working for others for a fee. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 41,100 KHR per day. 

In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee. She hopes that she can get more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana pertenece al banco comunal LA INMACULADA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Juana tiene 62 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este  negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder  seguir trabajando parea de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to a communal bank called La Inmaculada (Immaculate). It is located in the Kosnipata district in the province of Paucartambo, located within Cusco.

Juana is 62 years old and has three children. She is married. Her daily activities alternate depending on her agricultural business. She has dedicated many years to this business, which is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts in day after day. She wants to be able to continue working so she can keep supporting her family.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy seeds, among other things. She is very grateful for the loan, and promises to pay back each month according to the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other products.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 57-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her one child. Her husband has been running his own garment business for three years. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of garment items in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Shamim is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these garment items in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's garments business

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Carla works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Carla is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to  buy more fish and other materials for her business.

Carla has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her business

loans.name: Azmat

texts.en:
Azmat, age 45, is a mother of eight children. She has been running a business of her own embroidery work, which is the only source of income for the family. She needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell. However, due to lack of money, she finds it difficult. This will help her to offer more variety to her customers and to continue her work efficiently and professionally. For that, Azmat is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her family.

Azmat will purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials. Azmat is feeling happy that she will be able to be helped with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her embroidery business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal LA INMACULADA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Juliana tiene 39 años de edad y es  conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de kiosko escolar, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose   a este  negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia se dedica  a la venta de ropa, la socia desea poder  seguir trabajando parea de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra casacas.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Juliana belongs to a communal bank called La Inmaculada (Immaculate). The bank is located in the Kosnipata district, in the Paucartambo province, located within the city of Cusco.

Juliana is 39 years old and is married. Her daily activities are always changing with her kiosk near the school. She has dedicated a lot of time to her business, which is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts in day after day. She is currently making a living selling clothing; she hopes to continue working in this way so she can support her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy coats. She is very grateful for the loan, and promises to pay back on the established timeframe.

loans.use: to purchase coats.

loans.name: Sreysros

texts.en:
Sreysros is 24 years old, and a single student who is pursuing a bachelors degree, majoring in veterinary medicine at a university in the city. She is from a family with a father and three children living in the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. She is motherless and her father is a rice farmer. 

Sreysros doesn’t have enough finances to cover her university fees from the second to the fourth year, so she would like to request a loan. With the loan, she will be able to graduate successfully with skills to build her future. After graduation, she dreams of working in a company with a decent salary and of saving money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to cover her university fees.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cecelia is 50 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Cecelia has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Cecelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt and other materials for her business.

Cecelia has been in this business for 18 years and earns additional income from food vending. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt and other materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a kitchen and a shed for his firewood.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a person who has had to go through a lot of adversities in life. Nonetheless, she has always had the strength to overcome them and get ahead with her children. 

Teresia is a smallholder farmer from Kerugoya, in the central region of Kenya. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. She keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She has two years of experience in farming. 

Teresia is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. 

Loans for smallholder farmers with little, irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations like Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Teresia. 

Through a group of 10 members called Songa Mbele, Teresia has access to loans from Juhudi Kilimo for income-generating assets. These loans use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Teresia, because the institution believes that women, too, are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farming.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly because of which her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.
 
Therefore, Asma has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Asma is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina, a 45-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is still in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has been operating a dried fish-making business in the Philippines for five years.

Cristina has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and other products for her business. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other products for her business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a widowed woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristina is 48 years old and has five children who are in school. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Cristina has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sugar, coconut etc. to use in her business. She has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coconut etc. to use in her business.

loans.name: Aide

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal LA INMACULADA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Aide tiene 50 años de edad es  casada y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose   a este  negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder  seguir trabajando parea de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank that is titled La Inmaculada. The bank is located in the Kosnipata district, within the province of Paucartambo, which is located in Cusco.

Aide is 50 years old and is married with three children. Her activities change daily depending on her grocery store business. She has dedicated a lot of time to this business, which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in day after day. She hopes to continue working in this way so she can keep supporting her family.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy rice, sugar, and milk, among other things. She is extremely grateful for the loan, and promises to comply with the established timeframe for paying it back.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and milk, among other things.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal LA INMACULADA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Anastacia continua con su  negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia continua vendiendo diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to a communal bank which is called La Inmaculada. The bank is located in the district of Kosnipata, in the province of Paucartambo, which is located in Cusco. 

Anastacia works in grocery store sales; she sells different types of products, such as rice, sugar, and milk, among others. She is grateful for the loan, which will be used to buy milk and sugar, among other things, and promises to pay back in the established timeframe. She is very responsible and earnest, which is why she is the one working to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy milk and sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Koleti

texts.en:
Koleti is a 39-year-old with three children. She operates a business selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Koleti has requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2013 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his income by investing in his store with the loan to help hie family.

loans.name: Martha Cerafina

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal LA INMACULADA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Martha Cerafina tiene 34 años de edad es  conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose   a este  negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder  seguir trabajando parea de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to a communal bank called La Inmaculada. The bank is located in the district of Kosnipata, in the province of Paucartambo, which is located within the city of Cusco.

Martha Cerafina is 34 years old and married. She alternates her daily activities depending on her agricultural business. She is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts in to her business day after day. She would like to continue working in this way so that she can support her family.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the established payback timeframe.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal LA INMACULADA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Rosa Elena tiene 37 años de edad es  conviviente  y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose   a este  negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder  seguir trabajando parea de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to a communal bank called La Inmaculada. The bank is located in the Kosnipata district, in the province of Paucartambo, which is located in Cusco.

Rosa Elena is 37 years old and is married with two children. Her daily activities change daily, depending on what she is doing for her agricultural business. Her business is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts in day after day. She hopes to continue performing this work in order to keep supporting her family.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer. She feels very grateful for the loan, and promises to pay back in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal LA INMACULADA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Adela  tiene 56 años de edad es  conviviente  y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose   a este  negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder  seguir trabajando parea de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to a communal bank called La Inmaculada. The bank is located in the district of Kosnipata, in the province of Paucartambo, which is located within the city of Cusco.

Adela is 56 years old, and is married with three children. She alternates her daily activities depending on her agricultural business. She is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts in to her business day after day. She would like to continue working in this way so that she can support her family.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the established payback timeframe.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elma is 27 years old.

Elma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell in her food stall.

Elma has been in this business for one year. In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 65-year-old married woman with six children (one child is still in school). She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elena has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Elena requested a 6,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more fish and other materials to be used for her business. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials to be used for her business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emma is 48 years old and three of her children are in school.

Emma has a fishing business in the Philippines. Emma has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials needed for her business.

Emma has been in this business for one year. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a widowed woman, and 64 years old with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. 

Jessica has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish, and sacks of salt and other supplies to make dried fish. Jessica has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, and sacks of salt and other supplies to make dried fish.

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en:
Genevie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bread production business.

Genevie has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns more income from fruit vending. Genevie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bread production business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has two children who are presently in school. Delia has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business like meat, fish, flour, spices, etc. Delia has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business like meat, fish, flour, spices, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She is 51 years old and has one child in school. Edna has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Edna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Edna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 10 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. He needs to make maintenance of his taxi, because the current condition of it is not good.  It requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Rizwana has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Rizwana's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Rizwana also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income, to meet her family's needs in the future.  She is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 33-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past ten years. Her husband is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Lubna's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g., rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items, for his business. But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all these products for reselling. 

Therefore, Lubna has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also help him to earn maximum profitable income to manage the household and business. 

Lubna is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business

loans.name: Pheakdey

texts.en: Pheakdey is a 33-year-old single factory worker who resides in the Kandal province in Cambodia. She has been working in the factory for over four years, making a daily income of 5 USD. Pheakdey would like a motorcycle for commuting to work but she lacks the finances, so she needs a loan. With this loan, she will have enough money to buy a motorcycle and have better traveling conditions. In the future, she wants to run a small grocery store at home and save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is a 29-year-old, single blacksmith who lives in Kandal Province in Cambodia. He has been working as a blacksmith for over four years, earning approximately USD 6.66 each day. Sokha needs more money to buy metal to make windows, doors and handrails to sell, therefore he would like to request a loan. 

This loan will help him to improve his business. In the future, he hopes to have enough money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to buy metal to make windows, doors and handrails to sell.

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LUZ DEL SUR, él socio sigue  dedicándose a trabajar como plomero y  en construcciones, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas para su trabajo.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the LUZ DEL SUR communal bank. He continues to work as a plumber and and in construction. He is grateful for the loan he has been given and committed to making his payments. He is a responsible and hardworking person and this is how he gets his family ahead.

He is asking for the loan to buy tools for his work.

loans.use: to buy tools for his work.

loans.name: Thuok

texts.en:
Thuok, 45, lives in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has two children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business. On her small farmland, she primarily grows rice, and she sells her agricultural product to local dealers and customers at the market. She has been in this type of business around 30 years.

On average, she is able to earn 2 USD a day. Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is a 51-year-old mother, who owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cake, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for over a year. Mele has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profits to build a small bakery store in the near future. Mele joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom is 28 years old, a married factory worker with a dependent child. She is from the Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She has worked as a factory worker in a nearby province since 2010. Her husband is a 24-year-old factory worker. She and her husband can make around $10 per day.

Sreymom also wants to cultivate rice when she is free from her factory work, so she needs a loan to buy farmland. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to buy farmland and earn rice crops to support the family. In the future, she is going to build a bathroom with a toilet and support her child's higher education.

loans.use: to buy farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Gerlyn

texts.en:
Gerlyn is 29 years of age, married and blessed with three children. She offers a variety of vegetables for sale within her local community. She also engages in farming and hog raising. Her husband works as a farmer within their locality.

The couple would like to increase their income so they can sustain their family's basic necessities and maintain their other business involvements.To make her dreams possible, Gerlyn is asking for a loan of PHP5,000. She will use this loan to buy a variety of vegetables, such as onions, papaya, eggplant, tomatoes and string beans. She knows that through this loan, she can continue to improve her income and have a better way of living someday.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables, such as onions, papaya, eggplant, tomatoes and string beans, to sell.

loans.name: Alcerie

texts.en:
Alcerie has mastered her hog raising business in Siquijor. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. 

Just as she takes care with her hog raising business, so with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. Now a loan of 6,500 Philippine pesos will help her build a concrete pigpen that will support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build a concrete pigpen

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Estrella is 50 years old.

Estrella has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Estrella has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her stall.

Estrella has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Estelita has a sewing business in the Philippines. Estelita has requested a 14,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric and thread for her business.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Estelita has been in this business for 37 years. Estelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric and thread for her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell to her customers.

Helen has been in this business for 26 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 45 years old and married with three children. Lerma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns income from buying and selling firewood.

Lerma has borrowed and repaid one loan from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) before this loan. She has requested a 7,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store, such as canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries. Lerma hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, such as canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha, a farmer living in Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province, is 30 years old and the mother of two children. Both of her children are dependent on her and they are too young to study. For her living, she grows cassava and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has been in this business for 12 years. The current business earns her family about 20,800 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

This is Tha’s fifth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. As the group leader of four members, she will spend her entire loan portion to plow the field, and to buy pesticide, fertilizer and seeds to support her business. She hopes that she can earn more income and support her children to study until they graduate from high school.

loans.use: to plow the field, and to buy pesticide, fertilizer and seeds to support her business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Flora is 33 years old and her children are in school.

Flora has a water-refiling station business in the Philippines. Flora requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy water bottles to use in her business.

Flora has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Flora would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy water bottles to use in her business.

loans.name: Grupo Chuacruz Sector Betel Aldea Xojola Group

texts.es:
Telma(la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía de blusa rosada) una joven de apenas  26 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Telma para generar sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica en una plaza de su comunidad desde hace 5 años.
Telma es una joven con sueños y metas, pues ella ahora ha decidido mejorar su negocio, pues se ha dado cuenta que ahora el mundo está más de moda espor ello que hay que contar con mercaderías nuevos, pero lamentablemente  ella no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder realizar esta inversión, por esa razón se ha unido a un grupo de mujeres para solicitar un crédito que lo utilizara para comprar güpiles, fajas cortes para luego venderlos a un buen precio.
Telma tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito, para hacer de su negocio algo más grande.
texts.en:
Telma (on the right side of the photo in the pink shirt) is a 26-year-old woman. She lives with her parents in the city of Sololá.
Telma has bought and sold typical clothing in her city's plaza to generate earnings and support her parents for five years. Telma is a young woman with dreams and goals. She has decided to improve her business. She has realized that now the world is more fashionable. She needs new merchandise but, unfortunately, she does not have enough money to make this investment. This is the reason she has joined a women's group to request a loan to purchase undergarments to sell at a good price. 
Telma hopes to obtain the loan in order to make her business bigger.

loans.use: purchase and sell typical clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy and sell corn.

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is a 39-year-old mother with six children. She runs a small business selling toasted tuna sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Malo has requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of fish [canned tuna], plastic bags, containers, butter, and mayonnaise to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. Malo became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of fish [canned tuna], plastic bags, containers, butter, and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Taofo

texts.en:
Taofo is a 48-year-old mother with eight children. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Taofo has  requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a fry pan to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. Taofo  joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a fry pan

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Judith, ella pertenece al banco “LUZ DEL SUR” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia sigue con su negocio de fabricación y mantenimiento de equipos de refrigeración, la socia Judith está muy agradecida con KIVA por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de materiales como pintura.
texts.en: Judith is a member of the "Luz Del Sur" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Judith continues to work in her business manufacturing and repairing refrigeration equipment.  Judith is very grateful for Kiva and the loans she has received.  She is committed to making her payments on time.  Judith is a responsible and determined woman, which is how she has been able to get her family ahead. Judith is requesting this loan to purchase materials such as paint.

loans.use: purchase materials such as paint.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is a Kiva borrower. He has two children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. His business goal is to own a large grocery store within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a married man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells movies. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more movies. This is his second  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more movies

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is married, with two children. She describes herself as being honest. 

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and grows coffee. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place. 

She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. 

This is her second  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy farm inputs for her dairy farm and coffee plantings

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 59 years old now.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a 35-year-old woman with five children (three of whom are in school). She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Letecia has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. 

Letecia requested a 5,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy materials needed, such as bamboo leaves, etc. In the future, Letecia  would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her mat weaving business, such as bamboo leaves, etc.

loans.name: Laylani

texts.en:
As a married parent, Laylani works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Laylani is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers for her buy and sell ready to wear business.

Laylani has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Godafreda

texts.en:
Godafreda is 53 years old and married with four children. Godafreda works very hard to provide for them.

Godafreda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, coffee, home-care products and other groceries.

Godafreda has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Godafreda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, coffee, home-care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 24 years old and married, with two children, one of them in school. 

Lorena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lorena has been in this business for a year now, and she has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Hello, world, meet Lily!  Lily is a hardworking small-holder farmer in Litein, a rural town in the tea-growing region of Kenya. 

For the past 15 years of her life, Lily has been doing mixed farming. This has worked out well for her.  She has been able to provide a decent living for her family. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. 

Lily is seeking a loan to construct a dairy shed. This will provide shelter for her favorite animal. The thing she enjoys most about dairy farming is selling milk. However, in order for a dairy cow to be more productive, the farmer needs to be good at dairy management. 

Your loan will help Lily construct a cowshed that will help very much with dairy management. The shelter will enable her to prepare food rations and feed the cow. The shed will ensure that the cow is always in a clean and hygenic environment. 

Your loan will bring untold benefits to Lily. She is projecting a significant increase in milk production. The extra money will go to loan repayment and her children’s education. Her dream is for her children to live a better life, with basic needs fulfilled.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre seis y nueve años, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Domingo un hombre trabajador y honrado que para sostener a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de almacigo de café, esta labor lo realiza desde hace  ocho años él cuenta que gracias a esta labor ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
