Domingo ahora ha pensado en mejorar sus ingresos cultivando banano y café, pero para poder hacerlo necesita de un terreno, terreno con el que él no cuenta es este momento, por lo que ha considerado comprar un terreno, pero lamentablemente él no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder realizar esta compra  por lo que solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar un terreno para cultivo.
Domingo sueña con poder construir una casa de block, para darle a su familia una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Domingo is  29 years old, married, and is a parent. He has  a beautiful family of two children with ages between six and nine years old. They live in a community in Sololá department.

Domingo  is an honest, hard-working man who to support his family is engaged in the buying and selling of coffee seedlings.  He has been doing this work  for eight years, and says that thanks to it he has managed to help his family get ahead in life.

Now Domingo has thought of improving his income by growing bananas and coffee, but to be able to do it he needs a piece of land, land he does not have at this time. Therefore he has considered buying a piece of land, but unfortunately does not have sufficient money to undertake this purchase, so he is requesting a loan that he will use to buy a piece of farmland. Domingo dreams of being able to build a cement block house so that he can provide his family with greater comfort.

loans.use: To buy land for growing bananas and coffee.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been running a business of cloth trade from many years to support her family as her husband income is not enough to provide his family alone. Therefore she decided to start her business. 

She purchases different variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her community. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Safia has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of cloth in different colors and styles by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cloth in different colors and styles by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers

loans.name: Meipo

texts.en:
Meipo is a 53-year-old mother with ten children and has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a  year. 

Meipo has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots to assist her run the business. Meipo hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots

loans.name: Arminda

texts.pt:
A Sra. Arminda de 28   anos de idade solteira mae de 3 filhos 2  estao a frequentar a escola o ensino primario e 1 ainda è menor de idade para frequentar a escola, sustenta seu irmao mais novo. Ela è Operario Agricola na empresa de producao de banana, actividade que esta a exercer a mais de 3 anos e è tambem negociante informal de vestuario, actividade que esta a ser acompanhada com seu marido.
O presente emprestimo sera aplicado na compra de material de construcao (cimento, blocos, barrotes e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Arminda is 28 years old, single and the mother of three children; two go to primary school and one is still too young for school. She also supports her younger brother. 

For more than three years Arminda has been a farmhand for a company that produces bananas. She also works casually selling clothes and is accompanied in this job by her husband.

This loan will be used to buy construction materials (cement, blocks and beams) and pay for labourers so that Arminda can continue the construction work on her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, blocks and beams) and pay for labourers

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El socio David pertenece al banco comunal  “LUZ DEL SUR”,el socio sigue  dedicándose  al negocio de carpintería de estructuras metálicas, el socio se siente agradecido  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio continua haciendo ventanas, puertas entre otros, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar soldadores entre otros.
texts.en:
The member, David, belongs to the "Luz del Sur" communal bank. He continues working in his business doing carpentry work and building metal structures. He is grateful for the loan and promises to make his installment payments. 

The borrower is a responsible and hard-working person.  He continues making windows, doors and other products, as this is how he is supporting his family.

He is requesting the loan to buy welding supplies and other items.

loans.use: To buy welding supplies and other items.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia Antonia pertenece al banco comunal “LUZ DEL SUR” ,la socia continua  dedicándose  al negocio de venta de accesorios de cocina como hornillas y repuestos  para cocinas,  la socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar repuestos .
texts.en:
The member, Antonia, belongs to the “Luz del Sur" communal bank. She continues to work in her business selling kitchen accessories such as burners and spare parts for stoves. 

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her instalment payments. She is a responsible and hard-working person, as this is how she is supporting her family.

The borrower is requesting the loan in order to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a favorable area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more vegetables and cereals. Her business goal is to open a wholesale business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and cereals.

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en:
Silvester is a married man. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. 

He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in weather conditions. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married, with five children. She describes herself as being humble and generous. 

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. Her business is located in an area favorable for her business, and her primary customers are locals. 

Sarah says her biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and seeds. 

Her business goal is to buy at least three cows within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a good lifestyle. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and seeds

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 29 years of age, married, and has been blessed with three children.The couple both work hard in order to earn a living.

Evelyn manages her buy and sell vegetable business while her husband cultivates their farming business. She aims to increase her generated income, educate her children,  and get ahead in life.This time she would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 5,000.This amount will be use in buying eggplants, tomatoes, baguio beans, and string beans.She knows that having this amount will enable her to obtain her goal in life.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, tomatoes, baguio beans, and string beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new camera

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be experienced. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. 

She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 99,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to be a successful entreprenuer within 5 years. This is her seventh loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 32 years old, married,  and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilibeth has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been doing the business of tailoring for seven years with her daughter to support their family. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet all the expenses of their household. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well.

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Now she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, laces, and zips, etc. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand of her customers. Farzana hopes to grow her business by providing good stitching facility to her customers through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, laces, and zips, etc., to meet the increasing demand of her customers

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 41 years old and married. She is happily doing the business of shoemaking with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. 

They make shoes beautifully in different colors, designs and various sizes at home and then sell them in the local market at reasonable prices. By this time, they have attained a regular list of customers and make enough income to fulfill the basic necessities of their family. 

To cope up with the increasing demand of their customers, Parveen has requested for a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy leather material and plastic soles and heels in different sizes, together with more spools of threads in various colors to increase their production. 

In this way they can handle the growing demand for their shoes in the market and hence better support their family.

loans.use: to buy leather material, plastic soles and heels, and spools of threads in various colors to increase their shoe production.

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en:
Rose Ann is a 25-year-old woman with one child who attends school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rose Ann has a bakery business in the Philippines. Rose Ann has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy flour and sugar to use in her business.

Rose Ann has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rose Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar to use in her business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 43-year-old widowed woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. She has eight years of experience in this field. Her son purchases stocks of goods from the market and deals with the customers' visits at their shop.

Fatima is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow their business, so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, sugar, flour, beverages, etc., to meet the increasing demand in their store. She is expecting a boost in their earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, sugar, flour, beverages, etc., to meet the increasing demand in their store.

loans.name: Hilda Roxana

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer de 24 años de edad es casada, tiene un lindo hijo de 2 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Hilda es una mujer muy trabajadora, para que a su familia no le haga falta nada se dedica a lavar ropa con distintas familias de su comunidad esta actividad  lo realiza ella desde hace 1 año, pera ella desde hace algún tiempo se ha puesto a ver las necesidades de la familia y una de ellas es la compra de un terreno, pero una de las dificultades que Hilda tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para cumplir sus sueños, por tal motivo ella solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá para la compra de un terreno.
El gran anhelo de Hilda es comprar el terreno para luego construir su casa.
texts.en:
Hilda is a 24-year-old woman. She is married, has an adorable two-year-old, and lives in the community of Suchitepéquez.

Hilda is a very hardworking woman. She works washing clothes with other families in her community so that her family to keep her family from lacking what they need. She has done this activity for a year. For some time, the family has needed to purchase land but one of the difficulties that Hilda faces is that she does not have enough money of fulfill her dreams. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that will be invested in the purchase of land.

Hilda has a great longing to buy the land and then build a house.

loans.use: to purchase land to build a home

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el joven vive en casa propia con su madre, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ganado para engordar y así poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man whose face is pixelated is 23 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He has been raising cattle for several years. He sells his products in the surrounding areas near where he resides. The borrower lives in his own home along with his mother.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy cattle for fattening. As a result, he will be able to continue his work since this is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta is 22 years old and has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a  year. 

Ruta has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots to assist her run the business. Ruta hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda is 28 years old. She runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches and toast sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Elda has requested for a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of fish (canned tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter, and mayonnaise to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. Elda became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of fish (canned tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter, and mayonnaise

loans.name: Flora Virginia

texts.es:
La socia  Es la señora Flora Virginia, ella pertenece al banco “LUZ DEL SUR” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
La socia sigue dedicándose a la docencia universitaria, la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia continua ejerciendo su profesión el cual le va bien, siendo de esta forma que la socia puede continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia está solicitando el préstamo para comprar un electrodoméstico.
texts.en:
The member is Flora Virginia, who belongs to the "Luz del Sur" communal bank in the city of Cusco - Peru.

She is continuing her work teaching at the university.  She is very grateful to Kiva and promises to make her installment payments.

She wishes to be able to keep working, in order to in this way continue supporting her family.

The borrower is applying for the loan in order to purchase a home appliance.

loans.use: To buy a home appliance.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en: Mupa is a Kiva borrower. She has three children, and she describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells mangoes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as price fluctuations. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of mangoes. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mangoes

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is married, with four children. She describes herself as social. 

She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. 

Ann says her biggest business challenge is price fluctuations. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of shoes to sell. 

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her third  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to open other business branches.

loans.use: buy more stocks of shoes to sell

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jacinta is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks like soft drinks, cereals, coffee, beer, milk, vinegar, etc., to sell.

Jacinta has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like soft drinks, cereals, coffee, beer, milk, vinegar, etc., to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is in her early 40's and is from Litein, Kenya, a community not known for farming, but she has been earning well through agriculture. She is a young farmer practicing mixed farming. For the past ten years, her primary source of income has been milk, maize, and a variety of crops she plants. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has in farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to Hellen's heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she earns profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit. Therefore, Hellen requested a loan, which she will use to build a modern dairy unit. A dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also protects them from diseases that may arise because of exposure to harsh weather conditions. 

Hellen believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 28 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Jovelyn has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from folding bed making.

Jovelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tehmina

texts.en:
Tehmina is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a Suzuki motorcycle for four years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. He needs to maintain his Suzuki because the current condition of his bike is not good, and it requires maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to maintain his Suzuki. Therefore Tehmina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Tehmina's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and provide better transport facilities to earn a more profitable income. Tehmina also plans to save her husband's income profit amount to meet her family's needs in the future.

Tehmina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: repair her husband's Suzuki motorcycle.

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making artificial jewelry for many years with the help of her husband (who is also shown in the photo). The business has great potential for growth and Sonya is actively participating, as this business is the only source of income for them. 

They have five children, but none of them are going to school. The couple wishes to send their children to school by increasing their earnings to to be able to pay for the educational expenses. In order to meet all orders on time and boost their sales, Sonya has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase raw materials such as silver, gold, and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. They hope to increase their net income and want to expand their business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls

loans.name: John Alonso

texts.es:
John junto con su socio están buscando progresar esa palabra clave en la que se han enfocado para salir adelante, sacar su negocio de venta de alimentos de panadería los cuales fabrican, empacan y distribuyen ellos mismo, en la foto lo podemos ver junto con su socio con algunos de los productos que fabrican los cuales distribuyen en supermercados y tiendas y su idea es llegar a grandes almacenes de cadena.
Para realizar esta actividad fue necesario tomar clases, seguir requerimientos, normatividad para llegar a distribuir y tiene una meta que para este final de año tener sus productos en grandes almacenes de cadena.
 
John por el momento presenta una necesidad que quiere solventar con la ayuda de un préstamo y son las siguientes:
•	Comprar una mesa de trabajo para la panadería
•	Disponer de capital de trabajo para la compra de insumos
Apoya a este empresario en el cumplimiento de sus sueños, quiere progresar y demostrar que su empresa está para grandes cosas.
texts.en:
John and his business partner are looking to make progress, the key word that they have focused on in order to move forward. They have a business of selling baked goods that they make themselves. In addition, they package and distribute these products. The photo shows John and his partner with some of the products that they make and distribute to supermarkets and stores. Their idea is to appear in large retail chains.

John has taken classes in order to operate the business. He learned how to follow requirements and regulations for distribution. His goal for the end of the year is to have his products in large chain stores.

At the moment, John needs the help of a loan in order to do the following: to purchase a worktable for the bakery and to have available capital for buying supplies. Help this entrepreneur fulfill his dreams of making progress and demonstrating that his business can achieve great things.

loans.use: to buy a worktable for the bakery and to have available capital for acquiring supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to market her business and buy some equipment

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 62-year-old widow. She is mother of two children. After her husband's death, it was very tough for Razia to manage her household expenses. Therefore she decided to start her business of cloth trade. She buys cloth of different varieties from market at wholesale rates and then sells in her area. 

Now she is playing a very important role for her family. She wants to expand her business; therefore she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more varieties of cloth in different colors and designs by taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. She expects a boost in her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of cloth in different colors and designs by taking into account the taste and choice of her customers.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
Arshad is a 54-year-old married woman. She is doing the business of shoe making with her husband who is also shown in the photo. They make shoes in different colors, designs and various sizes at home, and then sell them in the local market at reasonable prices. 

By this time, they have attained a regular list of customers and make enough income to fulfill basic necessities of their family including their five children. To meet with the increasing demand of their customers, Arshad has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase leather material, plastic soles and heels in different sizes with more spools of threads in various colors to increase their production. They hope that it will increase their sales and helps to expand their business.

loans.use: to purchase leather material, plastic soles, and heels in different sizes with more spools of threads in various colors

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es:
La socia Luz Marina pertenece al banco comunal  CHASKA ÑAHUI,la socia continua  dedicando al negocio de consultorio médico, ella es cesante de enfermería y junto con su esposo trabajan, la socia está feliz con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para implementar su consultorio.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the Communal Bank “Chaska Ñahui”. She continues to operate her medical clinic. Luz is an unemployed nurse and works with her husband. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments. Luz has been in this business for quite some time and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. Working in this manner allows her family to get ahead.

Luz Marina is requesting a loan in order to keep her clinic in operation.

loans.use: to keep her clinic in operation.

loans.name: Emprendamos El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea, la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo  diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar azúcar, leche entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de librería, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
Las personas mayores de 65 años de edad  están excluidas del sistema financiero formal y gracias a los inversionistas de Kiva pueden lograr su financiamiento de tal manera la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO” communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Andrea continues with her grocery store business. She is a responsible and persevering person. She continues to sell different kinds of products like rice, sugar, milk and sweets, amongst others to all her clients when they want them. This is the way she gets her family ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy sugar and milk amongst others.

The other members work at their businesses: a bookstore, selling clothing, a grocery store and a restaurant. The person with the face blanked out does not belong to the communal bank. People over 65 are excluded from the formal financial system and thanks to the lenders at Kiva they can access loans. As such the member promises to pay the installments of her loan within the given time-frame.

loans.use: to buy sugar and milk amongst others.

loans.name: Saraphina

texts.en: Saraphina is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in climate. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a cooking oven for family use. Her business goal is to be a supplier of milk within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her lifestyle. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a cooking oven

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as smart. He operates a restaurant. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm equipment, seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest.

Henry operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a favourable place, and his primary customers are individuals.

Henry will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.
